Agatha scoffed. “Billy ought to be. I paid for his first lot of guitar lessons, remember?”
Wanda hummed. “You bought him that guitar too.”
Agatha thought back to Billy’s thirteenth birthday.

Agatha and Wanda had been together nearly a year and had been talking about Agatha moving in with her and Billy for a few months. But they had agreed that they’d wait until after Billy’s birthday so as not to overshadow the day for him. Billy had been talking Wanda’s ear off about wanting to learn to play guitar ever since the three of them had watched School of Rock towards the end of the previous year, and Wanda had told him that if he still wanted to learn by his birthday then she would get him lessons as a late birthday present.

In February, about a month before his birthday, Agatha had convinced Wanda to let her buy Billy the guitar lessons for his birthday. They did their research and found a local guitar teacher with good reviews and Agatha paid for ten lessons up front to start on the weekend a week after his birthday. She also bought him a pack of guitar picks in a range of thicknesses and a capo to get him started. Since the instructor had guitars for the students to use, they had decided to hold off on buying him an actual guitar until they were sure that it was something he would actually stick at.

Agatha designed and printed an A4 certificate saying “Congratulations! You are now the owner of 10 weekly guitar lessons starting on the 16th of March 2019!” She put it in an envelope and put the envelope in a box, along with the plectrums and capo, which she wrapped and gave to him.
He nearly cried with happiness when he opened it and pulled her into a tight hug saying, “I’m so glad my mum asked you out.”
Agatha and Wanda laughed, both taking turns to ruffle his hair once he pulled away from the hug.
Wanda said, “You should thank Agatha for saying yes.” She pressed a quick kiss to Agatha’s lips before continuing. “Okay, go get dressed. You still have to go to school.”
Billy dramatically rolled his eyes. “It should be illegal to have to go to school on your birthday.” But he got up off the couch and went upstairs all the same.
Agatha chuckled. “I know kid, they’re monsters.”

When Billy was safely upstairs, Wanda kissed Agatha again. This time it was deeper and more passionate. “For the record,” Wanda started, slightly breathless, “I’m really glad I asked you out as well.”
Agatha pulled Wanda into her lap and brushed her hair behind her ear. “For the record, I’m really glad I said yes.”
They kissed again, quickly breaking apart and giving each other a look that said ‘we’ll continue this later’, when Billy started to come back downstairs.

__________

They were driving Billy to his final lesson of the ten that Agatha had bought and this was the fourth week in a row of Billy telling them that his instructor said that he should really have his own guitar so that he could practise between his lessons.
Wanda said, “I’ll think about it,” like she always did and they both told him to have fun before driving back home.

“Have you?” Agatha asked, looking at Wanda briefly before making sure her eyes were back on the road.
“Have I what?”
“Thought about it?”
Wanda sighed. “I have and I’ve done some looking online. It’s very expensive to just get him the basics. The guitar, a case, a strap, a stand, an amp, cables, extra strings. And then there’s the fact that he’ll probably want a bunch of effects pedals as well.”
“What has his dad said about it?” Agatha asked.

Agatha had only met Vision a handful of times when he’d come to pick Billy up for weekends at his or the days out that they’d planned, but he seemed like a nice guy and a decent parent considering he and Wanda were divorced. Billy enjoyed the time he spent with his dad and that’s all that mattered to Agatha. If that ever changed, however, she was ready to fight for Billy’s independence from him.
Wanda had started discussing more things about Billy with Agatha since she had moved in but as it stood right now, Vision and Wanda were still the main decision makers in Billy’s life.

Wanda ran a hand through her hair. “He said the same thing and that it’s only just been Billy’s birthday and Christmas is a while away.”
Agatha thought about it. The kid seemed to be working hard and really enjoying his lessons. He was getting good marks at school and was well behaved, never in trouble barring the odd teenage-hormone fuelled outburst.
She put care into how she phrased the next thing she said, speaking cautiously so that she didn’t overstep any boundaries. “We could leave the choice up to Billy as to whether he wanted it to count as an early Christmas present, or whether he’d rather wait. But what if I bought him the guitar and the rest was split between you and Vision? The effects pedals can come later, but this would cover the basics for him.” She remained facing forwards, focussing on her parking out of fear of seeing a look of disgust or disapproval on Wanda’s face.

When she had finished her parallel parking, she chanced a look over at Wanda. But what she saw wasn’t disapproval or disgust. Wanda looked… sad?
No wait, she was smiling. Those were happy tears filling her eyes.
“You would do that for him?” Wanda asked, voice shaky.
Agatha cupped her face, wiping away a tear that had dropped with her thumb. “Of course I would, my love. He’s as much my family as he is yours.”
Wanda leaned in and kissed her. “I love you.”
“I love you too.”

It was moments like these with Billy and Wanda that allowed Agatha to feel like she could be good, that she had something to offer other than misery. That she was worthy of happiness.

***

Rio was glad that she’d taken her jacket off and given it to Agatha because just that one song had made her start sweating. She pushed her hair behind her shoulders in the time they had whilst Eddie changed to his acoustic guitar. They had dedicated some rehearsal time to planning out how they would transition between songs to make sure there wasn’t a bunch of silence whilst Eddie swapped guitars for a couple of songs. They had even timed themselves to get the time that it took as low as they could. Too many bands suffered from stage death because they hadn’t had this foresight.

When Eddie was ready they went straight into the next song. Since it was more simple for her, Rio found herself looking back at Agatha. Agatha was watching Billy but she was too far away for Rio to make out her expression. She did notice Agatha’s mouth moving slightly in time with the words. Rio smiled at the fact that Agatha was singing along and her eyes moved to Wanda, who was watching her. Rio didn’t need to be able to properly see Wanda’s face to know what it looked like. She had seen that look from Wanda many times. It was a look that told Rio that there was only a limited amount of time that she would be staying clothed for.

Usually that look would have brought Rio to her knees, in more ways than one. But tonight it wasn’t having an effect on her. She wasn’t interested in Wanda right now. She was interested in the woman sitting next to her. She brought her attention back to the drums as she did a fill and then it went to Agatha again.
Agatha was looking at her now, still too far away to read her features, but she was definitely watching her.
It was probably innocent, the whole room was looking at them, but just knowing that Agatha was watching her made a heat settle low in her stomach.
“Focus Vidal,” she muttered to herself. “We’re only on the second song.”
She was thankful that she was sitting behind the wall of sound that the band were creating and nobody could hear her talking to herself like a crazy person.

She didn’t look in Agatha’s direction again until the song had ended. It was the safest option given how her body was reacting. It wouldn’t be a problem if she didn’t still have seven songs to get through, but she didn’t exactly have the time to quickly run off and sort herself out right now.
Eddie addressed the room again as the applause died down. “Thank you! I hope we’re doing these songs justice for you. This next one is gonna require a little work from you guys so if you could get your phones out and put your torches on and wave them in time, that would be great!”
When he finished speaking, the lights in the room dimmed. They had asked during soundcheck if this could happen and were given “maybe” as an answer, so it was nice that it had.

Alice and Billy started the intro and there were some people who recognised it immediately, either smiling or rolling their eyes. Some people took until the chorus to catch on, but there was a sea of phone lights waving in the room nonetheless.

***

Both Agatha and Wanda recognised the song instantly. Agatha groaned whilst Wanda gave an excited gasp. Billy looked over and smiled at Wanda, knowing that this song was one of her favourites. He probably made sure this one was included because he knew it would make his mum happy. It was sweet, but it didn’t make the song any more listenable. At least it was someone else singing and not that awful Gallagher man, that was something.

Wanda had her phone in the air and was singing along. She had once asked Agatha if this song could be their first dance – which Agatha had immediately vetoed. She had dodged a bullet in that regard.
Wanda nudged her with her elbow and gestured to Agatha’s clutch then to her own phone. Agatha rolled her eyes and took a gulp of her wine. It was already half gone and it had to last the full set, but for this song, she needed it. She begrudgingly opened her bag and took her phone out, switching the torch on and holding it up like everyone else.

Agatha started to subconsciously sing along, only catching herself when the entire band dropped out after the guitar solo – which Billy did incredibly well – and let the audience sing the first line of the final chorus. She noticed Rio looking at her and laughing. Her disgust with herself for singing along to Oasis must have been evident.

The song finally ended – five minutes was an egregious amount of time for that song to last – and the lights came back up making Agatha blink at the readjustment. She turned her torch off and put her phone on the table. The singer was changing his guitar again whilst the others continued playing to fill the silence.
Agatha turned to Wanda who still had a sappy smile on her face. “How many guitars does Billy have now?”
Wanda seemed shocked that Agatha was speaking to her and took a moment to reply. “Oh, uh, he has four. The electric and acoustic ones that you know about, and he’s bought two more electric ones since then.” She nodded towards him. “That one’s still his favourite though. Something about the quality of the pickups or the style of the neck or something, I don’t really understand it but he seems to know what he’s talking about.”

Agatha smiled fondly, she missed hearing Billy talk to her about his guitars and music in general. He used to ask her to put a random song on and watch as he figured out how to play it by ear. He always had it down by the time the song was over and she’d put it on again so that he could play it from the top.
He had played and sang at her and Wanda’s engagement party. That had been the first – and last – time that she had actually seen him perform, apart from now. It also happened to be the last time that she had worn the dress that she had chosen for tonight. She wasn’t sure if she liked this coincidence yet.

The next song had started but Agatha wasn’t paying attention. She was finding herself enjoying this short walk down memory lane of her time with Billy. “Do you remember the weeks he spent learning that song from the end of School Of Rock?”
“Oh do I? If I never hear that song again, it’ll be too soon.”
They both laughed at the memory. “He was so proud when he called us into his room to watch him play it.” Agatha said.
“It’s still one of his favourite movies, he watches it at least once a month. At least he did before he moved onto campus, but I’m sure he’s kept it up.”
Agatha smiled. “I don’t think he’ll ever let that movie go, it showed him how cool being a rockstar could be.”

She turned her attention back to the band, more specifically, back to Rio. She was concentrating but still adding some flair to her playing, twirling her drumsticks between beats but never missing them. The whole band was a cohesive unit, interacting with each other and having fun. It made them enjoyable to watch.
On the lyric “long brown hair,” Agatha swore Rio looked at her. It was brief, but she was certain.
She had finally tuned into what the song was at the end of the chorus when she heard the title lyric and Rio looked at her again. Even from this distance she could see her smirk.

Was Rio using this song to flirt with her?
They had been very close earlier and not just in distance. There had been an energy that Agatha knew she wasn’t making up, she could tell that Rio had felt it too from the way she was looking at her. It was definitely mutual.
The realisation made Agatha’s heart start to beat faster. Lilia would be loving this if she was here.

As if she could sense what Agatha was thinking, a message from Lilia made Agatha’s phone light up.

Kooky Bitch: How’s it going?

Agatha: Ask me again in the morning.

Kooky Bitch: That’s my girl!

Agatha put her phone down and looked back up at Rio in time for the end of the final chorus. She was still looking at her, still smirking, but as the final lyric was sung, Rio winked. Agatha’s brows shot up and she couldn’t stop the smile that pulled at the corners of her mouth.

***

Four songs down and the crowd was loving them. Ash high fived Rio and said, “Dude, that was so clean!”
“We’re crushing this!” Billy leaned over the kit to say.
Eddie was once again working the crowd. “Are there any Swifties in the house?” This got the loudest cheer so far. “This next one is for all of you!”
Alice used the drum pads on her keyboard to start the beat for Anti-Hero and Rio started to regret not bringing any water on stage with her to quickly gulp down.
She had planned to, but she had gotten a little distracted before they went on stage so she had forgotten.

The beat looped while Alice played some synth lines and Rio did some light cymbal work through the first verse and pre-chorus and then the beat dropped out when Rio fully started playing on the chorus. This was something they’d only decided on in their last rehearsal so Alice and Rio exchanged a happy look when it went smoothly.

The rest of the song also went smoothly as did the transition into the next song. They all had so far and with each song they did, their collective energy grew. They’d had energy when they were rehearsing but actually being in the room with an audience and watching people singing along and dancing around was a whole different thing. Being able to not only feed off of the vibes from each other but the crowd watching them elevated the feeling. It gave them a boost.

Billy had said that he didn’t want to sing, he just wanted to focus on playing, but Rio loved seeing him not being able to resist leaning into Eddie’s microphone and singing along with Alice’s harmonies. Eddie didn’t let it throw him off, he just stepped to the side when he saw Billy walk towards him so that they both had space to sing. And the way that they looked at each other was so cute, it made Rio happy to see it.
It almost made her miss being in a relationship. Almost.

Sure relationships were good in the beginning. You had your person, your constant. But when that all went away, the readjustment to being by yourself was tough. Having to relearn how to be you wasn’t something that she wanted to go through again.
She hoped that Billy and Eddie wouldn’t have to do that, she hoped that they had found their forever. Because if they could, then maybe she could too.

***

Agatha wasn’t super up to date with the newer pop music, she knew a few Taylor Swift songs and didn’t hate them, but the one the band played after was completely lost on her. Wanda seemed to know it though, singing along to every word. She stopped to say, “Eddie’s an incredible singer isn’t he?”
That’s who Eddie was? She had heard Billy mention him when he and Alice had been round for dinner a few weeks ago, and seeing them on stage now that she had a face to put to the name, she could see it. The way that Billy looked at him, the kid was in love.
He had downplayed it when he told her about him, but he was probably trying not to rush into anything.

Billy had seen his mum go through two relationships in his life, she had almost been married twice, and he was probably trying to avoid making her mistakes. Especially now that he knew the truth about why her last relationship had broken down.
Agatha couldn't see Billy following in his mothers footsteps in that regard, the boy had a good head on his shoulders and, despite her current feelings towards them, Wanda and Vision had done a good job raising him. She couldn’t fault them for the way the kid turned out.

Agatha had been in his life for four years but she had never officially been his parent. After she moved in with Wanda and Billy, her involvement in the decisions regarding Billy grew. Wanda would often turn to her instead of Vision for things and Agatha would have to remind her that he had a dad and that Vision should be involved as well.
She didn’t really know what Vision did for work, she just knew that it kept him busy and there were times when he was out of the country. He tried to be as present as he could, but Agatha was the one living with them.

Agatha was the one who was there in the morning before Billy left for school and the one that he greeted at the door when she came home from work. Agatha was the one Wanda called from the hospital when she didn’t know if Billy would ever wake up again.
Billy still had a good relationship with his dad, Vision never missed his birthday or Christmas, or any important events in his life. But Agatha was the one that was there.

Watching him perform with his friends, seeing how good he had gotten at guitar – even more so than when she and Wanda were together – she was so proud of him. She still loved him the way that she did nearly three years ago and she was so happy that she got to have this second chance with him and rebuild what Wanda had broken.

Agatha nodded. “He is. Billy speaks very highly of him and I can see why. He’s besotted with him.”
Out of the corner of her eye, she saw Wanda turn her head to her and wrinkle her brow. “When did he tell you that?” She asked.
Agatha turned to face Wanda as well. “He’s been over for dinner a few times. Did he not tell you?”
“No. No he didn’t.” Wanda said after a moment.
Agatha hummed but didn’t say anything else. If Billy wasn’t telling his mum then he must have a reason and Agatha had clearly already said too much, she wasn’t going to say anything else that would cause difficulties for him.

The awkward silence that had settled between them was broken by the applause and cheers that went round the room, both of them joining in out of obligation.
Eddie spoke to the room again. “For this next one I don’t want to see anybody sitting down. There’s a dance that goes along with it and if you don’t know it, I’ll give you the first step. It starts with a jump to the left.”

***

Time Warp was always a crowd pleaser and people were singing along right from the first line. They had split it so that Eddie would be doing Riff Raff’s parts, Alice would be Magenta and Ash would jump in and sing Columbia’s bit. They had tried to convince Rio to do it but she refused saying, “If I tried to sing, it would probably cause an avalanche.”

Everyone was on their feet. Everyone except Agatha, stubborn as ever. It was getting towards the end of the first verse and Agatha still hadn’t gotten out of her seat.
Rio started playing the groove with one hand so that she had a free one that she could use to point at Agatha and gesture for her to stand.
She couldn’t see it, but she knew Agatha was rolling her eyes as she reluctantly stood up and joined in.
Rio had to laugh at the half-arsed way Agatha did the steps the first time round, but by the second time, she was into it.

If Rio thought she was sweating before, Time Warp was a whole different story. The fast fills that she had put in were fine when they were practising because she didn’t put in nearly as much power as she was now that they had an audience.
She was out of breath when the song finished and there were still two to go. She was desperate for a drink and got Ash’s attention whilst Alice played and sang the opening for the next song.
“Ash, can I have some water? I’m dying.”
Ash handed her their glass. “This is why your focus shouldn’t have been on your own personal after party.”
Rio downed the water in time for the full band to kick in.

The energy from Time Warp carried over into Pink Pony Club, especially with the version that they were playing. Agatha had sat back down, but Rio could see that she was singing along to the chorus . Even Agatha wasn’t immune to Chappell Roan.
Wanda cheered and clapped when Billy started his guitar solo, it was weird seeing her act like his mom. Rio had managed to separate the two in her mind when she slept with Wanda again over the past few weeks, mostly because she never saw them together. But having them in the same room was a constant reminder.

With eight songs down and one to go, Eddie spoke to the crowd for a final time. “Thank you everyone for joining in and having a good time!” The room cheered . “We have been Twisted Symphony and this is our last song, so make sure you give it your all!”
He started playing the intro to the anthem of drunk British people. Rio hadn’t believed them when her friends had told her the effect this song had on people over here, but the reaction from the audience proved her very wrong.

She thought they had peaked with Time Warp, but Mr Brightside blew it out of the water. She had no idea why this song had the effect that it did on the crowd, but the four other band members had been right when they said that it should be their last one.
The students lost their minds, jumping around and singing along so loudly that Rio could hear them all the way at the back of the stage.

The song ended to a rapturous applause and they all left the stage to people high fiving them and telling them how good they were. This was a feeling that Rio hadn’t known she had missed.

***

Agatha was thoroughly impressed with Rio and Billy. She was impressed with them all, but mostly those two. She wanted to go to them and tell them, but she was still trying to keep a distance from Billy in public until he told her otherwise, and she didn’t want more rumours to fly about her and Rio.
They might not be on campus but it was still a university event, and they had already almost kissed in front of everyone. They needed to be careful.

Agatha stood from her seat and Wanda followed suit asking, “Do you want another drink?”
“Yes but not with you. Your thirty minutes are up, Wanda.” She put Rio’s jacket on her chair and headed for the bar, wanting to get there before a gaggle of students inevitably swarmed it.
She joined the small queue that had already formed and took the time to decide on her next drink. Did she want more wine, or did she want something stronger? There was still half an hour before the drinks stopped being free so she decided to stick with wine, it wasn’t like she couldn’t afford the top shelf anyway.

She got two more glasses of wine, but this time one was actually for Rio.

***

When their little group of fans dispersed, Rio and her friends made their way to the bar to finally make use of the fact that it was free.
“Oh actually, could one of you grab me a pint? I’m gonna go to the toilet first.” Rio said as she carried on towards the bathrooms. Ash said that they would and Rio headed into the toilet.
She stood in front of the mirrors surprised that she didn’t look worse than what she did. She had sweated her makeup off, there was a redness on her cheeks and her hair was less tame, but she didn’t look nearly as bad as she thought she would have. She ran the tap and dabbed some of the cool water on her face, being careful to not get any on her corset.

Her eyes were closed as she was wiping the water away with a paper towel, not thinking anything of hearing the door open behind her.
“Way to go, rockstar.”
Rio jumped at the unexpected voice and spun around to see who it was.
Wanda was standing behind her.
“Fucking hell Wanda, you scared me.” Rio said once her breathing had slowed a bit.
Wanda pushed herself off the wall and walked towards her. “Sorry, I didn’t mean to.”
Rio raised an eyebrow. “Did you follow me into the bathroom?”
“Well when you say it like that, you make me sound like a stalker. But no, surprisingly I came to the toilet of my own accord.” She stepped closer to Rio. “I’d be lying if I said that I’m not glad I finally have a moment with you though.” She lifted her hand and ran a finger down the studs on the busk of Rio’s corset. “This is beautiful. How much did it set you back?”
Rio swallowed. “I don’t remember, honestly.”

Wanda stepped towards her again, putting her hands on Rio’s hips, and leaned forwards, her torso now flush with Rio’s. “I’d love to get you out of it, but that’ll have to wait until later.” She whispered, her breath tickling Rio’s face. She pressed a kiss to Rio’s cheek, then her jaw, then she started kissing her way down Rio’s neck.
Rio instinctively closed her eyes and tilted her head to give Wanda more access to her neck.
When she felt one of Wanda’s hands leave her hip and begin to reach under the corset in search of the waistband of her trousers, she remembered where they were.

She grabbed Wanda’s wrist to stop her. “Wanda, wait.”
Wanda pulled back from her neck enough to meet her eyes. “Don’t tell me you’re too good for sex in a bathroom.”
Rio wasn’t at all. But this bathroom, on this night, with this woman? It wasn’t what she wanted, despite what her body might be telling her.
“It’s a bathroom that any number of students could walk into right now. We’re incredibly lucky that no one has already.” Rio was keeping her voice low in case anyone passing by could hear them.
Wanda stepped back, her wrist slipping out of Rio’s hand. “You weren’t worried about students walking in when we had sex in my office.”
“Your office door locks, Wanda. And people generally knock before they try to go in, they don’t do that for a bathroom.” Rio said, her voice still a whisper but taking on an edge of harshness. “Also your son is out there waiting for me to go back to our table.” She huffed out a breath and ran her hand through her hair.

Wanda pulled her bottom lip between her teeth and nodded slowly. “Okay, you have a point. I’ll wait for you to text me.” She said before turning and leaving the bathroom.
Rio leaned against the counter and rested her head against the mirror, letting out a heavy sigh.
She wouldn’t be texting Wanda, but Wanda didn’t need to know that.
She took a moment to actually use the toilet before heading back out to her table and taking a healthy swig of her pint.

***

Agatha re-entered the room and did a quick scan of the seating chart, looking for Rio’s table. She looked in the direction of table one, but no one was there. She must have just missed them as they went to the bar.
She looked over to her own table and, much to her annoyance, Dottie and some of the other people that were assigned to it had taken their seats. Wanda wasn’t there though so every cloud, as they say.

She went to Rio’s table and put one of the glasses down in front of her name card and took a deep breath before walking to her own table. She knew that she would have to interact with her colleagues at some point during the night and she had already survived Dottie and even endured half an hour of sitting next to and talking to Wanda. She could do this.

She put on her best fake smile and walked with confidence towards her seat. The food would be served soon and then she could go back to avoiding them all. She just had to hang on a little bit longer.
She draped Rio’s jacket over the back of her chair, took her seat and had a sip of her wine before picking up her phone and sending two messages.

The first was to Billy.

Agatha: You did great up there kid! You all did. It was a nice surprise and I’m glad those guitar lessons paid off

The second was to Rio.

Agatha: Okay wine taster extraordinaire, impress me. What’s this one?

She had just sent the second message when Dottie turned to her. “Agatha! We were just saying how great it is that you decided to come this year.”
Sure they were.
Agatha forced sweetness into her voice. “Well, it’s like I said to you earlier. It’s time I started to get involved again, it’s been far too long.”
The woman sitting next to Dottie – after reading her name card Agatha remembered her name was Lisa – smiled. “It was nice to see you and Wanda sitting together earlier. She’s been saying how she hopes that the two of you could be friends again.”
Had she? When the fuck had she said that?

Agatha hummed, tightening her smile at this new information. “Yes. With Billy being at the university for at least the next three years, we agreed that it would be best for him if we could find a way to put the past behind us.”
If it kept these vultures off her back, she would fake any hakuna matata shit that she needed to.
She took part in the idle chit chat, and every time someone else came to take their seat it was a repeat of: “Agatha, it’s great to see you!”
“I know, it’s been too long.”
Each one more fake than the last.

Billy, Alice, Eddie and the other one had all come back in, drinks in hand, but Rio hadn’t been with them. She was starting to think that Rio and Wanda’s combined absences were more than just a coincidence.
Before she could start spiralling, her phone buzzed on the table.

Billy: Thank you, I’m glad you were able to watch. You’re kinda the reason I play guitar

Agatha: I just paid for the lessons and the guitar. The talent is all you, kid.
I would have come if you’d told me. You know that don’t you?

If Billy had told her that he was playing at this thing she would have bought her ticket straight away, no question.

Billy: I know but I didn’t want to make you feel like you had to come. I know these people aren’t your biggest fans

Her heart clenched. Billy hadn’t told her because he didn’t want her to feel like she had to put herself through this just to see him play. He’d rather her not come to watch him and be happy, than be here and suffer. He really was still every bit of the kind and caring kid she had known.

Agatha: You don’t have to worry about me. The only thing you have to focus on is having a good night with your friends

He didn’t reply but she saw him and his friends all knock their glasses together and take a drink, probably celebrating their great performance.

Out of the corner of her eye, she saw Rio walk back in. She was alone.
She beelined for her table and knocked back about a quarter of her drink in one gulp before sitting down and properly joining them.

Agatha desperately wanted to pick up where they had left off, preferably not in a room full of people, but with everyone seated and the first course being brought out, she couldn’t do that yet.
Wanda rushed in and got to her seat just as the waiter was putting her starter down. “Thank you so much.” She said to him as she sat down. “Looks like I made it just in time.” She said to the table.
The scent of cigarette smoke hit Agatha’s nostrils. Is that where Wanda was? When did she start smoking again?
Wait, why did Agatha care? If Wanda wanted to fall back on old habits, she could do so.
Agatha wished she didn’t have to smell it though because god damnit it was making her want a cigarette.

She was half way through her first course when she got a message.

Rio: I can’t believe you would make me drink Pinot Noir. That’s pure psychopath behaviour!

Agatha had to stifle her laugh and turn it into a cough. It still baffled her that Rio could tell what wine it was. She looked up in Rio’s direction but Rio was talking to Alice about something as they were eating their food.

Agatha: Too grown up for you? Maybe you’ve ruined your palette with all that cheap lager you’re drinking 😉

Agatha put her phone down and continued to eat her starter, tuning back into the conversation that was happening around her.
“Billy was fantastic Wanda! You must be so proud.” Percy, the person sitting next to Wanda, said.
He was probably the only person sitting at this table that Agatha didn’t hate. He had remained impartial in the office drama that followed the break up. They weren’t exactly friends but they did greet each other whenever they passed as they were walking through the building, which is more than can be said for the rest of them.

Wanda nodded, finishing her mouthful before replying. “I really am. It always amazes me whenever I see or hear him play. He really took to it like a duck to water.”
“And good on you and Vision for nurturing that creativity and providing him with the means for it.” Percy said, giving her a gentle nudge with his elbow.
Agatha subtly rolled her eyes. It had been her that provided the means. It had been her that convinced Wanda to let him have the lessons for his birthday. Hell, it had been her that suggested they watch that fucking movie in the first place.
She was keeping her head down, just finishing her last mouthful when Wanda said, “Well actually, we can’t take all the credit.” She set her knife and fork on her plate as she had finished her own food. “Agatha bought him that guitar.”

Agatha looked up at that and saw everyone’s eyes on her, expressions varying. Except this time it wasn’t because they thought she was the one who had cheated six months before her and Wanda were due to be married. It was because Wanda had said something positive about her.
She cleared her throat. “I did.” Was all she could say, too shocked to form any more words.
“She also bought him his first lot of guitar lessons.” Wanda added on, which Agatha nodded at.

She didn’t know how to handle this. It had been over two and a half years since she had heard Wanda speaking truths about her to their colleagues and she didn’t know how to react. The lies and the hatred she could handle. She knew how to take that and how to respond, but she wasn’t used to this anymore.
Percy lifted his glass up. “To Agatha, for helping create this generation’s newest rock star.”
Everyone raised their glasses and said, “To Agatha.” in unison before knocking their glasses together as much as they could with the table between them.
They all took a sip of their drinks and Percy smiled at Agatha. It was a genuine smile, like he was happy that she was finally getting the recognition she deserved.

***

Rio drained the last of the wine, it might taste like acid but it was free, and checked the time. “We only have a few minutes left before we have to start paying for drinks, shall we get one more round in?”
Her friends made varying noises of agreement and they all stood, making their way to the bar. As they were waiting to be served, Ash turned to Rio and said, “You probably don’t need to be rushing, mysterious glasses of wine just seem to appear for you.”
Rio shrugged and smiled. “Don’t hate ‘cause you ain’t me dude. My fans know the way to my heart.”
Ash scoffed and shook their head.

Rio was the last to be served and was technically over the time limit, but she charmed the female bartender into letting her have her drinks for free and the bartender threw in a shot of black sambuca as well.
Agatha might get to the front of the queue quicker, but Rio knew how to make it count.
She knocked back the shot at the bar and then took her pints back to the table. The plates from their first course had been cleared and the main course was starting to be brought out.
Rio cast a glance towards Agatha, she looked uncomfortable but didn’t look like she was having a horrible time and that was as good as it would probably get.

Rio wanted to talk to Agatha again, but that wouldn’t be possible with all of the seats currently filled. She would have to wait until she could get Agatha alone. Not for any lustful reasons, but just so that they could talk without the risk of someone making a stupid report about their ‘relationship’.
Rio wondered if some of the people that were currently being pally with Agatha had been the source of the rumour. She also wondered what the conversations could be about with both Wanda and Agatha sitting next to each other.

The rest of the meal passed relatively quickly, Rio and her friends having a constant source of chatter as they ate. They talked about things each of them did well during the gig – Eddie hitting a note that he had been worried about, Ash nailing the chorus of a particular song etcetera – they talked about the upcoming semester and the marks that they got on their essays.
“I’m still mad at you for saying we failed by the way.” Alice said whilst eating her dessert.
“I never said that you’d failed. I implied you’d failed. Two very different things.”
Billy pointed his spoon towards her. “Whatever, you’re still a twat.”
“Oh, I’m not denying that.” Rio said with a laugh.

When the dessert plates were cleared there was some time where people remained seated, finishing drinks and conversations before people slowly started to leave their tables and begin to mingle again. Some people swapping tables, some going to the bar. Everyone from Agatha’s table left except Agatha.
Wanda walked past Rio on her way out of the room. She didn’t say anything, she didn’t even look in Rio’s direction – probably because Billy, Alice, Eddie and Ash were all still sitting there – but Rio could tell that Wanda wanted her attention. She probably wanted Rio to follow her, to give in and let her fuck her in a public bathroom. But that wasn’t what Rio wanted.

She let Wanda walk past her and continue on to wherever she was headed. Billy said he was going to the toilet and Eddie, Alice and Ash all said they were stepping out for some air, leaving Rio alone.
She looked over at Agatha again and she noticed that now she was by herself, Agatha’s shoulders had dropped slightly and the smile that Rio had seen her wearing earlier was gone. She didn’t have to hide behind the pretence right now.

*~*

Rio finished one pint off and picked up the full one, crossing the room towards Agatha. She sat in the same chair that she had earlier, angling it so that she was fully facing Agatha.
Agatha looked at her with a half smile, glad that she was able to talk to Rio again after enduring an hour and a half of fake niceties, and sipped her wine. “Not a fan of Pinot then?” She asked, her voice lilting with the small chuckle that carried it.
Rio screwed her face up. “Absolutely not, it just tastes like acid. I don’t know how you’re still drinking it.”
Agatha looked at her glass. “Oh I’m not, I can’t stand it. I agree wholeheartedly with your review.”
“Then why make me drink it? That’s pure evil work.”

Agatha laughed. She immediately felt more at ease with Rio sitting beside her. “I needed to check that you had good taste. I can’t associate with someone who likes bad wine.”
Rio snorted. If only Agatha knew that she was literally raised around wine. “And what about me would suggest that I don’t have good taste?” She asked before taking a drink of her Coors.
Agatha raised an eyebrow and waited for Rio to put the glass on the table again. She pointed at it. “The fact that you’re drinking that for one.”
Rio looked at her pint then back to Agatha. Of course Agatha would turn her nose up at lager. "There's nothing wrong with this, it’s a perfectly good drink actually. Also I’m a student, we don’t all have jobs that pay us a top shelf salary.” She smiled and ran her tongue along the inside of her cheek.

It wasn’t a total lie. Rio didn’t earn a salary as high as Agatha’s, she never had. She wasn’t earning anything at the moment since she was studying. But her parents had taught her how to save her money since she had been old enough to understand it. They had drilled in the importance of knowing that just because they had money from their business and could afford to get Rio whatever she wanted for her birthdays and Christmases, not everybody had that privilege. Her family, and by extension her, having money didn’t make them any better than people who had less.

They had helped her apply for all of the minimum wage jobs that she had worked and helped her budget so that she could put some of her pay check into her savings and still have enough left over for her immediate needs.
This was a huge help when it came to buying her house.
The inheritance she got from her abuela on her dad’s side also helped, but she had already got a significant amount saved up by the time that was added.

Agatha made a noise of disbelief. “Rio, you’re living in a building where the rent for the year costs more than the loan you get for your PhD. You also afford your flights to and from America, which have gotten a damn sight more expensive than when I last went back there.” She picked up her glass. “Don’t try to tell me that you can’t afford a more expensive drink.” She drank the remainder of her wine.
Agatha had no idea what Rio’s money situation was, but from what she had gathered, Rio was nowhere near the ‘struggling student’ that she made herself out to be.
She wasn’t going to force Rio to tell her though, if Rio was keeping it close to her chest then that was her business.

Rio pursed her lips then rolled them inwards. “Touché.” She said before taking another healthy drink from her glass. “When were you last in America?” Agatha had alluded to not being from England before, but her accent was so close to the one she had gotten used to hearing around Cambridge that she couldn’t place it. There was a hardness to her Rs and a slight lilt to some of her vowels, but nothing specific that Rio could assign to a particular country.

Agatha took a deep breath and leaned back in her chair. She could just tell Rio that she did her undergrad over there and cover the conversation off but, for a rare moment, she wanted to tell her more. “I’m actually from there. I lived in Salem until I was eight and my mother moved us over here to Kent. Then I went back to study Classics at Yale and when I finished my degree in two thousand and five, I came back to Kent for a bit before I moved to Cambridge to get my masters and PhD and basically never left.” Agatha reached for her glass only to be disappointed once again to find it already empty.
Rio pushed her pint closer to Agatha and Agatha held her hand up. “I’d rather drink from the toilets.”

Rio smiled and shook her head. “Yeah the prices have gone up a little bit since then, it’s ridiculous actually. But it’s the life I’ve chosen.” She gave a quiet laugh.
Agatha smiled. She was always hesitant about telling anyone anything about her life because she didn’t want the questions that followed. But Rio just accepted what she had told her and didn’t push for more, it gave her a sense of safety, it offered her some comfort. Knowing that she could give Rio these little nuggets and she would only have to give the amount that she was comfortable with.

She thought back to their first few meetings and how she was dead set against Rio knowing anything about her. Now she trusted Rio enough to start opening up to her. She wasn’t about to go into detail, but sharing the basics didn’t make her feel like she would crumble.
“Do you want a proper drink?”
Rio took another small sip from her glass. “The bar's not free anymore. That’s why I’m nursing this one so much.”
Agatha picked up her bag and stood from her chair, smoothing out her dress. “Well how about we put my top shelf salary to good use then?” The corners of her mouth twitched as she held out her hand to Rio.

Rio slowly rolled her tongue over her bottom lip. Far be it from her to refuse to let an attractive woman buy her drinks. She took Agatha’s hand and stood up, letting the touch linger. Agatha slowly let her arm drop, their fingers slipping apart except their pinkies which they both subconsciously locked together.
Rio let her eyes drop slowly, taking in how Agatha’s dress sat on her frame now that she was standing and Rio could see the full thing up close. She wanted more contact than just their little fingers. She wanted to know how soft Agatha’s lips felt. She wanted to hear the soft moan Agatha would make as she kissed down her neck.

Agatha swallowed as she noticed Rio’s gaze travelling down her body. The way Rio was looking at her made heat start to creep into her stomach and made her breathing quicken ever so slightly. The last person who looked at her like that was Wanda, and Agatha really didn’t want to think about Wanda right now.
She wanted to grab Rio by the waist and pull her close. She wanted to thread her fingers through Rio’s hair as she brought their lips together. She wanted that breathless feeling that came from a kiss so electric that the only reason it ended was because you needed to breathe.

Agatha took a shaky breath and nodded. “Bar.”
Agatha let Rio walk a couple of steps in front of her, needing the few moments that it took them to get to the bar to try to collect her thoughts.

Rio almost wished that she had taken Wanda up on her offer earlier because god did she need it right now. Her whole body was warm and not from the alcohol, though that certainly wasn’t helping matters.
They got to the bar and the queue was almost non-existent since it was no longer free. There were only two people in front of them, both currently being served so it only took a couple of minutes until the bartenders were free.

The one that Rio had flirted with earlier gave her a smile but switched her attention to Agatha when she presented her card.
Agatha looked at Rio. “Glasses or a bottle?”
Rio thought for a moment. A bottle could be dangerous, but glasses would mean that they would have to keep getting up. Fuck it. “Why don’t we go for a bottle?”
Agatha nodded. “Which one would you recommend?”
Rio began to scan the bottles that lined the shelves as the bartender started speaking. “Well I’m not much of a wine drinker myself, but our most pop-”
“Oh no, sorry.” Agatha cut her off. “I was asking Rio. She’s a connoisseur.”
Rio rolled her eyes and addressed the bartender. “Ignore her, she likes to exaggerate.” She said before turning her attention back to the bottles.

The bartender raised an eyebrow as she looked between them, a knowing smile starting to appear on her face.
Rio pointed at a bottle, having made her decision. “That Merlot is a good one.”
The bartender picked it up. “This one?” She asked sceptically and when Rio nodded, she added, “This is our most expensive bottle.”
Agatha didn’t miss a beat. “That’s the one she wants.”
The bartender smiled again and began to remove the cork from the bottle. She put it on the counter along with two glasses and said, “Enjoy your night, ladies.”
Agatha took the bottle while Rio took the glasses and they both thanked the bartender before making their way back to Agatha’s table.

Rio saw that Wanda and a few other people were sitting at the table so she stopped walking. Her table was free but probably not for long. “It’s actually getting kinda warm in here. I know it’s December, but do you wanna sit outside for a bit?”
Agatha too had noticed that the table was no longer empty and was glad when Rio offered the alternative. She agreed and they made their way outside.

The garden of the hotel was expansive and there were plenty of tables littered around the edges. The majority of people who had made their way outside stuck to the patio, including Billy, Alice, Eddie and Ash. They motioned for Rio to go over to them so she handed the glasses to Agatha and said, “Go find a table, I’ll be over in a minute.”
Agatha took the glasses and nodded, moving from the patio proper to a part that still had flagstones but it was away from the crowd. There was no way she was walking on the grass in these heels.

Rio joined her friends at the table. Billy had a glass of water in front of him, the rest of them all had fresh pints and looked relatively sober. “I didn't think you guys could afford drinks outside of the campus bar or the student nights at the clubs.”
“Our bank accounts can handle one special occasion.” Eddie said with a laugh.
Ash rolled their eyes. “Billy’s mum gave him her card. In other news, Ms Maximoff is Billy’s mum”
Billy snorted. “She already knows.”
Alice pushed his glass of water towards him and said, “Sip that you lightweight.” At the same time Eddie asked, “How did you already know?”
Rio gave a short laugh at Billy and turned to Eddie. “I figured it out. I can’t believe you guys didn’t actually.” She turned to Ash. “Especially you. I had high hopes for you.”
Ash flipped her off and they all laughed.

Rio was surprised that Billy had told them considering how secretive he’d been about it, asking Wanda to keep it quiet. Maybe the booze had given him the confidence. She addressed the table. “Please tell me he wasn’t at the point of needing water when he introduced you.”
Eddie shook his head as he was taking a drink. “No thank god, he was passable then. It was the drink after that that sent him over the edge. Is this how I imagined meeting my boyfriend’s mum for the first time? No, but I’ll take it.”
Rio smiled at Eddie calling Billy his boyfriend. They really were cute together.
Rio stood to leave. “I’ve got someone waiting for me so I’m gonna go find her. Alice remember, I’m leaving you and Billy in charge of my plants while I’m back home.”

She was about to leave when Eddie asked, “Was that Agatha we saw you with? You’re having drinks with your professor?”
Rio scanned the garden looking for her and saw her sitting partway into the garden. “I can be friends with my professors.”
Billy snorted again. “Like you’re friends with m-”
Alice's eyes went wide. ”Water!” She said, cutting him off.
Rio gave her a small smile before pointing at Eddie. “Don’t let him die.” She switched arms and pointed at Alice. “Don’t let my plants die.” Then she spoke to the table. “I’ll see you all after the holidays.”
She walked away in Agatha’s direction.

She had asked Billy and Alice if they would go to her flat once a week over Christmas break to water her plants and gave Alice the spare key. She had written a list of instructions of how much water each plant would need and how to tell if they needed cutting back and exactly how to do it. She hadn’t long since done it herself so they shouldn’t need it, but she wanted all bases covered.

The wooden awning that was over the patio extended about a quarter of the way into the garden and Agatha picked a table that was just on the edge of it. The heat lamp that was mounted on one of the beams was the main selling point, but it also gave them a view over the lake. Well, it did if they both sat on the same side. There were fairy lights that were wrapped around the beams as well adding an ambiance to the otherwise lightless garden. The sun had long since set so the warm glow cast by both sources of light would have to do.

She filled the two glasses while she waited for Rio and smiled when she saw Rio approaching her.
“Sorry, they can’t survive if they’re away from a responsible adult for too long.” Rio said as she sat opposite Agatha on the picnic-style bench.
Agatha pushed one of the glasses towards her. “Oh so they still need someone to go over there then?”
“You’re hilarious.” Rio deadpanned and took a sip of the wine. “Damn this wine is nice. I’m good.”
Agatha raised an eyebrow sceptically as she tried to mimic the movements Rio had done with the wine earlier. She swirled it around, looked at it, took a sip and smelled it.

The bartender nodded and turned to leave but quickly spun back round and looked at Rio. “Your shoes are behind the bar, by the way. Just swing by and grab them on your way out.” She turned again and walked away.

She had already gotten into a situation with a faculty member at the university. It hadn’t quite blown up, but it was close enough. Maybe this was a message to not do it again.
They silently made their way back to the bar, Rio dropped the bottle and glasses off and the bartender passed her her shoes.
They walked towards the exit and stopped when they got to the steps.
Rio turned to Agatha. “How are you getting home?”
Agatha pulled Rio’s jacket around herself, feeling the loss of the heat lamp. “I live just around the corner from here actually.”
“Let me walk you then.” Agatha started to protest but Rio cut her off. “Agatha, it’s cold and dark. Let me walk you home.”
She held out her hand and after a moment of deliberation, Agatha took it and started to lead them in the direction of her house.

Chapter End Notes

Hoo boy that took TIME and I hope that it doesn't disappoint
This is only part 1 of The Ball™️
I hope this was easy to read. I never know if it actually flows properly since it makes perfect sense in my head, but might not to someone who can't read my thoughts!

The setlist is as follows:
Call Me - Blondie
Valerie - The Zutons
Don't Look Back In Anger - Oasis
Are You Gonna Be My Girl? - Jet
Anti-Hero - Taylor Swift
Espresso - Sabrina Carpenter
Time Warp - The Rocky Horror Show
Pink Pony Club - Chappell Roan
Mr Brightside - The Killers

Also playing drums in a corset *is* possible, but I know from experience that it isn't the easiest thing lmao

Chapter 22: Rio &amp; Agatha

Chapter Notes

The Night Of The Ball Part 2: Electric Boogaloo
Full disclosure I'm really ill atm. So if this is a bit janky, no it's not

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Rio swung her shoes in her hand slightly as they walked, extremely glad that she wasn’t wearing them right now.

Converse feel a lot more natural for me.”

“Since high school, but this is the first time I’ve actually played in front of people since my senior year. I was nervous as fuck.” Rio breathed out a laugh.

Agatha was surprised that it had been that long since Rio had played in front of an audience, she looked so natural on that stage. “You hid your nerves well and the whole band worked so well together. She nodded. “That would be nice, yeah.”

Rio thought for a moment, trying to remember what Wanda had called it. “I think it’s called a builder’s brew?”
Agatha laughed. “Okay, one builder's brew coming up.” She went into the kitchen to start making the drinks.

There were only two bookcases but they were floor to ceiling and they were stacked. They were filled a lot less chaotically than the ones in Agatha’s office and Rio noticed that they were alphabetised by the author's surname, like a book store would be. She smiled to herself. Of course this was how Agatha would organise her books.

The Night Circus sat on the shelf.

There were five books in a row that each had spines so cracked and worn that she couldn’t tell what they were.

There was no way that Agatha ‘use a fucking bookmark’ Harkness had allowed books to get to this condition.

Percy Jackson & The Olympians Book One The Lightning Thief was staring right at her. Not only that but it was the original paperback cover. “I was wondering if you’d find those.”

Rio shook her head. “No need, I know the way. I’ll see you in the new year.”
Agatha smiled and nodded. “See you in the new year.”

The dress, her duvet cover and the covers on her couch cushions would all need a wash but that was tomorrow Agatha’s problem.

The lock screen flashed up and the first thing her eyes were drawn to was a message.

Wanda: I didn’t wear this underwear for no one to see it

The way that Wanda and Rio were on first name terms with each other. The concern on Wanda’s face when she heard about Rio’s knee. The way that Wanda reached for Rio to offer comfort for her injury.

This was definitely something else.

How could this be happening?
The woman that she had spent months building up to this night with had been sleeping with her ex fiancée.

If she saw this message now would she go straight to Wanda’s?

Agatha’s voice was uneven and Rio chuckled. “Okay, you sound like you need some rest. Merry Christmas Agatha.” She took the phone out of Agatha’s hand and Agatha forced a smile.
“Merry Christmas Rio.”
Rio turned away and Agatha closed the door.
Yeah, she fucking hated Christmas.

Rio ordered her taxi and waited for it on the corner under the glow of a street lamp. She wouldn’t realise it until much later, but that feeling that she usually had when she left Wanda’s house, or after she’d slept with Taylor – the feeling that something was missing or not quite right – she didn’t feel it as she sat in the car leaving Agatha’s house, setting her alarms for the morning. 

Chapter End Notes

ARE YOU ALL HAPPY NOW?
THEY DID THE DO!

Also now Agatha knows about Rio and Wanda so ya know. There's that.

Chapter 23: Rio

Chapter Notes

I didn't intend on leaving it this long, especially after the way the last chapter ended, but I got a music brain worm and needed to work it out
Please accept my sincerest apologies!
Also the Spanish was all google translate so if there's anything that's wrong or should be worded differently, let me know so I can change it!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Rio was sitting in the airport waiting for her connecting flight and fighting to keep her eyes open. She hadn’t gotten much – if any – sleep the night previous, for obvious reasons.
She had showered when she got home so that it was one less thing to do in the morning but after that she was too wired to settle down. She had managed maybe half an hour of sleep before her alarm went off and she had to drag herself back out of bed.
Now she was sitting in the airport regretting not having gotten any sleep. She didn’t regret the reason but god damn was she tired.

She was blasting heavy music into her ears in the hopes that the heavy distortion, fast double pedal and roaring vocals would keep her awake long enough to board her next flight. She watched the other people milling about in the airport. Some were families with small children that saw the wide open space as a huge playground, and were running around whilst their parents tried to corral them.
Some were young couples going on their first holiday together.
Some were people that looked just as tired as she felt who probably also had multiple flights to catch on the same day and were just trying to make it to their destinations in one piece.

Rio had resorted to closing one eye for a few seconds at a time and then switching in an attempt to rest them enough without fully closing both eyes and risking drifting to sleep, whilst also watching the board so that she can see which gate she needs to head to in a few minutes.
After what felt like hours of desperately trying to stay awake, the board finally changed and showed her gate. She groaned softly at the fact that she now had to move and stood up, slinging her bag over her shoulder and made her way in the direction that the arrows were pointing.

__________

Rio didn’t know exactly when she lost her fight with sleep, but she was woken up by a gentle nudge on her shoulder. She slowly opened her eyes and saw the smiling face of the little girl that was sitting next to her.
“My mommy told me to tell you that you need to put your seatbelt back on because we’re landing soon.”
It took Rio’s brain a minute to process what the girl had said, but when it had caught up she replied. “Oh. Thank you so much.” She smiled softly at the girl and gave a nod of thanks towards her mom before wrapping the belt around her waist and securing it.

The girl – whose name, Rio found out, was Olivia – chatted to her until the plane landed and it was time for them to get off.
Olivia told her that this was her first ‘big girl’ flight because she had been too small the other times she had been on a plane to remember it, and that they were going to visit her uncles for Christmas. Rio smiled and nodded along as Olivia spoke excitedly, saying the occasional “wow” when she felt like it was needed.

Olivia’s mom got their cases from the overhead compartment and led Olivia off of the plane, Rio following behind. When Rio started to veer away towards the luggage carousels Olivia said, “bye bye Miss Rio. Merry Christmas!” with a wave.
Rio waved back. “Bye Olivia, merry Christmas!”
The interaction made Rio smile as she was waiting for her suitcase to appear on the carousel.

When she finally saw her case, she grabbed it and headed for the exit. Maddy was picking her up so she swept her gaze over the people that were stood waiting, looking for her friend, and rolled her eyes when she saw Maddy and the sign she was holding.
Her Royal Highness, Queen Of The Lesbians, Rio Vidal
“You just had to, didn’t you?” Rio asked as she pulled Maddy into a hug.
“How could I resist?” Maddy answered as she wrapped her arms around Rio and gave her a tight squeeze. “Fuck, I’ve missed you dude.” Maddy added as she pulled away.
“That’s a bit gay.” Rio deadpanned.
“Hey, bisexuality is real. Don’t erase me.”
“My sincerest apologies your bi-ness.” Rio said with a cheeky smile. “Can you take me home now though? I’ve had enough of airports for one day.”
Maddy looped her arm around Rio’s. “Your chariot is this way.” She said as she led them towards her car.

Rio paid for the parking as a thank you, and they set off towards her house.
Maddy began telling her about a new person that had been adopted into the friend group. “Her name is Kate and she moved here four months ago. She started working at the office about three months ago and I’m training her. She didn’t know anyone and she doesn’t really speak to her family, who live in New York. So naturally I took her in.”
Rio smiled as Maddy spoke.

Maddy was the kind of person that would talk to anyone and hated to see anybody being alone. It was how they had become friends.
None of Rio’s middle school friends were in her homeroom when they moved to high school, so she had tucked herself into one of the back corners, too nervous to speak to anyone. And that's how the day went until lunch. She was once again tucked into a corner, watching her friends sitting and laughing with new people that they had met through the morning, when someone pulled out the chair opposite her and sat down. And from that moment on, her and Maddy were best friends.

“Is she joining us on Boxing Day?” Rio asked.
Her, Maddy, Chloe and Jesse had agreed to go for a meal and then go back to Maddy’s house to exchange the group's Secret Santa gifts, get high and have a few drinks.
“Yeah she is and she’s staying the night at mine. So please for the love of whatever deity you want to assign this to, do not, under any circumstances, sleep with her.”
Rio scoffed in fake outrage. “Madylin, what are you implying?”
Maddy didn’t reply until she had finished a risky lane change. “Well she’s a lesbian so I don’t need to tell Jesse and we both know that it won’t be Chloe, so that just leaves you. She’s still new to the city and she’s shy. So she doesn’t need to be added to your ever-growing body count.”
Rio laughed. “I can’t believe I flew all this way just for you to slut shame me.”
“I’m not slut shaming you, if anything I’m slut jealous. I’m just looking out for a new friend.”

Rio made a show of thinking hard about what Maddy had said. “Hmm, okay. I won’t sleep with her.”
“Thank you, you’re such a saint.” Maddy said with a smirk.
“I’ll save her for when I come home in summer.”
Maddy rolled her eyes. “You’re such a prick!”

They spent the rest of the drive to Rio’s house finalising the plans they had for the Christmas period.
Rio had bought most of the presents for her friends and family online and had them delivered to Maddy’s house, so Maddy was going to bring them over and help her wrap them tomorrow afternoon. Then during Maddy’s lunch break on Monday and Tuesday, they were going to do some last minute shopping and Kate was going to join them so that she had a chance to meet Rio before the full group had their gathering.

Everyone would spend Christmas Eve and Christmas Day with their own families – except Kate who had been adopted by Maddy’s family for the holiday and would be with Maddy at Maddy’s parents’ house for dinner – and they would have their time on Boxing Day. The rest of the week before new years they would play it by ear since Jesse and Chloe both had to work and Maddy and Kate both had the week off. The plans for new years hadn’t been locked in yet so they would be decided on Boxing Day before they got too high.

Maddy pulled up outside of Rio’s house and grabbed Rio’s arm to stop her from getting out of the car. “Before you go in, there’s something I need to tell you.”
Rio didn’t respond, she just waited for Maddy to continue.
Maddy took a shaky breath. “So I came by every week to water your plants and clip them back when needed, like we agreed. I followed all of your instructions to a T. I spoke to them, I used their names, I even put classical music on for them like you asked.” She dropped her gaze, no longer looking Rio in her eyes. “I stopped by today before heading to the airport just to make sure they were all sorted for you coming home and you didn’t have to worry about them for a couple of days. But…” She trailed off.

Rio put her hand on Maddy’s arm reassuringly. “Maddy, it’s okay. I won’t be mad, just tell me how bad it is.”
Maddy looked back up at Rio’s face. “It’s Samwise. He was fine when I checked on Monday, but today his leaves had started shrivelling and they weren’t as vibrant as before.”
Samwise was a Hobbit Jade that Rio adored, she’d had him for nearly five years and she’d have taken him to England with her if she could.
“I Googled what to do,” Maddy continued, “and it said to let the soil dry completely before adding any more water. It was still slightly damp when I checked so I haven’t done anything, but I needed to tell you before you went in.”

Rio started to laugh, she couldn’t help it. Maddy had taken this so seriously, and yes she would have been a bit upset if any of her plants had died, but it wouldn’t be the end of the world. “Maddy, you probably just underwatered him slightly. I’ll sort him out, don’t worry. He can be very dramatic.”
Maddy breathed out a sigh of relief. “Oh thank fuck. I thought for sure that this would be the end of our friendship.”
“Well I’m glad you didn’t overreact.” Rio said as she got out of the car and went to get her case out of the boot.
Maddy flipped her off as she went to the front door and used her spare key to open it for Rio.

Rio dumped her bags near the living room and threw her shoes back towards the door before heading to check on Samwise. His leaves were looking a little dry and shrivelled as Maddy had said, but it wasn’t anything she couldn’t fix with a bit of TLC. “You can relax, he will live to see another day!” She shouted over her shoulder towards Maddy.
“I’m so glad!” Maddy replied, walking towards Rio. “I told your abuela that we’d be there for eight, so you’ve got time to shower if you want.”
“As much as I’d love to, I know that if I get in that shower now then I won’t want to leave the house again.”
Maddy snorted. “Valid. I’ll make us a coffee then so that you don’t fall asleep in your food later.” She headed to the kitchen and Rio followed behind her, taking a seat at the counter. She knew that if she sat on the comfy sofa she would definitely pass out.

They killed the time drinking their coffees and chatting before Maddy drove them to Rio’s parents house – the drive was short as Rio only lived about ten minutes away from her parents.
Her parents house was at their vineyard, right at the end of the winding road, past the small on-site shop. Rio never got tired of the scenery and admired it in the low light as they drove down the road.

When the house came into view Rio felt a pang of excitement at seeing her family again after so long. Living so close to each other meant that they saw each other often and this was the longest she’d ever been away from them since she had been in New York doing her masters.
As they got closer she could see that the front door was already open, and waiting to greet them was her thirteen year old great pyrenees, Monty.

When the car stopped he immediately bounded towards it, beelining for Rio like he knew she had come home. She had barely opened the door before he was jumping up at her, his tail wagging so fast that it was just a blur.
“Hey buddy!” She said as she rubbed his head, trying to stop him from licking her face. “Did you miss me? I sure missed you!”
She managed to get him off of her long enough so that she could get out of the car and as soon as she was standing, he was jumping up at her again. He might be an old man, but he still had the same energy he did when he was a puppy.

Maddy walked around the car to join them. “Wow, you come home and he forgets all about me.”
At the sound of her voice, Monty dropped down from Rio and went to Maddy for a moment before going back to Rio and then back to Maddy, seemingly trying to work out who his attention should go to.
Rio bent down to pat his head. “How about we go inside and you can sit between us buddy?”
As if he’d understood what she’d said, he turned and started walking towards the house, looking back at them to check they were following him, which they were.

Rio closed the door behind them and Monty continued into the living room.
“Did you bring them in safely, compañero?” Rio heard her dad ask from inside the room, before hearing him stand up.
She was hanging her jacket up when he appeared in the hall. “Mija, it’s so good to see you!” He said with a beaming smile as he wrapped his arms around her in a tight hug. “Thank you for picking her up Maddy.”
“Any time Luis. Someone had to make sure she didn’t land herself in trouble the minute she got back.” Maddy said with a smirk.
“Isabella, Camila! Rio’s home!” Luis shouted over his shoulder towards the kitchen.
Rio and Maddy slipped their shoes off and the three of them made their way to the kitchen where Isabella, her mom, and Camila, her abuela, were finishing the meal that they had been preparing.

Her mom set down the spoon that she had been using to stir the pan and pulled her into a hug. “Querida, it’s so good to see you! I’ve missed you so much, how are you?”
Rio hugged her back. “I’ve missed you too Mami. I’m good, just tired and hungry.”
Isabella pulled away and said, “well we can fix one of those things.” She turned to Maddy. “Thank you for getting her here.”
“No problem, Isabella. Anything for my second favourite family.” Maddy said with a smile.

Camila, who had been quiet up to this point, walked up to Rio and pressed the handle of the wooden spoon that Isabella had set aside a few moments ago into her hand. “Please help me. Your mother burnt the sauce twice.”
Rio chuckled and looked at her mom. “How could you burn the sauce not once, but two times?”
Isabella leaned in to whisper in Rio’s ear. “She kept turning the heat too high.”
“Isabella Marie, escuché eso!”
Isabella turned to face Camila with a sickly sweet smile. “Te amo mucho mamá.”
Camila grumbled under her breath and grabbed Rio by the wrist, leading her to the stove.
Isabella laughed softly and left the kitchen with Luis in tow.

Camila bent down to check the contents of the oven before saying, “You’re staying for dinner, Maddy.” It wasn’t a question.
Rio had assumed that Maddy would be staying for dinner, her abuela always cooked enough to feed a small army and never turned anybody away. She had the feeling that Maddy had eaten meals with her family a lot while she’d been away.
“Roger that.” Maddy said whilst saluting Camila and leaving the two of them alone in the kitchen.

The conversation started as small talk. Camila asked Rio how her journey was and how her PhD was going, if she’d made any friends, how living in England was etcetera.
Rio enjoyed spending time with her abuela. Cooking with her was a huge part of her childhood and she had taught Rio so many recipes over the years.
Rio’s family had imparted so many essential life skills on her and she was thankful for every single one of them.

The small talk shifted onto the topic that Rio had been anticipating, when her abuela said, “I was hoping you’d have a girlfriend for me to meet.”
Rio smiled. Camila always asked her when she was going to be in another relationship, not because she thought there was anything wrong with being single, but because she wanted Rio to be happy and find her ‘forever person’ – Rio still had no idea who had taught her abuela that phrase.

“How do you know I don’t?”
“Porque te conozco, cariño. Unless you and Maddy have an announcement to make, you wouldn’t get a girlfriend and not bring her to meet me. It’s against the rules.” Camila poked Rio in the ribs to drive the point home and Rio chuckled as she poured the sauce into a bowl.
“Okay fine, I don’t have a girlfriend. I’m trying to focus on my studies, abuela.”
Camila didn’t need to know that Rio was definitely taking part in extracurricular activities. The woman might be surprisingly open-minded for a devout catholic, but she didn’t need to know that information about her granddaughter.

Rio’s lie seemed to sate Camila and they began taking the copious amounts of food into the dining room, announcing that dinner was ready.
Rio made a plate for Monty and put it on the floor at the head of the table, the place that had been reserved for him since he was a puppy. They had trained him to wait until Camila had said grace before he started eating, using “amen” as his release word.
While Rio didn’t follow any religion, she still closed her eyes and respected the prayer that Camila said before they ate. It gave her a warm feeling in her chest. The feeling of being home.

__________

The remaining four days until Christmas were filled with last minute Christmas preparations and spending more time with her friends and family.
On Sunday morning Rio bought a card to write for Kate and in the afternoon, Maddy helped Rio wrap the presents that she had ordered.
They made light work of the task and decided to reward themselves with a drink, which quickly turned into several drinks.

They headed to a local bar where the bartenders knew them by name and discounted their drinks. Rio was greeted by them like she had returned from the war, and her first couple of drinks were free.
They invited Chloe and Jesse to join them and Maddy set a hard rule of no shots since she had to be at work the following morning.
The four of them occupied their usual booth at the back and enjoyed a quiet Sunday night together.

Chloe returned to the table with a fresh round for everyone and set the drinks down in the middle. “I am surprised that you haven’t brought a sweet yet naïve British girl back with you. I thought you’d have managed to find at least one that would follow you around wherever you went.” She said as she took her seat again.
Rio took a sip of her rum and coke. “I’m gonna blow all of your minds when I tell you that I’ve only slept with three women while I’ve been there.”
Jesse’s mouth dropped open and his eyes went comically wide. “Only three? Damn, has the PhD broken you already? Do you remember all of their names?” He asked, his voice steeped in sarcasm.

Rio flipped him off as Maddy and Chloe laughed. “You’re all bullies actually. I don’t know why I continue to put up with you.”
“You’d be lost without us, babe.” Maddy said as she reached across the table to hold Rio’s hand.
Chloe mimicked the action and reached for Rio’s other hand. “Please tell me I was right and one of them was your supervisor.”
Rio felt the corners of her mouth lift as she thought about her night with Agatha just two days ago. The night definitely could have lasted a lot longer if she hadn’t needed to catch her flight the following morning. She could always make up for lost time when she got back to England.

“Okay yes, I did sleep with her. But it was after you mentioned it and not because of.”
Chloe grinned at her. “Doesn’t matter, a win is a win.” She turned to Maddy and nudged her. “You owe me ten bucks.” Then she turned to Jesse. “You too. Pay up.”
Jesse and Maddy both sighed but reached into their pockets and pulled out a ten dollar bill each and handed them to Chloe.
Rio watched the exchange in shock. “You guys were betting on whether I’d sleep with her or not?”
“Me and Maddy bet that you wouldn’t sleep with her.“ Jesse tried to defend himself. “So technically, we’re not the problem here.”
“Technically, you’re all dickheads.” Rio grumbled into her drink.

__________

Rio met Maddy and Kate on their lunch break for some last minute shopping on Monday and Tuesday as planned. Kate took a little while to come out of her shell on the Monday but on the Tuesday Rio could see her being a good fit with their little group. She had a good sense of humour, which was needed around that sarcastic group of idiots, and joined in with the gentle bullying that went on between Maddy and Rio.

Rio tried to get to know Kate a bit better, asking her questions about herself, but avoided mentioning her parents since Maddy had mentioned that Kate didn’t really talk to them. Rio figured that Kate wouldn’t want to talk about them to someone she had only just met.
“I was on my college's archery team, I was the best actually, and had the opportunity to take it further. But I enjoyed it too much and didn’t want it to end up feeling like work, you know?” Kate explained and Rio nodded in agreement. She understood where Kate was coming from.
“I was worried about that when I decided to do my PhD on Greek Mythology but so far, touch wood, I haven’t had that feeling.” Rio said as she tapped her fingers against a wooden post that they were walking past.

Maddy snorted. “It also helps that she’s sleeping with her supervisor.” She stage whispered to Kate.
Rio rolled her eyes but Kate spoke before she could. “Oh wow! That’s one way to make sure you pass.” She said with a laugh.
Rio threw her arms up. “I’m not sleeping with her, we had sex one time. And trust me, an orgasm isn’t enough to ensure a good grade from that woman.” While Rio definitely believed that, it probably wouldn’t hurt if Agatha actually had any say in her final grade. “Besides, she’s not the one that marks it. It's a panel of examiners that I need to impress and then I need to defend it.”
“So you just need to sleep with the examiners then.” Kate said matter of factly.
Rio scrunched her face up. “But what if they’re men?”
Kate matched her expression. “Oh good point actually.” She put her hand on Rio’s arm. “Don’t put yourself through that, you’re too pretty to sleep with a man.”
“You’re so right! I’m glad you moved here, Kate. You get me.”

They walked back to the building where Maddy and Kate both worked. Kate went straight in because she needed the toilet and Maddy stayed outside with Rio for a moment.
“What did I say you’re not allowed to do?” Rio furrowed her brows in confusion, not really sure what Maddy was referring to. “Stop flirting with her. ‘Oh Kate, you get me.’” Maddy continued in a high pitched, mocking voice, followed by a gagging noise.
“That’s not what I sound like and that wasn’t flirting. I was being friendly!” Rio said, defending herself.

Maddy narrowed her eyes. “The line between you being friendly and you being flirty is almost non-existent, dude. You’re forgetting how well I know you.”
Rio crossed her arms. “You’re so dramatic.” She said with a smirk.
Maddy rolled her eyes. “And you’re still a prick.” She said before turning and heading into the building. “Merry Christmas asshole, love you!” She threw over her shoulder.
Rio smiled and shook her head. “Love you too. Merry Christmas.”
