__________ 

On Christmas eve Rio drove to her parents house so that she could spend the next two nights there like she did every year since she moved out. The vineyard was closed to the public until Boxing Day so there was nothing to do except spend both days together.
More family members would also be coming to stay and spend the holiday with them.
The house was big enough that Rio, Luis, Isabella and Camila never felt like they were living on top of each other and always had their space, but with the seven extra people that were staying for the next two days, the house was going to be packed.

Luis and Isabella had planned out the sleeping arrangements ahead of time, both of them well versed in these family gatherings by now. They had the biggest house so it made sense that everyone went to them and they had the added convenience of Rio’s house only being a ten minute drive away so that people could stay there as well.

In the late afternoon her tías Lucinda and Amelia and her tío Gabriel arrived with her cousins Luna, Sofia and Gabriela – Gabriela had also brought her boyfriend, Jason. They were all staying at Rio’s parents house both nights as well which meant it was about to get a bit crowded.
The final cousin, Marcus, arrived with his wife Lara and their nine month old baby Phoebe who were all staying at Rio’s house so that Phoebe could have a quiet space. They had already stopped by Rio’s house to drop their bags off before arriving at her parents house to join the chaos.

Monty was diligently waiting by the door to greet each person as they arrived, loving the attention that he was getting.
This was the first time that he had met Phoebe so they all watched as he cautiously sniffed her for a minute before ultimately deciding that he must protect the tiny human at all costs. He would lay at the feet of whoever was holding her, and if she was taken out of the room, he would follow closely behind, keeping an eye on her the entire time.

The focus shifted from the baby to Rio as everyone wanted to know how her studies were going and what England was like. She answered all of their questions, avoiding the ones about relationships as there was nothing to say other than the pre-prepared line of “I’m just trying to focus on my studies.”
She would definitely be updating Gabriela, Luna and Sofia about her exploits later on when they were sharing a couple of joints in the field, and judging by the way they were looking at her as she spoke, they knew they would be getting all the details at some point.

Lara, Rio and her cousins had placed bets on how long it would take Gabriel to say something slightly homophobic, but just over two hours in and he was yet to supply them with the goods. Luna and Sofia were out of the running which left Gabriela, Marcus, Lara and Rio still in with a chance of winning the pot that they had gathered when everyone arrived.
It was something they did every time there was a family gathering, but Amelia must have spoken to him about it on the drive down because it had usually happened by now.
The rules of the game included not being allowed to trick him into saying anything homophobic – it had to be legitimate – and two people had to be with him at all times so that there were witnesses.

Just past the four hour mark and only Marcus and Rio were still in. Rio usually had very little faith in him and placed her bet somewhere within the first hour, but this time she felt the urge to go late. They were finishing up dinner and the drinks were starting to flow; this was Rio’s time to get her win.

Lara, Gabriel and Rio were all in the kitchen sorting the takeaway cartons into recyclable, non-recyclable and ones that Camila would definitely want to keep and reuse. It was tradition that they ordered in on Christmas eve as the kitchen was all prepped for the food that would be cooked the following day.
They were just chatting and Rio was about to accept defeat as Gabriel still hadn’t made any comments… Until he turned to her and asked, “So you really haven't found yourself a girlfriend in England?”
Rio watched Lara’s eyes go wide behind him and she felt the corners of her mouth fighting to lift.
This was it.
She still had ten minutes left until Marcus won by default and this could be her moment.

She turned her attention back to the plastic tubs she was washing to be stacked in the cupboard later in an attempt to appear nonchalant. “No, I really haven’t. Like I said, I’m just focusing on my studies.” She kept her voice light, she wasn’t allowed to goad him.
He handed her another tub. “What about a boyfriend?”
Rio flicked her eyes to Lara for half a second before looking at Gabriel. “I’m a lesbian tío. I definitely won’t be looking for a boyfriend." She said with an undertone of amusement.
He hummed and nodded.

Rio was so close to winning the money she could almost taste it. The sixty dollars was within her reach. All she had to do was lead Gabriel to the water and let him drink, but it couldn’t seem like she was leading him. He had to go of his own accord.
She asked her next question carefully, making sure to phrase it just right. “How’s your search for a boyfriend going?”
Rio watched Lara’s expression shift over Gabriel’s shoulder. It was a risky question, but was still within the rules… Just.
He gave a short, sharp “Ha!” before saying, “About as well as I want it to.”
“Ahh, so you’ve found him then.” Rio said without missing a beat.

Lara snorted and quickly disguised it by coughing but Gabriel didn’t seem to notice, he was too busy laughing at what Rio had said.
“You’re a funny fucker, Rio! You know I don’t like my shopping dropped off round the back.” She faked her laugh like she was joining in with him, hoping that he would continue because that was a phrase he had used before and no longer counted for a win. They were playing in the big leagues now.

Lara held up her hand behind him, spreading her fingers and mouthing, “Five minutes,” at Rio.
She thought she would have to concede but then Gabriel continued. “Besides, I work in construction. I couldn’t do that job if my wrists were limp!”
Bingo!
Lara punched the air which made Gabriel turn around. “I saw a fly.” Lara quickly explained. “I nearly caught the fucker but it got away.”
He made a noise of disgust. “Pequeños bastardos.” He turned back to Rio. “Your dad still have that electric fly swatter?”
“Oh, uh, I think so? You’ll have to ask him.”
He nodded and left the kitchen in search of Luis.

Rio and Lara waited for him to be out of earshot before they celebrated Rio’s win.
Lara grabbed her and pulled her into a hug before pulling back and resting her hands on Rio’s shoulders. “That was fucking masterful, truly. I cannot believe I got to witness that with my own two eyes and ears.”
Rio laughed. “There was no way in hell that I was letting Marcus win again. He’s way too smug about it.”
Lara nodded her agreement. “We need to assemble the Council Of The Cousins to let them know.”
“You gather them and I’ll grab the beers and the weed and meet you outside.”
Lara saluted her and they went their separate ways.

About five minutes later everyone was gathered outside for the announcement. Marcus and Rio stood next to each other and everyone else stood opposite them, with Lara giving the results as she was the last witness.
“I have gathered the Council Of The Cousins here tonight to announce the winner of the traditional game of ‘When Will Gabriel Remember He’s Homophobic?’”
They really needed to come up with a better name.

“The last two people in the running were Marcus and Rio, so let’s have a round of applause for them getting this far.”
The seven of them clapped and cheered, Rio trying hard to keep the grin off her face at knowing that she won.
“But unfortunately there cannot be two winners. So, it is my absolute pleasure to announce that tonight's winner is none other than Rio Vidal!”
Everyone clapped and cheered again and Marcus pulled out the money bag that they’d all stuffed their ten dollar bills into hours ago to hand to Rio.
“You have no idea how much pain this is causing me.” He said as she took it off him.
“Oh I do, and I’m loving it.” Rio replied, her smile now wide and free.

They all stayed out there for another few minutes congratulating Rio before Marcus and Lara said that they were leaving because it had been a long day for Phoebe and they needed to get her to bed. They said their goodbyes and left Rio, Gabriela, Luna and Sofia outside.
Rio fished the joints out of her pocket. “Shall we ladies?”
“We shall!” Her three cousins said in unison.
Luna grabbed the beers and they all went out into the field.

Gabriela got the blankets out of the shed and they wrapped themselves up before sitting on the log that they had claimed years ago, they had even scratched their initials to reserve their ‘seats.’
Marcus’ initials were also there and later Lara’s were added, but it would be a while before they joined in with the smoking again.

They lit the joints and took a few drags, enjoying the quiet for a moment after the chaos of the evening, listening to the crickets chirping away.
Luna passed the joint to Rio as she said, “Okay, spill. How much has your body count risen while you’ve been over there?”
Rio took a drag and took it back, savouring the burn on the back of her throat. “Only by three. One of them lasted a couple of months, one was a few times in between the first one and the last was on Friday.” She took another drag before passing it back to Luna.
Gabriela breathed out the joint that she and Sofia were sharing. “Ahh. So small amount of women, big amount of orgasms.”
Rio smiled. “Oh there were plenty of orgasms.”
“That’s my girl.” Gabriela said whilst patting Rio on the back.

Sofia leaned forwards so that she could see Rio from her position at the end of the log. “How come the first one ended? Got too real?”
Rio sighed. How did she begin to explain the Wanda situation? “Kinda, but not for the reasons you’re thinking.” She took a swig of her beer before continuing. “It turns out that I was friends with her son and she decided that wasn’t information that I needed to know.”
Her three cousins all spoke over each other.
“Damn.”
“Shit.”
“Dude!”
Rio puffed out her cheeks and blew out a breath. “Yep. We slept together a handful of times after I found out but, I don’t know. That’s information you can’t unlearn.” She gladly took the joint from Luna when it was offered to her and breathed it deep into her lungs before exhaling it.

“Did the son know? How old is he? How did you meet him? How did you meet her? Sorry, that's a lot of questions.” Luna said, her questions coming in quick succession.
Rio answered all of the questions in order while they all listened, not interrupting her. “He found out that I was sleeping with his mom at the same time I found out that she was his mom. We were in her room and he came home to do some laundry – she wasn’t expecting him because it was mid-week and he usually went round on the weekend. So she quickly went downstairs and I threw my clothes back on and tried to sneak out but he caught me. In my haste to get dressed I also put my shirt on inside out.” She laughed at the absurdity of it, starting to see the humour in the situation. “He’s called Billy and was actually pretty cool about it and said that, as long as he didn’t have to know about it, we could keep seeing each other.”

“He’s eighteen and he’s getting his degree in ancient history so we actually met on the first day of what they call freshers week, and he’s taking the module that my supervisor teaches so we sit together in those lectures. I’m also in a band with him.” She passed the joint back to Luna and took another drink of her beer. “I met his mom because she’s also a lecturer in the department. I emailed her about being my supervisor actually, but she never replied. I’m actually kinda glad about that now. Anyway, we ran into each other in a bar one night and I woke up in her bed and then we started a casual thing.”

Luna passed the joint back to Rio for her to have the final drag. “When’s the last time you slept with her and when did you call it off?”
“I slept with her about two weeks ago and I realised that I was pretty much done with it on Friday actually. We were at a university event and she came onto me in the bathroom but I turned her down. She messaged me later on but I was… busy. I didn’t see the message until I got home much later into the night.”
Gabriela finished off the joint that she was sharing with Sofia and asked, “I’m assuming ‘busy’ was woman number three?”
“Ding, ding, ding, we have a winner.” Rio said as she discarded her joint into the small metal bucket they kept for occasions such as these.

Gabriela flicked the end of her joint into the bucket as well as Sofia spoke. “Okay, we’re getting ahead of ourselves. Tell us about woman number two.”
Rio cracked open a second can. “Oh that one’s way easier. She’s one of Billy’s friends but she’s a couple years older than him and we met at a Halloween party, then we all went to a bonfire together and I went back to hers. I’ve seen her a few times since but nothing regular. She’s not my usual type but I like sex so…” She smirked and lifted her arms in a shrug.

Gabriela snorted and shook her head, a smile spreading across her face. “Short and sweet, I like it. Number three please.”
“Okay so, she’s a bit more complicated than two, but nowhere near one. At least I hope.”
There was a beat of silence before Sofia said, “We’re waiting.”
Rio tucked her tongue into her cheek, waiting another few seconds before speaking. “She’s my PhD supervisor.”
All the replies came at once.
“Oh come on!”
“Seriously?”
“Rio!”

Rio held her hands up. “I didn’t plan it!”
“You never do!” Luna teased as she lightly hit Rio on the arm.
“Oh, let me guess, you just tripped and fell into her vagina?” Sofia questioned.
Gabriela just sighed and shook her head again.
“We were both at the event and one thing led to another I guess.” Rio tried to defend herself but her cousins were having none of it.
“Don’t give us that shit.”
“Yeah you’ve been spending extended amounts of time with this woman and you expect us to believe that?”
“You’re telling me that not a single thing happened between you before Friday?”
They were talking over each other again and Rio was just laughing. She knew that this would be how they reacted and was thoroughly enjoying it.
“She looked hot, okay? I’m only human!”
“You’re a fucking menace!” Sofia said as she gently threw a piece of bark she’d ripped off of the log at Rio’s shoe.

Rio picked it up and threw it into the field. “Okay, enough about me. Update me on your love lives. How’s things with Jason?” She asked the question to Gabriela.
“They’re good! He’s just jealous that he doesn’t get to take part in the bet or join us out here.” Gabriela replied with a light chuckle.
“He knows the rules. No joining in with family activities outside of gatherings unless you’re officially part of the family.” Luna said.
“Yeah, so one of you needs to get down on one knee if he wants to stop feeling left out.” Sofia added.

Rio read the look on Gabriela’s face in record time, she could see the uncertainty in her eyes. “Unless you don’t want to get married.”
Gabriela blew out a breath. “I want to get married, I’m just not sure I want to marry him.”
Luna started to stand up. “Okay. If we're gonna unpack this, we’re gonna need more beers. Back in a sec!” And she took off towards the house.

Luna returned a few minutes later with Monty in tow for extra emotional support and she handed a fresh can out to everyone. “Okay, go ahead.”
Gabriela took a deep breath. “When I think of my future with my husband and potentially children, I don’t see Jason being there. We’ve been together for nearly four years and he’s not a bad boyfriend, he’s a really good guy. He supports me, he does housework, we share the cooking and the bills, he’s really attentive… He’s just not what I think of when I think ‘husband’, you know?”

“Do you still love him?” Sofia gently asked.
Gabriela was now absentmindedly stroking Monty’s head. “I love him, I just don’t think I'm in love with him. I don’t think I ever have been. Come to think of it, I don’t think I actually know what being in love feels like. I’m happy with him but I feel like there should be more. And it’s nothing that he’s done. He hasn’t done anything wrong ever, the whole family accepted him pretty much straight away, but something feels like it’s missing.”

Rio listened intently but didn’t offer any advice. She didn’t think that she could offer any advice. She wasn’t exactly a relationship guru given how she avoided them at all costs. Sure she had been in relationships but Cassidy was the only one that lasted for any significant amount of time, and that one clearly ended so well.
She thought about what Gabriela said about not knowing what being in love felt like and Rio could relate to that. She thought she had been in love with Cassidy and then with the few girlfriends she’d had after Cassidy, but was she?

It wasn’t that she thought she was incapable of love. She obviously loved her family deeply and missed them horribly when she was in England.
She thought about her platonic relationships, about Maddy, Chloe and Jesse. She loved each of them in the way one loves their friends but that wasn’t the same as romantic love.
She didn’t truly know what romantic love felt like.

She had experienced the giddy feeling of being around a partner, the feeling of wanting to be near them all the time, and she had definitely experienced the feeling of wanting to rip their clothes off.. But she hadn’t experienced the chest aching, earth shattering, ‘no matter what, I’ll always find you’ type of love that people talk about.
She wasn’t stupid, she knew that love wasn’t always like it is in movies, but she hadn’t even felt anything close to that.

The four of them stayed out there until they had finished their beers and then headed back into the house where the majority of people had already showered and donned the obligatory matching pyjamas. Jason was waiting for Gabriel to be done in the spare bathroom so the four cousins used Rio’s and Camila’s en suites.
Once they were all showered and comfortable in their pyjamas they all reconvened in the living room for a final drink before heading up to bed.

Rio, Sofia and Luna all shared Rio’s room, Camila, Isabella and Luis all had their own rooms, Gabriel and Amelia took the spare room and Gabriela and Jason slept in the living room.
It was the system they’d had worked out since Rio had bought her house and they could also use that. It was the one they were all used to.

Rio laid awake for a while, her brain unable to move on from the fact that she didn’t know what love really was. She really didn’t need an existential crisis right now, and the jetlag wasn’t helping with the difficulty of falling asleep either. She was happy with her life and her choices. Sure the Wanda situation could have been a bit smoother but she didn’t regret any of it. She was happy not being in a relationship, it was easier that way.
It was safer.

__________

Not being entirely sure when she fell asleep or how much sleep she’d had, Rio groggily opened her eyes and peered around her room. Luna and Sofia were still sleeping in their makeshift beds on her floor and daylight was only just beginning to work its way through the gap between her blinds and the wall. She picked up her phone from her bedside table to check the time and had to screw her eyes shut to adjust to the brightness of the screen.

7:32am

She put her phone back and closed her eyes again. There was still about half an hour before her parents and abuela would be getting up to slowly start getting dinner ready and another hour after that until everyone, including Marcus, Lara and Phoebe, would be in the living room for the video call with the family that were still in Puerto Rico.

She laid there with her eyes closed until she heard doors opening down the hall. People were officially on the move. She sighed, resigned to the fact that she wasn’t getting any more sleep and quietly padded to her bathroom, careful not to wake Sofia and Luna. When she had finished brushing her teeth she climbed back into bed and propped herself up against the headboard. She picked her phone up again and opened the band group chat as there were several unread messages.

Each one was a “merry Christmas” message followed by a picture of each of the band members with their families. She assumed the man in Billy’s picture was his dad and smiled as she looked at each picture.

Rio: Merry Christmas nerds! I’ll send a picture when everyone is awake

Billy: How late does your family sleep? It’s 1pm????

Alice: She’s 5 hours behind you idiot!

Alice: Merry Christmas Rio!

Ash: Merry Christmas Rio! Ignore Billy and his dumbness, sleep all you want queen

Eddie: My boyfriend and his smooth brain never fail to amuse. Merry Christmas Rio!

Billy: Don’t bully me, it’s Christmas!

Billy: Merry Christmas Rio!

She laughed quietly to herself as each of the messages came through. Of course Billy would forget that she’s in a different timezone, she shouldn’t have expected anything less.

Not too long later, Luna and Sofia began to stir. Luna opened her eyes and blinked a few times before looking at Rio. “Oh thank fuck you’re awake. I couldn’t deal with your snoring this early in the morning.”
“Fuck you, I don’t snore.”
“Yes you do.” Sofia grumbled, her eyes still closed. “I could fucking feel it through the floor.”
Rio threw a pillow in their direction, not aiming for either of them particularly, just happy to hit one of them. “Merry Christmas to you too, assholes.”
Luna gave a soft “hmph” as the pillow hit her in the stomach. “Feliz Navidad, idiotas.”
Sofia finally opened her eyes. “Merry Christmas, fuckers.”

When Luna and Sofia had both used the bathroom, all three of them shuffled their way downstairs and into the living room. Everyone apart from Camila and Rio’s parents were there as they were hard at work in the kitchen.
“Ah, they're alive!” Lucinda announced as the three of them took up spots on the couch. Monty jumped up to join them, laying across all three of their laps – he was also wearing a pyjama top to match all of the humans.

Isabella wandered into the room a few minutes later. “I have officially been kicked out of the kitchen.” She saw the three newest arrivals to the living room sitting on the sofa. “Good morning you three.” Then to Rio, “Merry Christmas Mija.”
Rio smiled. “Merry Christmas mamá.”
Isabella squeezed herself into a gap on the other sofa. “Marcus texted. They should be here in ten minutes. Who wants to help Camila until then?”
An immediate chorus of “Not it!” followed the question along with everyone's heads, including Monty’s, turning to Rio.
Rio rolled her eyes. “You’re all pussies.” She gave Monty a kiss on the head before she moved him so that she could stand and head into the kitchen.

She could hear her abuela loudly giving instructions to her dad, not quite shouting, but not soft either. She knocked on the doorframe to announce herself. “I heard you might need some help, abuela.”
“¡Oh Río, mi salvadora!” Camila said as she started shooing Luis out of the kitchen.
“I see the willing sacrifice has arrived.” He joked as he walked past her. “Merry Christmas Mija.”
Rio chuckled. “Merry Christmas, Papá.” She walked further into the kitchen. “Where do you want me abuela?”
She spent the remainder of the time until Marcus, Lara and Phoebe arrived following all of the instructions that Camila gave her.

She understood why the others didn’t want to help her. Camila was an amazing cook but she easily got stressed and could become snappy if you weren’t doing things just how she liked them. Rio had learnt how to be the perfect sous chef for her though which is why she was always the one that Camila either requested or the others sent.

Upon hearing Marcus announce their arrival, Rio and Camila left the kitchen to re-join everyone in the living room. Monty had reassumed his position as Phoebe’s personal guardian and Gabriela was linking her laptop to the TV for the call that would be happening shortly.

When everyone was ready, they hit the call button and within a few seconds, the faces of the family members that were still in Puerto Rico were splashed across the TV screen.
“¡Feliz Navidad!” Everyone shouted in unison and then the chaotic Spanglish began.
Phoebe was lifted in front of the camera like baby Simba in The Lion King so that she could be seen and fawned over. She had a onesie that matched everyone’s pyjamas, even the family in Puerto Rico wore the same pyjamas.
All of Rio’s family took tradition very seriously.

Rio got everyone's attention and moved to the corner of the room, holding her phone up in selfie mode to snap a picture of everybody. “On three, everyone say ‘merry Christmas.” She counted down and everyone said it in unison as she took the picture.
She sat back down and sent it to the chat with her cousins so that they all had it, then she sent it to the band chat.

Rio: Obligatory family picture!

Ash: Stop it! Even the dog is matching you all 😭I’m obsessed, merry Christmas to your familia

Eddie: Tell everyone feliz navidad from me!

Alice: That is the cutest baby I’ve ever seen! Also your family is huge holy fuck merry christmas Rio’s family!

Billy: Look at the goodest boy wearing his pyjamas, merry christmas everyone. Especially the dog!

Rio: Tell your families I say merry Christmas too! Now get off your phones!

She also sent the picture to her chat with Maddy, Chloe and Jesse and then she was faced with a dilemma. Should she say merry Christmas to Agatha and Wanda?
Technically she had covered Wanda off with telling Billy to say it so she could get away with that, but should she message Agatha?
They hadn’t messaged at all since Friday so would it be weird to do it now?
Normally Rio wouldn’t even think about a one night stand in any capacity, but Agatha was different. She was her supervisor first and they were sort of friends.
Fuck it. What harm could it do?

She sent the message to Agatha, put her phone down and thought no more of it.
The family call lasted around an hour before everyone said their goodbyes and Camila beckoned Rio back to the kitchen.
Camila put Rio to work straight away, asking her to check on the pork shoulder in the oven before handing her a knife and some plantains to slice.

They worked in comfortable silence with Camila occasionally muttering to herself as she flitted around the kitchen.
The silence was broken when Camila said, “It’s such a shame that I passed my cooking skills on to you and you have no one to cook for.”
Rio rolled her eyes, but not because she was mad, she was just tired of her choice to remain single being questioned by her family. She knew they always meant well, but after a few years it started to get tedious. “I told you abuela, I’m focusing on my studies. I’m not looking for a relationship right now.”

Camila reached out and put her hand on Rio’s to stop her slicing. “Cariño, how will you know if you’ve found the right person if you’re putting all of your time and effort into your work? I know the others haven’t worked out but the perfect woman is out there. You won’t find her if you’re not looking.”
Damn Rio had not expected Christmas to get this deep. First Gabriela was considering breaking up with Jason, then Rio spiralled about whether or not she had ever actually been in love and now her abuela was giving her a pep talk in the kitchen about finding the perfect woman.

Rio picked the knife back up and resumed slicing the plantains. “Okay, I see your point.” She said, hoping agreeing would get them off this topic. “I suppose I could amend my study schedule to allow time to meet people.”
Camila narrowed her eyes which made Rio laugh. “I will amend my schedule to allow time to meet people.”
“Better!” Camilla moved to the cooker to check the various pans that were sitting on it and they continued to work until it was time for Luis to come start preparing the desserts.

Everyone slowly got changed out of their pyjamas, only changing into comfy clothes but clothes nonetheless. Marcus and Lara had brought theirs and Phoebe's clothes with them and used the spare room to get changed – Monty guarded the door while they were in there. When they came back down, Phoebe was wearing a Santa's elf onesie and a multitude of pictures were taken of her. They put her on the floor as she had just started to crawl and she curiously explored the living room, looking at everything with the awe that only a baby could have.

She soon found Monty’s tail and was enraptured by the fluff. They all watched with smiles as she gently put her hands on his fur and tried to bury her tiny hands under it. He started wagging his tail and she squealed with joy which startled him. He didn’t know that it was a happy squeal and not one of fright or pain, so he got to his feet to sniff and inspect her but she took off after his tail again which led to a hilarious game of chase between them.

They walked/crawled in circles until Rio gently held Monty’s face. “She’s okay bud, you can relax.” She said whilst laughing and kissed him on the head. He looked back towards Phoebe who was now making her way towards his feet. He gave her a final sniff before deciding that she wasn’t in any immediate danger and laying down again, letting her play with his feet and fur as much as she wanted.

A few hours later everyone gathered around the huge table in the dining room which was now adorned with plates upon plates of food that Camila, Isabella and Rio had prepared through the morning. Monty still had his place at the head of the table and was patiently waiting for his command to begin eating. Camila said grace and they all tucked in.
The drinks flowed and the conversation matched it, flitting between topics of nothing and everything all at the same time. Multiple conversations happening at once between the thirteen of them, people dipping in and out as certain words and sentences caught their attention.

Gabriel was sitting next to Jason and started grilling him about when he was going to propose to his daughter. “Luis proposed after a year, me and Marcus proposed after two. You’re nearly at four now, gotta get your head in the game!”
Amelia nudged Gabriela. “Doesn’t have to be Jason, you could get on one knee.”
“No, no. Proposing is a man’s job!” Gabriel said, waving his hand as if to bat the comment out of the air.
“Well there’s no hope for Rio then.” Lara jokingly said around her glass.

Rio noticed how uncomfortable Gabriela was getting after their conversation about this very thing the previous night and decided to shift the focus. “Sounds like you want to propose to Jason there, tío. Anything you want to tell us?”
Gabriel screwed his face up and Jason joined in with the joke. “I’m a big diamond kinda guy Gabriel, just so you know. But you’ll have to wear the dress, I don’t have the hips.”

Gabriel put his hands up to stop anyone else from adding on. “Okay I get it, I’ll stop asking!”
Rio looked towards Gabriela who mouthed, “thank you,” to her and the various threads of conversation picked back up again.

After the main course and sides were done, Luis presented his desserts and then they reconvened in the living room to unwrap the presents. The majority of them were for Phoebe. Various new sets of clothes and toys and some things to store away for the teething stage.
Monty also got some toys and a bandana printed with the Puerto Rican flag, which was immediately put around his neck.
Rio snapped a picture of him sitting proudly and set it as her lock screen.

The rest of the day passed with the same lazy energy. People splitting up into different rooms and wandering between them.
Marcus and Lara helped with the clean up before they said their goodbyes and left to put Phoebe to bed.
Rio, Gabriela, Luna and Sofia went outside again to wind down but the conversation was kept light as they shared their joints and beers.

People started to slowly trickle upstairs to bed and Jason and Gabriela turned the sofas into their beds again for the night.
The house quieted and Rio checked her phone for the first time since that morning.
There was a single message.

Agatha: Merry Christmas, Rio

__________

Rio waited until Marcus texted her to let her know that they’d gone and thanked her for letting them use her house before she drove home.
It was early afternoon so she had a few hours to get ready to go out with her friends in the evening.
She showered, changed her sheets and did some odd bits of cleaning around the house before she got dressed to meet her friends.

The restaurant was a half an hour walk from her house but she opted to do it so that she didn’t have to watch how much she was drinking with the meal, knowing that she would get carried away with the spirit and didn’t want to be an irresponsible driver.

When she got there, Maddy and Kate were already seated and Maddy waved her over to their table. Rio gave both of them a hug and sat opposite Kate.
Maddy placed a glass in front of her. “Jesse and Chloe are a few minutes away so I ordered a round.”
Rio raised an eyebrow. “How do you know what I wanted to drink?”
“Because we’ve been friends since high school. We share a brain cell you moron.”
Rio raised her glass and knocked it against Maddy’s before taking a sip and tasting the rum and coke as it hit her tongue. “Ahh, you know me so well.”
“Nice to hear you finally admit it.” Maddy smirked.

Chloe and Jesse walked in and headed straight for the table, Chloe sat next to Rio and Jesse sat next to Kate, and they immediately took a sip of the drinks that were put in front of them.
“How was everyone’s Christmas?” Jesse asked.
“Kate is now officially my parents' favourite daughter.” Maddy said with fake annoyance.
“I was just being nice!” Kate defended. “I wanted to show that I was grateful for them letting me join you for the day.”
Chloe’s eyes went wide. “Please don’t tell me you told her dad that his rancid eggnog was nice.” She said to Kate.
Kate looked between them all. “What was I supposed to do? Tell the truth?”
A unanimous response of “yes!” came from everyone’s mouths and then they all laughed.

Maddy put her hand on Kate's shoulder. “I tried to warn her, but she didn’t listen.”
“Hold up,” Jesse said. “You guys make me drink it as some kinda sick initiation but Kate gets warned against it? How’s that fair?”
Chloe reached out to gently hold Jesse’s hand. “Life’s not fair, Jessekins. It’s one of the lessons we must learn.”
He flipped her the bird and turned to Rio. “Tell us what we’re all dying to know. Who won the bet this time?”
“Who has two thumbs and sixty dollars?” She pointed both of her thumbs towards herself and leaned back in her chair. “This guy.”
“Hell yeah!” Maddy high fived Rio. “It’s about time Marcus lost.” Then she noticed the confused look on Kate’s face. “Rio’s uncle is slightly homophobic so her and her cousins make a bet every time the family is together on how long it’ll take him to say something homophobic.” She explained.

Kate’s brows dipped further. “Do you do this every time your family is together?”
“Pretty much yeah.” Rio took a sip of her drink before continuing. “If it’s a multiple day event, like Christmas, we only do it on one day. And he’s gotten a lot less homophobic over the last couple of decades. He has some phrases and things that are his go-tos so we've had to ban a lot of them from being winners, but he always manages to come up with something.”
Kate nodded, still confused but starting to accept it. “I guess if he’s gonna say it anyway, you might as well monetise it.”
“Exactly!”

Chloe and Jesse told the group about their Christmases and they all ordered their food.
They were at the restaurant for a few hours, having a general catch up and finding out more about Kate. She opened up a bit about her family, not giving too much detail but giving the group some basic knowledge. She told them that she moved to Virginia because she stopped talking to them but didn’t elaborate further than that and no one pushed for more information, all seemingly having the same thought of ‘she’ll tell us when she’s ready.’

They split the bill evenly and left a healthy tip for the staff before all making their way to Maddy’s house. Rio took a detour to her own house to pick up the joints that she had rolled ahead of time along with the Secret Santa gift that she had bought, and met them all at Maddy’s.
They attempted to make plans for new years and ended up leaving it as a pencilled in road trip to New York to watch the ball drop, but in reality they would probably end up doing exactly what they were currently doing and watching the ball drop on TV.

They exchanged their Secret Santa presents and none of them were serious. Rio unwrapped the one with her name on it. It was a Puerto Rican flag in the lesbian pride flag colours. “You could hang that off your balcony in England so that all of the queer women know where to go.” Jesse said.
She draped it around her shoulders. “I think it works better as a cape. They can just follow me home then.”
“I like your thinking, Vidal.”

Maddy went next and she opened an envelope to reveal a Lovehoney gift card with the message “Now you can actually go fuck yourself” typed onto the cardboard sleeve that the card came in. “Aww you guys.” She faked a crack in her voice and pretended to wipe tears from her eyes. “You know me so well!”
Kate unwrapped her gift and pulled out a toy archery set with a surprisingly sturdy looking plastic bow, three arrows that had suckers on the end of them and a target to pin to the wall. “Now I can finally live my Olympic dreams! Thank you Santa.”

Chloe picked up the brown cardboard box that had her name written on it. “Damn, Santa couldn’t afford wrapping paper?” She asked to the room before opening it. She pulled a piece of paper and read what was on it. “Since you can’t drive a real car, I figured you could ride this to work.”
“Oh fuck yeah! I can’t wait to take this baby for a spin on the interstate!" She said as she pulled out a toy car and a controller.

Jesse was the last to open his present. He chaotically ripped the paper and the gifts fell to the floor. He picked up the one closest to him and flipped it over. It was a grow your own girlfriend kit which made Rio nearly wet herself from laughing. “Whoever did this, I will pay for your drinks every time we go out!” She announced, hoping the culprit would reveal themselves but no one owned up to it, they were all too busy laughing as well.
The second gift was a travel mug that said ‘Born To Slay, Forced To Work’ in pink cursive writing.

“I love when you guys listen to me when I talk.” He had told them not to buy him a travel mug as he had more of those than he did actual mugs at this point, so naturally it guaranteed that he’d get one. “I think I’ll grow my girlfriend in this mug, it can be her home.”
“You can’t keep her cooped up in there, she needs space to roam!” Maddy laughed.
“Yeah you need to be a responsible girlfriend owner.” Chloe added.
He balled up two separate bits of wrapping paper and threw one at each of them.

With the gifts now done, Rio passed out the joints. “I made these with love so you all better appreciate them.”
Kate took the joint that Rio handed to her. “What does ‘made them with love’ mean?” She asked, slightly sceptical.
“It means we’re about to get fucked.” Chloe said before flicking the lighter and sparking her joint.

Maddy turned on the TV and hit play on Planet Earth for background noise as they smoked and chatted absolute shit.
Chloe found some batteries for her toy car and started whizzing it around the living room, crashing into everything that was available.
Rio unfolded the target that came with Kate’s archery set and pinned it to a wall that wasn’t near anything breakable. “Okay Robin Hood, flex those archery muscles.” She said as she stepped out of the way.

Kate stood as reasonable of a distance from the target as she could given that they were in Maddy’s house and not a space specifically built for archery like she was used to.
She tested the string on the bow a couple of times before knocking one of the arrows and drawing the bow. She took a slow breath and released the string.

Rio, her joint resting between her lips, watched the arrow fly towards the target and land perfectly in the middle. “Holy shit!”
“I’m not done.” Kate simply stated as she knocked the second arrow and repeated the process. It landed just above the first one.
She knocked the third and final arrow and sent it through the air to land just below the first one.
Rio just stood there for a moment, mouth open in awe while Kate removed the arrows from the target with a smug smile. “I told you I was good.” She said with a shrug. “Of course I’m used to specific bows and actual arrows, but the basic mechanics are the same.” She walked back to the spot that she had fired from. “Your turn.” She held out the bow and arrows to Rio.

Rio stepped up and swapped places with Kate, taking the bow and arrows from her and handing her the joint instead. “Prepare to be embarrassed.”
Rio tried her best to mimic the stance that Kate had taken and to repeat the movements she’d seen her use, knocking the arrow, drawing it back and taking a slow breath. She loosed the arrow and it hit the target at an odd angle and fell to the floor.
Kate tried to stifle her laughter. “You’re right, that was pretty embarrassing.”
Rio picked up the second arrow. “I’m just warming up, give me a sec.”
Kate crossed her arms and raised her eyebrows, but she didn’t say anything else.

Rio knocked the second arrow and drew the bow, taking a little longer to line the shot up before releasing it. The arrow went wide and hit the wall, it stuck this time though.
Kate stepped forwards before Rio could knock the third arrow. “Okay, watching this is painful. Let me help you.” She moved behind Rio and told her to knock the arrow and lift the bow without drawing it.
Rio followed the instructions and waited for Kate to tell her what to do next.

Kate gently covered Rio’s hands with her own, lifting the bow a little higher and then slowly pulling back on the string. “Obviously this is a very cheaply made toy, and the draw weight is practically non-existent, but this kind of tension on the string is what you’re aiming for.” She removed her hands from where they were covering Rio’s and said, “Don’t move.”
She gently moved the arm that was pulling the string towards Rio’s cheek a bit more and tipped her elbow upwards just a touch.
“When aiming you have to account for the drop. So you wanna aim just a bit higher than where you want to arrow to land.” She moved the arm holding the bow proper a little higher than where Rio was originally aiming it.

Kate dropped her hand from Rio’s again. “Take a nice, deep breath and when I say ‘release’ I want you to let both the breath and the arrow go.”
Rio slowly breathed in through her nose, feeling her lungs inflate.
She felt Kate lean in close behind her, her breath ticking the shell of her ear.
In a whisper, Kate said, “Release.”
Rio breathed out at the same time she let go of the arrow and watched it sail straight to the middle of the target and stick there.
“Look at that. You’re a natural.” Kate was still behind her and speaking softly in her ear.
Rio turned her head to look over the shoulder where Kate was. “It helps to have a good teacher.”

They held each other’s gaze for a moment, neither moving until there was a loud cough from the living room behind them. They both turned towards the noise.
Maddy had a plume of smoke around her as she continued to cough. She absolutely could have been coughing because of the joint, but Rio suspected that she had been watching them and wanted them to break apart.

Rio stepped away and collected the arrows before handing them and the bow back to Kate. “I feel like you need a challenge.” She unpinned the target and moved it higher so that the middle was just above the top of her head and stood in front of it. “Let’s see how good your aim really is.”
A smile slowly spread its way across Kate’s face. She nodded. “Okay.”
She picked up the joint from where it had been resting in an ash tray and took a hit before knocking an arrow and drawing the bow.
Rio smirked. “Don’t miss.”
“I never do.”

She released the arrow and it landed perfectly in the centre circle above Rio’s head. “Don’t move.” She said as Rio started to turn to look at the target, but upon the instruction, Rio turned back again.
Kate knocked and fired the remaining two arrows and each one landed right next to Rio’s ears.
Maybe she was just really high, but Rio felt a rush from Kate shooting the arrows at her. Obviously they wouldn’t do any damage if they hit her, but knowing that they could hit her made her stomach clench.
Rio didn’t move as Kate collected the arrows. Neither of them spoke but they maintained eye contact as Kate pulled them free from the target and then they returned to the living room.

Jessie turned towards them as they entered the room. “Damn it, I was hoping that Rio would have one of those arrows stuck to the middle of her forehead.”
“It could still happen.” Kate said with a smirk as she sat next to Rio on the sofa.
They all stayed there for another couple of hours, making sure the joints were as used as they could be before Chloe and Jesse said that they were going to head home.
Maddy, Rio and Kate hugged them goodbye and told them to text when they were home.

Maddy asked Rio to help her clean up by taking the ends of the joints into the kitchen to throw away and put the ash trays in the sink for her to wash the next day. “If you’re too high to walk home, you can crash down here. But Rio I swear to god if I hear you in that spare room at any point so fucking help me.”
Rio defensively held up her hands. “Okay, okay. You will not hear me in the spare room.”
“Good.” They walked back into the living room and Maddy announced that she was going to bed and shot Rio a look that said “behave”.

Rio saluted her before dropping back onto the couch next to Kate.
“Are you staying over too?” Kate asked.
“Nah, my house is only round the corner. I’ll walk back when I’m a little more sober.”
“Well I’m not gonna leave you down here by yourself. What do you want to do?”
Rio had a few answers to that question and all of them would piss Maddy off, which made them incredibly hard to resist. She looked into Kate’s eyes. “Whatever you want.”
Kate grabbed the collar of Rio’s shirt and pulled her towards herself, crashing their lips together and immediately trying to sweep her tongue into Rio’s mouth, which Rio allowed.

Kate grabbed Rio’s waist and pulled her so that she was sitting in her lap, never breaking the kiss. Okay so maybe Kate’s archery muscles were more than just metaphorical.
Rio felt Kate undoing her jeans and slowly sliding her hand beneath the waistband and had to fight to keep her volume down when Kate started slowly circling her clit through her boy shorts.

Rio always came harder when she was high and this time was no different. She had to bury her face in the back of the settee to dampen the noises that she made and the second time, Kate had to kiss her to keep her quiet.
“Damn, I wish we could be somewhere where you didn’t have to be quiet so I could hear you properly.” Kate said in a hushed voice as she was slowing her movements to help Rio come down.
“I know a great place to put my mouth where I won’t be heard.” Rio smirked as she started to slowly back her way off of Kate’s lap, pulling Kate’s pants down as she went.

__________

Rio made her excuses to leave, which Kate accepted easier than Rio thought she would, and made her way home.

The next few weeks were filled with spending more time with her family and friends.
She did some work at the vineyard which her parents insisted on paying her for.
She went out a few more times with her friends and ended up taking a couple of detours to Kate’s apartment on her way home.
She stopped by a local piercing shop and got herself a Christmas present.
The weeks seemed to fly by and it wasn’t long before she was back at the airport waiting for her flight to England to start the new semester of university. 

Chapter End Notes

10/10 recommend getting high and watching David Attenborough btw

Chapter 24: Agatha

Chapter Notes

I made a twitter so you can all yell at me on there if you want
@P4ravato

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Agatha stared at the closed door for an unknown amount of time. She couldn’t move, she was rooted to the spot on the floor where she was standing. Every part of her felt numb and her eyes were stinging. It wasn’t until she tasted the salt on her lips that she realised it was because she was crying. But she wasn’t crying because she was sad.
No.
She was fucking angry.

She was angry at Rio for sleeping with Wanda. She was angry at Wanda for still managing to have this effect on her. And most of all, she was angry at herself for feeling anything at all.
Her and Rio were nothing. They weren’t in a relationship, Rio wasn’t cheating on her. She was Rio’s god damn PhD supervisor for fucks sake.
This should never have happened.

As a professor she had a duty of care over all of her students, no matter how old they were. And she had violated that by allowing herself to develop feelings for, and then sleeping with, Rio.
This could never happen again and she would make sure of it.

Eventually she was able to move her legs again and take herself back upstairs. She walked back into her bedroom and saw her dress still crumpled on the floor.
That fucking dress.
She should have known better than to wear the dress that she wore for her and Wanda’s engagement party again, it was smothered in the bad luck that their past relationship held and had brought more bad luck the second that she let it adorn her body again.

She peeled back her quilt and crawled into bed, pulling the quilt back over herself until it settled just under her chin. She didn’t even bother attempting to sleep, there was no way that she could right now. Sex usually made her very sleepy but that message on Rio’s phone was burned into her brain and she saw it every time she blinked.
How long had whatever Wanda and Rio were doing been going on?
She didn’t want to think about it but she couldn’t think of anything else right now.

The rational part of her brain knew that she could get answers if she asked either of them, but she would rather die than talk to Wanda about this and did she have a right to ask Rio?
Once again, they weren’t in a relationship, they were both single and free to sleep with whoever they wanted. But did Rio have to be sleeping with Wanda? Of all the fucking people? Was Wanda even the only other person she was sleeping with?

Agatha knew there was no possible way that Rio could know about her past with Wanda so no part of her thought that Rio had done this maliciously. And Wanda had no way of knowing that Agatha felt the way that she did about Rio, so for once she couldn’t just out and out blame Wanda. But she was angry and she needed to direct that anger somewhere… So she sent it inwards.

She was the one that had let herself develop feelings for a thirty year old student. She was the one that had allowed that thirty year old student to get to know her and worm her way into her brain. She had been the one who had decided to go to the ball and let herself get close to Rio throughout the night. She was the one who let Rio walk her home and invited Rio into her house. Rio had given her a chance to back out when she’d asked how far Agatha wanted it to go, but Agatha had given Rio the go ahead because she decided to ignore the voice in her head that tried to remind her exactly why it was a bad idea.

The voice was right.
The voice was always right.
And now here she was lying in bed feeling so fucking hurt by something that she could have avoided if she had just listened to it. Well she wouldn’t be ignoring it again. It kept her safe, it kept her out of situations like this.
She had ignored it when she started her relationship with Wanda and that left her with four years of time wasted on a relationship that was never going to last and nearly three years of dealing with the fallout of that relationship.

Of course those four years had given her Billy and she wouldn’t change that for the world. She would have still met him if she hadn’t gotten with Wanda, he would have still been at the university taking her module, but she wouldn’t know him.
She wouldn’t know what an amazing kid he was and what a wonderful young man he was growing to be.
So ignoring the voice did have its perks, but at this point Agatha wasn’t sure if they outweighed the detriments. Were the perks worth the suffering?

In this case the perks – sleeping with Rio – definitely were not worth the suffering – finding out that Rio was also sleeping with her ex fiancée.
Agatha ran her hands down her face and groaned. This wasn’t how the night was supposed to go.
In an ideal world her and Rio would be laying next to each other right now and Agatha would have her head on Rio’s chest while Rio wrapped her arm around her and they’d drift off to sleep together, but Rio had to leave so that she could catch her flight.

Now though, Agatha was wondering if that was just an excuse to not spend the night. If Rio was sleeping with multiple women did she choose whose bed she would wake up in the following morning? Was Wanda's bed her bed of choice? Would it ever be Agatha’s?
She shook her head.
No. That didn’t matter because it was never happening again. Agatha wasn’t going to let Rio have that choice.
Rio was her student and she was Rio’s supervisor. That’s how this started and that’s how this was going to stay.

__________

Agatha managed to sleep in short, restless bursts and the final time she woke up she could hear the birds outside her bedroom window. Her blackout curtains were doing their job but there was no mistaking the line of daylight that was pushing its way over the top of them. She sighed knowing that there was no chance of getting any more sleep now that she was aware of the sun having risen. She swung her legs off of the bed and headed for her bathroom, throwing her robe over the back of the chair that was pushed under her dresser.

She turned the shower on while she brushed her teeth so that it could warm up before she stepped under the steady steam of water. In the mirror she saw the faint bruises on her breasts, echoes of where Rio’s mouth had been the previous night.
The heat of the shower burned her skin in the exact way she was hoping it would as she let it run down the front of her torso for a moment before turning so that her back was under the water.
She breathed in sharply as the heat stung her back and she was reminded of the scratches that Rio’s clipped nails had left behind as she came around Agatha’s fingers.

She remembered the feeling of Rio’s teeth on her inner thigh and Agatha couldn’t help but think about the way Rio felt writhing beneath her, the sounds she made when Agatha curled her fingers or the way her thighs shook when she was close.
Agatha felt a heat separate from the temperature of the water settle low in her stomach but when she closed her eyes, the image of Wanda’s message flashed in her mind and she tore her eyes open again.
Why couldn’t she have one thing in her life that wasn’t tainted by that woman?

She finished her shower and put some comfy clothes on, leaving her hair to air dry as she stripped her bed and took the bedding and her dress downstairs to throw in the washing machine. She started brewing a coffee while she unzipped the covers of her sofa cushions and threw them in the washer with her bedding and dress and turned it on.
She hadn't decided if she was going to keep the dress or throw it out yet, that was something she could think about later.

She sat in her kitchen since her couch cushions were currently coverless and sipped her coffee whilst she had music playing in the background, until she remembered the fact that her phone was still in her bag which was in the living room. She got up and retrieved her bag, pulling out her phone that was currently out of charge.
She plugged it into the charger that lived in the kitchen and leant against the counter as she powered it up.

Once it had come to life a slew of messages from Lilia and Jen popped up, all of them asking how the night had gone. She would reply to them in a bit as there were two other messages that caught her eye. One was from Billy, thanking her again for going to the ball and for putting up with his mum for as long as she had.
The other was from Wanda.

Wanda: When did Billy tell you about his relationship with Eddie?

Agatha gave a short, sharp “Ha!” as she read the message.
Did Wanda send this before or after she sent her, presumably, almost nude to Rio?
She could ignore it and not reply, it would be easy as she had ignored Wanda’s messages many times before. But the lack of sleep and unstable emotions were making her feel a little chaotic at present.

Agatha: I told you, he’s been round for dinner a few times the past couple of months. He told me during one of them.

She put her phone down and sipped her coffee while she waited for Wanda’s reply and for the first time in nearly three years, she hoped it would come fast.
If she was going to spend the day being bullied by her thoughts, why wouldn’t she take the opportunity to also cause some discomfort to one of the reasons her thoughts were attacking her?

Wanda: How many times has he been for dinner and when?

Agatha: Are you asking me because he’s not telling you?

Wanda: Just answer the questions, Agatha.

Oh, Agatha was getting to her. This was going to be fun.

Agatha: Why should I? If Billy hasn’t told you then I’m not going to violate his privacy. Besides, keeping secrets runs in your family, does it not?

Wanda: Are you fucking serious? I’m trying to look out for my son!

Agatha: Yes, because he’s always been so unsafe with me.

It would have been easy to mention that she wasn’t the one who put him in hospital a year ago but it would have been incredibly cheap and a ridiculously low blow – especially since that hadn’t been Wanda’s fault. She had never been a reckless driver and even the most experienced can’t do much against a patch of black ice. And Agatha had assured her of such in the days following the accident when she had been in the hospital to support Wanda.
She might be having fun toying with the woman right now, but she wasn’t going to stoop lower than she had to.

Wanda: You know, last night made me think that maybe you were starting to put my mistakes in the past. But you’re still choosing to punish me, and you’re using Billy to do it.

Agatha ground her teeth while she typed out her message.

Agatha: If Billy is keeping things from you, it is not my place to tell you. If it was something that I thought you needed to know because it actually affected his safety, I would tell you without a second thought. However, him spending time with me and rebuilding our relationship isn’t something that is cause for concern. He is eighteen years old and if there are things that he is cautious about telling you, maybe you should reflect on why that is instead of trying to blame me. Though that is your go-to when you don’t want to face reality, isn’t it?

How had Wanda still not realised that she is the one who soured Billy’s view of her? That her own actions are the cause of these consequences? She was clearly hurt by the fact that Billy told Agatha things and not her, but Agatha wasn’t going to break the trust that her and Billy were starting to rebuild by passing information on to Wanda that he clearly wasn’t ready for her to know, unless she absolutely had to.

Wanda: How many times can I say I made a mistake, I fucked up, I ruined my relationships with you and with Billy because I was scared? I need your help with Billy because he listens to you, he always has. I know he loves me but he always held you in a higher regard and I will admit that I was jealous of that. I really don’t want him to be caught in the middle of our shit, but he always will be and we can’t escape that. I just want my son to trust me again and I need your help. Please Agatha.

Agatha stared at her phone, reading and re-reading the message over and over, her coffee left to go cold on the counter.
Was Wanda aware that she had never actually used the words “I’m sorry”?
She had said that she’d fucked up, made mistakes, ruined things time and time again. But she had never actually apologised.
Wanda saying that she had done it because she was scared was new though, she’d never said that before.
Scared of what? Being happy? Scared of not having to raise a teenager essentially by herself? Scared of Billy having an additional parent figure who would love and care for him?
What the fuck was she scared of?

Agatha: I told him that we had reached a point of civility like you asked, my part is done. If you want his trust back then you have to do that work yourself. He’ll tell you about Eddie when he’s ready and you can’t force him to do it before he is. It’s not hard, Wanda.

Wanda: He told me about Eddie last night and introduced me to him and their friends

Agatha: Well what the fuck are you whining about then? Get a grip.

She put her phone down on the counter and immediately swiped the notification of Wanda’s next text off of the screen. Agatha already knew that Wanda was jealous of how close she had been with Billy before she had said it a few minutes ago, but that wasn’t Agatha’s problem. She couldn’t change that.
She took a final drink of her coffee, forgetting that it had cooled significantly, before screwing her face up and pouring the rest down the sink.

She spent the next several hours pottering about her house, doing random bits of cleaning and putting fresh sheets on her bed. When her cushion covers were dry she put them back on her settee and ironed her bed sheets and dress before returning them upstairs. She still hadn’t made a decision on the fate of the dress so she hung it back in her wardrobe and closed the door. Out of sight, out of mind.

She pulled up outside Jen’s house ready to go in for dinner, but took a few moments to mentally prepare herself for the barrage of questions that were likely to come her way since she still hadn’t replied to any of her friends’ messages.
She turned her car off and took a deep breath before getting out and heading through the front door.

She hung her coat up on one of the hooks by the door and followed the sounds of voices into the kitchen.
Lilia saw her first as Jen was stirring a pan on the cooker. “There’s our dirty stop out. Too busy to reply to our texts?” She asked while moving her eyebrows up and down.
Agatha leaned against the counter next to Lilia. “Nope. I just left my phone in my bag and my bag downstairs. Then I figured there was no point in replying since we’d all be here tonight anyway.” She pulled a glass out of one of the cupboards and got herself some water.

Jen stopped stirring the pan, which Agatha could now see had rice in it, and turned to face her. “So what? You just got home, put your bag down and went straight to bed?”
Agatha shrugged. “It was late and I was tired.” She said around her glass.
Lilia’s eyes narrowed and Agatha thanked every possible iteration of god that Rio hadn’t left any marks on the skin that was currently visible.
“So you went to the ball, stayed for the whole thing, and nothing significant happened?” Lilia asked.
“Correct.”
Lilia hummed. “Alright, keep your secrets. But you know they don’t stay kept around me for very long, Agatha Harkness.”
Agatha just smiled innocently and started pulling plates out of the cupboard for Jen to dish the food onto.

They took their plates to the table and poured their wine. Agatha felt the corners of her mouth begin to tick upwards as she remembered Rio teaching her how to properly taste wine less twenty four hours earlier. But the second that she felt the tiny moment of happiness, the message on Rio’s phone flashed forwards and the corners of her mouth dropped again.
Any thoughts of Rio from the previous night were now sullied by Wanda and whatever she and Rio were to each other.

Lilia raised her glass. “I think we should raise a toast to Agatha for going to a university event for the first time in three years and not getting arrested for killing her co-workers.”
Jen raised her glass as well and Agatha raised hers but not before rolling her eyes. They knocked their glasses together and took a sip.
“It wasn’t without its challenges though. Some idiot thought it would be a good idea to sit me next to Wanda for the night.”
Jen nearly choked on her wine. “Excuse me?” She stuttered whilst coughing.
“Yeah I pretty much had the same reaction when I saw it.” Agatha said with a slight chuckle.

Lilia moved her food to the side of her mouth so that she could speak. “And how did that go?”
Agatha moved her curry around her plate for a moment before taking a spoonful of it and eating it. Both Lilia and Jen waited for her reply. “It was okay actually. Billy was in a band of students that played a set, so Wanda and I sat together and watched them. He still plays the guitar I bought him and he’s gotten even better than I remember him being.” She looked down at her plate and smiled softly. “We mostly just reminisced about him begging for guitar lessons and then an actual guitar. And she actually told the rest of the people at our table that I had been the one to buy them for him.”

Jen and Lilia’s eyebrows were trying to join their hairlines when Agatha looked back up. “If the wind changes, your faces will stay like that.” She mumbled.
“Sorry.” Lilia said whilst shaking her head, seemingly to reset her brain. “But you can see why that would be shocking, surely.”
Agatha blew out a breath. “Oh, I’m aware. I didn’t know how to react when she said it. I just nodded.”
Jen had managed to speak again. “Did you spend the whole night with her?”
“No, just the half hour that the band was playing and the meal. I didn’t want to be around her for any longer than I had to.”
They both nodded and there were a few moments of quiet while they all ate some more of their food.

“So what did you do with the time you weren’t having to suffer Wanda’s presence?” Lilia asked as she sipped her wine.
Agatha knew what they were doing. They weren’t outwardly asking about Rio because they wanted to give her the chance to bring it up herself. She respected it and was glad that they hadn’t gone in all guns blazing right from the get go, but they were too obvious about it.
“I know you’re trying to subtly prompt me to mention Rio, but you're both failing on the subtle part.” She had another mouthful of her food. “If you must know, yes I spent some time with her throughout the night. She was one of the members of the band, actually. But nothing happened, we just talked and had a few drinks.”

“That’s something though! You spent time together off campus in a more relaxed setting.” Jen said excitedly. “Did you mention the fact that you’re ridiculously rich or…?”
“Jennifer!” Lilia cut in. “Please tell me that you didn’t actually follow her terrible advice.”
Agatha laughed. “No I definitely did not. I might be embarrassingly inept when it comes to talking to women but even I can recognise that that is a fucking horrific idea.”
“Well it seems there’s some hope for you still!” Lilia joked.

Agatha’s recount of the night seemed to sate their interests, even with her omission of some very specific details, and the conversation geared more towards Billy for a bit. They asked how he was and how things were going regarding rebuilding their relationship. She told them that it was looking positive and she told them about her conversation with Wanda earlier in the day. They all agreed that Wanda was pathetic for asking Agatha to help parent her teenager when his lack of trust in her was a direct result of things that she had done.

“Do you think she knows that just repeating ‘I made a mistake’, and an apology, are actually two different things?” Jen asked as she refilled her glass.
“I would genuinely love to be present the next time the two of you talk so I can figure out what the fuck is going on in her head.” Lilia said as she handed her glass to Jen for her to top up.
Jen poured the wine into Lilia’s glass. “You could do a couples therapy thing for them. But, you know, for ex-couples.”
Agatha drained the last of her wine and also passed Jen her glass. “Yeah I’m gonna say no to that.”
“You don’t want me to figure out what's going on in her head?”
“Oh I very much do. But I do not want to do therapy with that woman, I’ve heard enough of her lies to last me a lifetime.” Agatha stood from her seat at the table and started gathering the empty plates and cutlery.

There was also the fact that Agatha wasn’t sure she’d be able to resist bringing Rio up if she was actually face to face with Wanda, and she wanted Lilia and Jen to know about those two less than she wanted them to know that she slept with Rio. It was all too complicated right now and she needed to figure it out in her own time first before she let them know.
She loaded the plates and cutlery into the dishwasher and washed her hands.

She watched the water pour over her hands, the thought of Wanda and Rio once again at the forefront of her mind. Why did this have to happen to her?
The first woman that she had felt anything for in a long time was also sleeping with her ex fiancée. The universe had a sick sense of humour.
Of course she wouldn’t be allowed to be happy. Obviously she wouldn’t be allowed to find something good. Her mother, and later her step father, had told her time and time again that she was evil and deserved to be treated as such.
The universe agreed apparently.

Why did it have to be Wanda? Why did she have to find out mere moments after her and Rio had had sex?
Why?
Why?
WHY?

Agatha’s spiral was interrupted by Jen’s voice coming from the dining room. “You’re running that tap like you pay the water bill!”
She had forgotten where she was and what she was doing until the sound startled her and made her jump slightly.
Shit. How long had she been standing there?
She quickly scrubbed some soap over her hands, unsure if she’d actually done it or not, and said over her shoulder, “Sorry, just trying to get the curry stains out from under my nails.” She shut the tap off and grabbed the towel hanging on the oven door to dry her hands. “Do you want me to bring pudding through?”
“Aye go on. Chocolate ice cream in the freezer.” Jen called back.

Agatha opened the freezer and routed through the drawers until she found the ice cream in question, then she grabbed some bowls and spoons and took them all back to the table. “Your freezer is a fucking nightmare.”
“You’re welcome to organise it for me.”
“You joke, but I actually will.”

They finished their meal and moved into the living room to finish out their night chatting about nothing in particular and finalising the plans for Christmas day. They traded who hosted each year like they did for their weekly dinners and this year was Lilia’s turn, so she told them to get there for around eleven so that they could help with the food.
They didn’t really do presents but they each still got something every year. They decided that, rather than committing to buying gifts, if they saw something that the others would like then they’d buy it and wrap it.
It removed the pressure of having to buy something.

When Agatha got home she went straight upstairs, fully intending on just collapsing on her bed. The exhaustion from the lack of sleep and her brain’s constant spinning had finally caught up to her. She did her nightly routine and pulled her pyjamas onto her body before crawling into her bed, the feeling of fresh, clean sheets giving her a sense of comfort.
She laid on her back with her eyes closed, willing a restful sleep to come to her.

__________

Agatha was breathing heavily, her lungs fighting to fill with enough air to sustain her. Her body was on fire and a thin layer of sweat was coating her skin.
“That’s it, you can give me one more. You’re so good for me.” A low voice came from above her.
She opened her eyes and was met with dark brown irises, black pupils so dilated that they nearly took up the whole space.

Rio leant down and nipped at the shell of her ear before whispering, “Come for me, Professor.” Her breath warm and soft against Agatha’s skin. The fingers that were inside her curled and right when she was about to fall over the edge, time stopped.
Agatha could still move, but Rio was frozen in that second.

A slow clapping came from the direction of Agatha’s bedroom door and she craned her neck to see what it was.
Leaning against the doorframe, with an evil smirk on her face, was Wanda. She pushed herself off of the doorframe and started slowly walking towards the bed where Agatha and Rio were, Rio still unmoving above her.

“She’s good, isn’t she?” Wanda asked.
Agatha tried to speak, to reply but she couldn’t. Her vocal chords seemed to no longer work and the only sounds she could manage were short breaths.
Wanda chuckled, low and dark. “Yeah, she’s left me speechless a few times as well. She definitely knows what she’s doing, no one can deny that.” Wanda stopped walking, now standing at the side of the bed.
She crouched down so that her face was level with Agatha’s. “Well go on, don’t stop on my account. She gave you an instruction, and we both know how you hate to be a disappointment.”

Wanda disappeared and time started moving again, Agatha’s orgasm pouring over her and her toes curled from the sensation.

Agatha woke up sweating. She threw her quilt to the side and sat up, trying to slow her breathing down.
What the fuck was that?

__________

Agatha spent the next few days fighting a losing battle with her thoughts. She tried to push her dream as far back in her mind as she possibly could, but how was a person meant to forget something like that?
Wanda hadn’t been present in her dreams since she dreamt of their wedding day just a few nights before she came home and saw her in bed with her ex husband. And now Agatha couldn’t even have a sex dream without her ruining it.

She had to force herself to go for a walk once a day just to make sure she wasn’t spending all of her time wallowing in her house.
She didn’t walk anywhere in particular, picking random streets to turn down and deciding at the last second whether she was going to turn left, right, or go straight on.
The cold December air helped her stay out of her head as it nipped at her nose and cheeks. There was no snow, but there were Christmas decorations everywhere. Lights strung from building to building, displays in shop windows, inflatables in front of people's homes.

She would nip into shops every so often just for a slight reprieve from the cold and look around for a few minutes before stepping back outside again.
She had tried to find something to give Billy but she was scared to actually buy something because she had no idea what he liked anymore. She didn’t want to give him something that he would have to fake his enjoyment of, only to return it or put it in a box somewhere and never look at it again.

She scanned the stalls at the Christmas Market a few times, picking up a necklace for Jen and a bracelet for Lilia, and treating herself to the street food that was on offer.

On Christmas Eve she still hadn’t managed to find anything for Billy so she decided the next best option would be to take him shopping and let him pick some things out that she would pay for. It was kind of a non-gift, a cop out, but she didn’t want to not get him anything at all. She had two Christmases and three birthdays to make up for and she was going to make sure that she did.

Agatha: Hey kid, hope you’re all set for tomorrow! I know it’s short notice but are you free on boxing day?

Billy: Mum’s fretting about the food as she always does but we’re good to go! Dad’s leaving after lunch on boxing day so I’m good for the afternoon?

Agatha smiled to herself. She remembered the way that Wanda would panic about whether she had cooked enough food, even though there were only four of them that she had to feed. Agatha would help her go through her list of the things she had to prepare on Christmas Eve and there would always be one thing that Wanda forgot to buy that Agatha would have to run out to grab before the supermarkets closed.

Agatha: 2pm sound good? I can pick you up

Billy: Yeah I can do 2. What’s the plan?

She hadn’t got that far yet, she had only focussed on whether he’d be free or not. But the afternoon would be for him so she was happy to let him lead the way.

Agatha: No idea, kid. We can figure that out as we go

Billy: Looking forward to it!

She felt a feeling of warmth pass over her as she read the message. Her and Billy weren’t back to the point that they left off from, but they were slowly getting there.
She tucked her legs underneath herself as she pressed play on Love Actually and settled into her couch.

__________

Agatha walked into Lilia’s house around twenty minutes late and beelined for the kitchen. “I can’t promise it’ll be tidy, but I’m here to help.”
Lilia was peeling carrots on one side of the kitchen and Jen was peeling potatoes on the other side. Lilia looked in Agatha’s direction. “Nice of you to finally join us. Take your Christmas lay in too seriously this year?” She handed Agatha the peeler she was using for the carrots and pushed her towards the counter.
Agatha got straight to work. “Something like that.”

The truth is that she was late because she’d had the dream about Rio and Wanda again and had spent way too long thinking about it.
“As long as she’s able to make her gravy, I don’t care how late she is.” Jen said as she started to cut the potatoes into chunks.
Agatha laughed. “Oh don’t worry, the gravy will happen.” She took one of the carrots that she had peeled and took a bite out of it. It was the one Christmas tradition that she had.

When her dad was alive, she would wander into the kitchen on Christmas day and ask if there was anything she could help him with. He would always pick her up and tell her that her only job that day was to have fun, and hand her a raw carrot to snack on before he put her down again.
Jen and Lilia had asked a few times why she did it but she just told them that she liked carrots.
She talked about her dad less than she talked about her mother and there was only one person that she had told that story to.
Wanda.

Agatha had given Billy a raw carrot while her and Wanda were prepping the food during their first Christmas together, and the four that followed, but it had taken until the third for her to explain why she did it. She was just happy that she was able to share the tradition with Billy.
She wondered if he still did it, she’d have to ask him tomorrow.

When they had gotten everything prepared and some of the things in the oven, they took a bottle of wine into the living room and filled their glasses.
“Merry Christmas, bitches.” Lilia said.
“Merry Christmas!” Agatha and Jen echoed.
“Another year survived.” Lilia continued, raising her glass.
They knocked their glasses together and Jen said, “We still have a week left until the year is over, let’s not be hasty.”
Agatha took a sip from her glass. “I have faith in us, we can last the week.”
Jen’s mouth dropped open and she slapped her hand on her chest. “Is that positivity I’m hearing from Agatha Harkness?”
“Shh, don’t draw attention to it, you’ll scare it away!” Lilia said in a stage whisper.
