Agatha rolled her eyes. “You’re both arseholes.” She said, wanting to be annoyed but feeling a smile tugging at her lips all the same.

Every so often, one of them would head into the kitchen to check on the meal until it was time to carve the turkey. They all pitched in to buy the food that they had on Christmas Day and got a decent sized turkey as a result. After they had eaten, they would portion out the remaining meat so that they all got some to keep and use as they wanted.
The dishes slowly started to populate the table and eventually they all sat in their seats, a fresh bottle on the table and the smell of the food filling the air.

For all the ways that Agatha could list as to why she hated Christmas, she did enjoy her meal with her friends.
They pulled crackers as they ate and all donned their paper crowns and, for the first time all week, Agatha’s mind was quiet. The shitty jokes that came with the crackers, the really cheap prizes that flew out when one was pulled, the laughter of her friends, Jen praising her gravy like she did every year. It all helped to push down the insecurities that had been a roiling storm within her for the past few days.

That was, until her phone buzzed next to her.

Rio: Merry Christmas

All of her thoughts suddenly became deafening.
Why was Rio texting her? They hadn’t spoken since Friday.
Had Rio just sent out a mass text to all the women she was sleeping with?
Did Rio even mean to text her or was it meant for someone else?
Why was a single text causing so many mixed feelings and emotions? She was a forty two year old woman allowing her head to be scrambled by someone twelve years her junior. What the fuck was wrong with her?

She clearly meant nothing to Rio if Rio was sleeping with multiple people at once.
Or did she?
What if she was the only person Rio had sent that message to?
If that was the case, then why?
Should she reply or was Rio just messing with her head and enjoying it?
Did she send that message knowing that it would make Agatha react this way?
It was just a plain message, was the one she sent to Wanda more?
Did they get each other gifts?
Did the-

“Is your phone going to explode if you stop staring at it?”
Agatha couldn’t even tell who had spoken, her head was just so loud.
“Agatha?”
Okay that was definitely Lilia.
Just look up and speak.
She tore her head away from her phone and it took her eyes a minute to focus. “Huh?”
Lilia nodded towards her phone. “Who texted you?”
“Oh, uh…” Just say a name. Any name. “Wanda.” Not that fucking name!
Jen furrowed her brows. “Wanda? Why the fuck is she texting you?”
Agatha put her phone face down on the table. “I have no fucking clue, that’s why it shook me.”
Lilia nodded. “Understandable. Just ignore her. Do you want more turkey?”
Agatha forced a smile. “Absolutely!”

She moved her phone further down the table so that she wouldn’t be tempted to pick it up again and stare at Rio’s text any more.
She tried to forget about it, to screw it up into a ball in her mind and throw it away, but she couldn’t.
It was just sitting there, mocking her, daring her to reply, begging her to think about it.

When they were taking the crockery back into the kitchen Agatha couldn’t resist any longer. She picked her phone back up and looked at the message again.
It hadn’t changed or magically disappeared. It was still there.
She hadn’t actually opened the app so Rio wouldn’t know that she had read it yet. She could swipe it away or she could do the mature thing and send a simple ‘Merry Christmas’ back. So that’s what she did.

She made a silent promise to herself that she wouldn’t think about it again until she was back at home. She wanted to enjoy the day as much as she could.

__________

Agatha woke up on boxing day still very much overthinking Rio’s message, but also excited for her afternoon with Billy.
She showered and got herself ready for the day, still no idea where she was going to take Billy but looking forward to it all the same.

She pulled up outside Wanda’s house, the house that she used to call her home, and texted Billy to let him know she was there.
She stared at the front door trying to remember the times when it felt welcoming but now, even with the heat blasting in her car, it made her feel cold.
It didn’t feel like the threshold to the home she shared with her family any more, it was a reminder of the last time she walked through it.
Billy’s face was so full of confusion as she wished him a happy birthday and promised that they’d talk soon before opening it and pulling her suitcase out with her.

She felt wetness on her cheeks and hastily wiped her tears away as the door opened and Billy stepped out, looking over his shoulder and saying something before he closed it behind him.
His smile was wide as he walked towards the car and opened the passenger door.
“Merry Christmas!” He said as he climbed into the car and wrapped his arms around her as much as he could given the awkward space.

Her own smile matched his as she hugged him back. “Merry Christmas, Kid. Did you have a good day yesterday?”
“Yeah it was good!” He said as he fastened his seatbelt across his body. “Lots of food, time with my dad and of course, the Mario Kart game.”
Agatha remembered the Christmas Mario Kart games with Wanda, Billy and Vision. There really ought to be a card made specifically to apologise for the things said during that game.

She checked her mirrors and pulled away from the curb. “Did you win?”
“Obviously. Mum lost.”
Agatha snorted. “Obviously.” Wanda was truly terrible at that game. Agatha cleared her throat. “Do you still have a raw carrot on Christmas Day?”
She saw him look at her out of the corner of her eye and smile softly. “Of course I do, you can’t break tradition. How was your day?”
She smiled. “Mine was good too. I spent the day with some friends.”
“I’m glad. Did you get any further with the plan for today?”
“Nope.” She said, popping the P. “But I did the maths and I have two Christmases and three birthdays to make up for, so I figured we’d head into town and you can pick out whatever you want.” She looked at him briefly before making sure her eyes were back on the road. “I know it isn’t the same as me wrapping things up for you, but hopefully it’s good enough.”
He sighed and dipped his head briefly before looking back up at her. “Agatha, you don’t have anything to make up to me.”
She smiled. “Thanks for saying that kid, but I want to.”

Billy put his hands together, his gloves muting the sound, and rubbed them. “So what's my budget for this? Ten k? Hundred k? A million?” He asked, voice rising slightly with each amount.
Agatha laughed. “Don’t push it you little shit, my credit limit isn’t that high.”
He laughed with her and started making a list of the shops he wanted to go to as Agatha drove them to the town centre.

She parked on one of the side streets to avoid having to pay for parking, and they walked into the centre together.
The first stop on Billy’s list was Waterstones, which Agatha could definitely get behind. She had to keep reminding herself that they were there for him and that this wasn’t her own personal shopping spree.
He kept making jokes about how much she was going to have to spend but he would still only pick the books that were on offer.

She was browsing the shelves, considering buying herself a treat when he walked up to her and held out a book.
She looked at it, it was called Blood of Hercules. “Sure kid, add it to your pile.”
“No, you don’t understand.” She quirked an eyebrow as he continued. “It’s called Blood of Hercules. But it’s set in Greece!” He handed it to her so she could read the blurb. “I mean how do editors keep letting this happen? Google is literally free.”

She couldn’t help but smile, she had taught him well. “You gonna write them a strongly worded email?”
“Might have to.” He grumbled as he struggled to keep a grip on the six books he was currently holding. “I think these will tide me over until my birthday.” He flashed her a cheeky grin and they put the Hercules book back before they went to pay.
Each book was under the buy one get one free offer so she actually only paid for three of the books and scanned her Waterstones card to get the points.

They went to Game next. His dad had gotten him a £100 gift card for Christmas so she told him to pick what he wanted and she would cover what the gift card didn’t.
He pulled two games from the shelves that she had never heard of and something called an amiibo. She had no fucking idea what it was but he wanted it, so she would buy it for him.

After that they went to a café and he insisted on paying for the drinks. “There’s also birthdays and Christmases that I’ve missed. I can’t take you on a shopping spree, but I can do this.” He said when she tried to stop him.
She couldn’t argue with that. For all the shit Wanda had done during and after their relationship, she couldn’t fault the way she had raised her son.

Billy returned to their table with two huge hot chocolates with a tall peak of whipped scream, chocolate dust and marshmallows sitting on top of them. “Jesus Billy, are you trying to give us diabetes?”
“I’ve seen the coffees Rio buys for you, don’t act like you're above this.”
She hadn't thought about Rio all afternoon, all of her focus had been on Billy since he got in her car, and she really wanted the rest of the day to follow suit.

“Don’t make me change your grade.” She said with mock seriousness.
“Oh shit. Uhh… You just work so hard, I thought you deserved a sweet treat?” He said with an innocent smile.
She narrowed her eyes. “Better.” She laughed.

Their last stop was a music shop. She suspected that there were more places that Billy wanted to go but he was probably conscious of not wanting to seem like he was taking advantage of her, and they were rapidly losing daylight.
The shop they went into was the one she had bought his first capo, pack of plectrums and guitar from, as well as packets of strings a few times whenever he needed them.

The guy behind the counter greeted Billy by name and they immediately started a conversation that Agatha didn’t understand in the slightest.
“How’s that Floyd Rose treating you?”
“I definitely didn’t take you seriously enough when you said they were a bitch to string.”
“Yeah, they’re not a beginner bridge, that’s for sure. I put one on my eight string. Sounds fantastic like, but the restringing? Awful.”
“You still a Fender hater?”
“Till the day I die, dude!”
“Weak. I’m gonna have a look around.”
Billy started walking towards the section with the acoustic guitars and the guy called after him, “Whatever the price tag says, I’ll knock fifty off it for you!”

Agatha followed Billy through the store, carrying his bags so that he could play the guitars if he wanted. She was completely in awe of all of the guitars on stands on the floor and hanging on the walls all the way up to the ceiling. They were organised by what Agatha assumed was the make of the guitar and there were certain sections that Billy stopped in front of.
He’d pick the guitar up and sit on a nearby stool, play a couple of different things and then put it back.
Agatha just watched him. It had been so long since she saw him do this, be somewhere where he was completely in his element.

After he put the fourth guitar back she asked, “Are you looking for a new one, or just window shopping?”
He picked up another and sat down with it. “I’ve been thinking of getting a second acoustic for a while, then I can have them in different tunings like I do my electrics. I’d love a Taylor,” he gestured to the guitar he was currently holding, “I just don’t have Taylor money yet.” He played some chords and riffs. “I’m not trying to get you to buy this for me, by the way. I know that would be taking the piss. I actually came in here because I need some new strings, but I can’t resist playing some of them.”
Agatha would absolutely buy the guitar for him if he asked, but this was one of those purchases that his mum needed consulting about – which she was not enthused by the idea of.

He stood up, putting the guitar back and started walking back in the direction of the counter.
Agatha looked at the guitar for a moment before following him.
He picked up four packs of strings and handed them to the guy who scoffed. “Surprised your Fender can handle strings this heavy.”
He scanned the barcodes and Agatha tapped her card on the machine as Billy replied. “I play it like it owes me money, so I need the heavy strings.”
The guy handed Agatha her receipt. “Thank you ma’am, enjoy your evening.” Then he turned to Billy again. “Tell Eddie I said he needs to educate you.”
“I definitely won’t be doing that.” Billy said as they started walking out of the store, throwing “Don’t work too hard!” over his shoulder for good measure.

They walked back to Agatha’s car as Billy was telling her why he preferred Taylors over Martins – whoever they were – and why the guy in the shop was wrong about Fenders. None of it made any sense to her but she was happy to listen to him for as long as he wanted to talk to her about it. It had been a while since she’d heard him talk about guitars and she welcomed it with open arms.

She dropped him off at Wanda’s house and he hugged her goodbye. “If I don’t see you before, happy new year.”
“You too kid.” She smiled at him and he smiled back.
“I’m really glad we’re able to spend time together again, Agatha.”
“Me too, Billy. Me too.” She ruffled his hair. “Now go back in before your mum thinks you’ve been kidnapped.”
He laughed and gathered his bags before getting out of the car and heading for the house.
Agatha stayed until she saw him safely inside before driving back home.

Chapter End Notes

Having to write Agatha as not knowing anything about guitars was low-key killing me jsyk
I am also a Fender hater, but Billy would absolutely play a Fender

Chapter 25: Rio &amp; Agatha

Chapter Notes

We're back with another long dual POV chapter lads
I don't think I'm capable of writing anything under 8k words at this point

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was around four A.M when Rio finally made it back to her apartment in Cambridge. She left all of her bags by the door, barely remembering to lock it behind her before she dragged herself into the shower. No matter how tired travelling made her, she simply couldn’t go to bed without washing the plane feeling off of herself.
She had purposefully made sure that she got little sleep the night before to make sure that she could just crash as soon as she got back.
She crawled into bed and dropped her head onto the pillows, closing her eyes and falling asleep within minutes.

Her sleep was dreamless, if a little shorter than she hoped it would be, but it was restful. She woke up around midday, her body clock fully thrown off as she had just gotten used to being back on eastern standard time and was now thrown back into British standard time. She got out of bed and went into her bathroom to brush her teeth and wash her face before grabbing her bags from where she had left them and unpacking them.
She hadn’t taken a huge amount of stuff back home with her as she still had clothes and other bits there, but it was enough to make the task annoying.

When she had finished unpacking she checked her plants. It wasn’t that she didn’t trust Billy and Alice with the job she’d given them, she just wanted to make sure. They had sent her various pictures over the month of them diligently going to her flat every week to check the water levels and the health of the leaves and flowers. Alice had even sent Rio a video of her reading out the instructions to Billy as he moved from plant to plant.

The semester properly started in under two days and she’d had no communication from Agatha about what that meant for their meetings. There were no essays to mark and this semester Agatha would be lecturing about ancient Rome, so not exactly Rio’s wheelhouse.
There was enough crossover between the Greeks and the Romans that she could cobble something together if Agatha asked her to give some more lectures, but it wouldn’t be as easy as the past couple had been.

None of that mattered though if Agatha didn’t let her know what was going on.
The past two weeks had been the exam weeks so she had probably been busy with that and holding drop-in sessions for students who wanted some extra tuition before they had to take the exams.
Rio had given Billy and Alice help where she could and checked in with them after they sat each exam. The three of them, Eddie and Ash were all going out for drinks that night to celebrate the end of exam week and Rio’s return, but Rio wasn’t sure how long she’d stay out for. She’d just play it by ear.

She had probably given Billy and Alice more help with their revision than she should have, but if it massaged her overall grade average a bit then she could live with it.

She had everything prepped and ready to go for Monday morning – well the whole semester actually. All of her lecture outlines were written and she had already finalised the essay questions for the first and second years – the questions for the final years always took her a bit of extra time because she wanted to challenge them, actually make them put some effort in.
After she had unloaded the dishwasher she took herself upstairs and changed into her pyjamas, settling into bed with her book to close out the night.

Rio walked into the pub, her friends already sitting around a table and went straight to the bar. When she had gotten her pint she went to join them and they were mid conversation.

Alice nodded in agreement. “There’s a guy in our building from Manchester who’s been wearing shorts all week. Northerners are built different.”

Their responses all came at once, overlapping.
“The worst.”
“An abomination.”
“It’s the worst thing I’ve ever tasted!”
“It’s a crime against tea!”
Rio held her hands up – she had not expected such a heated response. The British really take their tea seriously. “I’m so sorry I asked. I think I’ll just stay out of the tea debate from now on.”
Billy hummed. “I think that’s wise. You might get injured one of these days.”

The five of them stayed there for a couple of hours chatting and catching up before Rio could feel her energy starting to wane. She said her goodbyes and walked home – her beer blanket wasn’t anywhere thick enough for the temperature so her teeth chattered the whole way.
She was glad when she got back into the warmth of her flat and got changed as quickly as she could so that she could burrito herself in her duvet.

One minute had actually been fifteen, and the loud noise that woke her up was her back up alarm.

She groaned and turned it off before forcing herself to leave the warmth of her bed. She shuffled into her bathroom to get ready for the day, putting some concealer on the dark circles under her eyes in an attempt to dull them a little bit. It didn’t really work but it would have to do.

She swung by the café and picked up a large black coffee, stirring six sugars into it in the hopes that it would wake her up even a little bit. Agatha definitely wouldn’t approve of her dozing off in the middle of a lecture.

“Damn, you look like shit.” Billy said when he saw her.
“Thanks asshole.” Rio lightly punched him on the arm. “I’m calling it jet lag chic.”

“Can I get a show of hands for who’s heard of Julius Caesar?”
Everyone's hands were raised, she would have been worried if there were any outliers for that question. Anyone who knows facts about Julius Caesar can shout them out and I’ll add them to the slide.” She drew a few text boxes to type into.

There were a few seconds of silence before someone near the back called out, “He was assassinated."
She nodded and typed it into one of the boxes.
“Everyone thinks he was an emperor but he was only a dictator.”
“He was stabbed twenty three times."
“He was betrayed.”
She hurriedly typed out all of the things her students were saying, the facts coming faster now that the first few had spoken up.
A few minutes later the slide was filled and she moved on to start the lecture proper, giving an overview of who Julius Caesar was, his position in the government and ending the lecture with his assassination.

That's all it was.

It meant nothing.
It was just sex, Rio!

She threw herself backwards onto the bed again, bouncing a little from the impact.

Chapter 26: Rio

Chapter Notes

:)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

It was usually instant but maybe she was just tired and it would hit her in the morning.
She was still battling jet lag and her brain would probably catch up at some point.

Was she jealous of Wanda?

The information that she and Agatha had given each other had been given freely because both of them wanted to give it.
It had been a mutual exchange.

They had built a foundation before sex had been broached and that was the problem.
Agatha wasn’t just another body, she was someone that Rio knew.
She was someone that Rio had taken the time to get to know, and that complicated things.

Rio sighed and rubbed her eyes. Her body was begging for sleep but her mind was running a mile a minute and she couldn’t get it to stop.
This was why she didn’t sleep with people that she knew.
This was why it was easier to pick a random girl up.
This was why it was easier to keep a one night stand as just that.
One night.

She rolled over and grabbed her phone. She opened the youtube app and typed the name of the page she wanted into the search bar. She navigated the playlists until she found the one that was six video essays that did a deep dive into the lore of Lost. She hit play on the first video and put her phone back on her nightstand, turning her back to it in the hopes that the soft talking would lull her to sleep.

__________

Rio woke the next morning groggy and slightly sore. She groaned at the ache in her muscles as she rolled over, but she took some comfort in the knowledge that waking up like this meant that she had actually managed to get to sleep.
She picked up her phone that was still playing the videos she’d started. It was around half way through the last video which meant she’d managed nearly eight hours of sleep.

She had no idea how it had happened but she sure as hell wasn’t going to question it. She checked the time: 9:02 A.M. And then opened Whatsapp to check the message that was sitting there.

Alice: Are you coming to the lecture today?

There were two hours until the lecture started so there was no reason that she couldn’t make it. She could get there in time for the lecture to start or she could get to campus early and go to the library. The third option was that she could go to the music room and play the kit until it drowned out the noise in her head.
That option sounded the best.

Rio: Yeah, just woken up but I’ll meet you guys there!

She got herself out of bed and ready for the day and set off towards campus.
The cold bite of the January air spurred her on to walk faster so that she would be in the warmth of the music room quicker.
When she got there she threw her coat and bag on the sofa and immediately sat at the kit.
She changed the playlist she was listening to to one that had songs she was learning on it and wasted no time getting started.

Her muscles protested.
She dropped beats, messed up kick patterns and did some embarrassingly sloppy fills, but it was better that she got all of those mistakes out now before the full band met later that day to jam.

It took a few songs but soon she was back in full swing and absentmindedly kept reaching with her left foot for the double pedal that wasn’t there. She’d have to buy her own if she wanted to fully embrace the core-kid that still lived within her.

She played until the alarm she had set blared through her airpods making her jump.
She was sweaty, breathless and her body ached more than when she had started. But through playing she was able to rewrite the reason for it and make her brain associate it with something other than Agatha Harkness.

She threw her coat back on and slung her bag over her shoulder and made her way to the ancient history building.
She cursed herself for not having the forethought to either bring or buy a drink, so she went via the café to pick up a black coffee before making her way to the lecture hall properly.

When she got there, students were still filing into the room so she joined them and made her way up the seating bank to join Billy and Alice in the seat they had saved for her.

Their eyes met and the corners of Agatha’s mouth lifted slightly.

Rio gave her a short nod and fished her laptop out of her bag.
Billy nudged her side. “I hope you’re as good with the ancient Romans as you are with the Greeks. I already need to borrow your notes.”
Rio snorted. “It’s the third day, how do you already need help?”
“Why would I do the work when I know a massive nerd who can do it for me?” He asked with a cheeky grin.

She gave him a light flick to the forehead. “Oh you’re gonna make me do your homework? What next, you gonna bully me for my lunch money too?”
“I didn’t know your lunch money was on the table, but we can negotiate.” His eyes flicked down and his grin faltered slightly as his eyebrows dipped. “Either you didn’t realise that you have a ridiculous hickey, or you’re wearing it like a badge of honour. And I’m not sure which is worse.”

She was teaching about Roman plumbing and how it greatly influenced the modern plumbing that we’re all used to today, but Rio found that she couldn’t concentrate on the lecture for very long.

She’d done that.

She was the reason Agatha was finding walking more difficult than it should be right now.

If she used a bigger strap.
If she didn’t stop until Agatha was a useless, crying mess beneath her – or on top of her.

Rio: Looks like you're having some trouble walking. Need me to give you a rub down? Get you nice and relaxed? I’m very good with my hands

But the movement of Agatha’s eyebrows was enough for Rio.

“Billy, Rio. I hope whatever is happening up there is life or death, because you better not be disrupting my lecture for anything less than that.”
Rio cleared her throat as Billy glared at her. It was a glare that said “this is your fault!”
“Sorry Professor, it won't happen again.”
Agatha just hummed and went back to teaching.
Rio didn't move again after that.

She said under her breath. Whether Agatha heard it or not Rio wasn't sure because she didn't react. She just picked her bag up and hung it off her shoulder.

Rio let out a short, sharp laugh. “Ha! I knew you couldn't keep your hands off me.”
Agatha opened the door. “Shut the fuck up before I change my mind.” She tried to sound annoyed but her smirk gave her away.

“I have band practice tonight, so I'll let you know when we're done.” Rio said as she walked past her and left the room, casting one last glance over her shoulder so that she could shoot a wink at Agatha before fully leaving.

She tried her best to be fully present, forcing her brain to focus on the lectures she was attending and the conversation with Billy and Alice. And for the most part she managed it. But when they were walking to a lecture towards the end of the day, Agatha was walking in the opposite direction.

She was walking with determination as always, her head held high and a coffee in her hand. She made no move to acknowledge the little group save for the quickest flick of her eyes towards Rio and then she walked past them.
Alice and Billy continued talking but Rio no longer heard them. They faded into the background and instead she heard soft sighs, a moan of her name, rapid breathing and a whining voice begging her to not stop.

Rio’s private bubble of throughs was burst when she felt a dull thud against her shoulder and a mutter of, “Jesus, watch where you’re going.”
The student she had just collided with was looking at her like she’d just kicked their puppy and she rushed out an apology as she caught back up with her friends.

She made her excuses with Alice and Billy and peeled off towards Wanda’s office.

Wanda was standing behind her desk, organising the various things that sat atop it but she stopped when Rio closed the door behind her.
“Hello.”
“Hey.”

Rio shook her head. “I didn’t just want to talk about us.”

“Billy hasn’t said anything, but that response has given me more questions.” Rio calmly replied.
Wanda nodded and ran her hand through her hair. “What do you want to know?”
Everything. Rio wanted to know everything.

“So she and Billy know each other?”

His favourite person was just gone with no explanation. It tore him up.”

Rio rolled her eyes.

Rio: I saw you singing along to Pink Pony Club, you can’t lie to me

Agatha: Does you replying to me mean you’re on your way?

Rio stared at the message.

She should lie and say that she was tired since she’s had a few late nights recently – even if she was texting the reason for said late nights and every fibre of her being was telling her to go.

This was fine. Falling into bed with the same person three nights in a row was fine.
Seeing that person every time she closed her eyes was fine.

__________

She turned her head to look at what Agatha was offering to her.
It was a cigarette and a lighter. Something that had become customary when their time together for the night came to an end.

“I’ll see you tomorrow.” Agatha repeated. “Let me know when you’re home.”
Since Rio had first made that request at the start of the week, it had been something they’d kept up.

She hovered for a moment, hesitating just a little before she closed the gap and kissed Agatha’s lips.

The whole point of a casual hook up was that there was no planning, no forward thinking. Just seeing if the other was available when you were horny and using each other's bodies to alleviate that need.
But with Agatha it felt different. It was different.
But that was okay.
She could handle different.

She opened the front door and sparked the cigarette, placing the lighter down on the small table by the entrance before stepping outside and closing the door behind her.
She smoked half of it before ordering her taxi, letting the soft burn at the back of her throat ground her.
She took the smoke back into her lungs and felt them expand with each drag, smoking the cigarette until she could taste the burn of the filter.

She ashed it just as her Uber pulled up and she slipped into the back of the car, staring out of the window the whole ride home.

Chapter End Notes

:(

Highly recommend the youtube channel Lost Explained, those video essays are great background noise for going to sleep.

As always, twitter is @p4ravato if you wanna yell at me on there

Chapter 27: Agatha

Chapter Notes

A little yearning never hurt anybody... except Agatha

See the end of the chapter for more notes

If anyone had told Agatha Harkness a month ago that she would be having regular sex with the PhD student she was supervising, and subsequently had developed a slight crush on, she would have laughed in their face and had them committed.
And yet here she was, partaking in just that.

The last seven days had seen her spending a few hours each night entangled with Rio Vidal until one of them – more often Agatha – had to call it for the night and either walk away or watch the other walk away.

The decision to turn off her feelings and view this as nothing more than sex wasn't one that she took to easily.
She tried to put out a front as a hard, unfeeling, stoic woman who wasn't affected by anything or anyone. Someone who didn’t care what people thought or said. Someone who was damn good at her job and wouldn’t take shit from anybody. Someone whose flaws and broken parts couldn’t be seen, couldn’t be used against her, and couldn’t be twisted and manipulated.

But the truth, the hard, messy, almost unbearable truth of it was that she wanted to be seen. She wanted to be noticed and be able to lay herself out bare in front of someone and have them not walk away. Have them see exactly who she was and stick around. Have them accept her and love her for exactly who she is and not try to change her.

She wanted to be held by someone and have their touch smooth over her cracks and seal them back together, make her whole again.
She wanted to be able to have bad days and be short and snippy with someone and have them still there when she was done with her outbursts.
She wanted someone who wouldn’t run at the first sign of trouble and would face it head on with her.
She didn’t want someone who loved her despite her broken parts. She wanted someone who loved her because of them.

She wanted someone who would be there when she needed them and stay as long as she wanted them to stay.
She wanted someone who would fight to keep her even when every part of her was screaming at her to push them away, and she was making every effort to do so.
She wanted someone who could see through that to the Agatha underneath.

To the scared girl who had no idea why her mother hated her so much.
To the terrified teenager who had to become skilled with make up to hide the bruises on her body.
To the hard-lined adult who closed herself off to anything that could be perceived as a threat to her carefully manicured persona.
She wanted someone who cared enough to see that and accept it, welcome it.

But she didn’t want to be a burden.
She didn’t want to drag someone down into the horrifying depths of her mind and force them to live there with her. She didn’t want her darkness to dull someone else's shine.
She didn’t want someone's life to get worse because she was in it.
So she denied herself all of the things she desperately wanted and longed for, for fear of the things that she didn’t want.

She thought she had found the things she wanted in Wanda, and until she found her in their bed with her ex-husband, she thought that would be her forever.
For the first time in her life, she’d had a family. She’d had a family that she cared for and who cared for her in return.
She had often thought about what their life would have been like if she hadn't come home that day, if Wanda had gotten away with it and Agatha was none the wiser.

They would have gotten married and started their new life together, the Harkness-Maximoffs – they hadn’t actually settled on the double barrelled surname and it was most likely that they’d both just end up keeping their own names.

They might have bought a new house in a year or so, upscaled it since they were sharing the home office at their current house, and more space could never hurt.
Maybe they’d have gotten a house with a loft conversion so that Billy could have had a whole floor to himself.

Maybe they’d have gotten a pet. A cat, a dog, or even a rabbit. They could have had multiple.
They could have had a child. One that was made from both of them – Agatha’s egg and Wanda’s womb and a donor that they selected together.
Agatha had never been particularly maternal, but Billy had made her think about it more and more.

Of course Billy was twelve when Agatha came into his life and most of the work had already been done for her, but she still did her best to shape him and liked to think that part of the reason he was such an amazing young man now was because of her influence as well as his parents.

But those thoughts of the happy, blissfully ignorant marriage were overshadowed by the knowledge that she now had.
Would Wanda have continued to sleep with Vision even once they were married?
Would Agatha have eventually found out regardless?
Would it have hurt the same or more once they’d exchanged vows and promises in front of all of their friends and family?

Thankfully Agatha didn’t know the answers to those questions. She hadn’t had to live through that version of reality.
Now she lives in this version. The one where she did find out and didn’t go through with a marriage that was doomed.
The one where she very nearly ruined her relationship with Billy, but was slowly but surely rebuilding it bit by bit.
The one where she had her friends to help her through Herb's attempts to oust her from the university.
The one where she had Rio Vidal.

Well, she didn’t really have Rio. She had Rio’s attention for a few hours before she went off to do god knows what with god knows who. And ‘god knows who’ probably had red hair.
But as much as she had resigned to sex being the only way she could feel close to Rio, she still found herself wanting more.

She felt it fighting every time she locked eyes with Rio.
She felt it fighting every time Rio spoke to her in soothing words when she’d just come so hard that her vision had blurred.
She felt it fighting every time Rio called her baby.
She felt it fighting every time Rio moaned her name.
She felt it fighting.

But she couldn’t let it out, she couldn’t let it burst out of its protective casing and rush to the surface because then she’d be susceptible to hurt.
She’d be opening herself up to the pain of knowing that Rio’s heart didn’t want her the way that her hands did.

So she kept it locked away.
She played it Rio’s way.
She kept feelings out of it, but she couldn’t help wanting to spend more time with Rio. To just exist near her, clothed or not.

They weren’t looking at each other save for the times they let their gazes wonder and then immediately averted it.

“Hmm?”
Rio’s mouth opened and closed a couple of times but no sound came out until she breathed out. “I’ll see you in the morning.”
And with that, she left.

Agatha waited until Rio had pulled the door shut behind her before she moved to it.
Her intention had been to lock it but instead she leant forwards and rested her forehead against it, closing her eyes and counting her breaths.

Her chest hurt and her limbs felt numb. She could feel the prickling against her eyelids that meant tears were forming and would soon fall if she didn’t pull herself together.
What she didn’t know was that, on the other side of the door, Rio was doing the exact same thing.

__________

Agatha woke to her alarm reluctantly and with a groan.
She grumbled as she turned it off and threw her arm over her eyes in protest of her own self-imposed schedule.
She laid there for another few minutes before she forced herself to swing her legs over the edge of the bed and take herself to her bathroom.

She looked at herself in the mirror as she removed her pyjamas so that she could shower.
She saw the dark rings under her eyes, evidence of the many late nights she’d been having lately and the emotional turmoil each one sent her into.

She saw the marks on her neck and chest that Rio had made and added to since the start of the previous week.
She saw the fresh teeth marks at the top of her left breast and ran her fingers over it with a sigh.
She didn’t want to know what her back and legs looked like.

For someone who didn’t want to settle down, Rio sure did make an effort to leave as many marks as she could on Agatha’s body.
Staking her claim in a way that was akin to putting the American flag on the moon.

Agatha stood under the shower, letting the pressure and temperature of the water ease her aching muscles and clear her mind.
Once out of the shower she began the process of drying her hair. As thick and unruly as it was, she didn’t usually wash it when she had to be on campus before nine A.M, but she felt that it was needed that morning.
She needed to feel fully fresh for the day ahead.

Hair dried and clothes on, she set to work on covering the marks that were still visible.
There was sadness in the fact that she knew she could do this. The fact that she could be confident in her ability to hide them beneath foundation and concealer and know that it would last for the whole day with only minimal touch ups.
If she hadn’t had to learn how to do this from such a young age then she would definitely be panicking about someone seeing them.
Her mother was good for something, at least.

When she was satisfied with her work, she left the house and drove to campus.
She swung by the café first and as she was about to pay for her white coffee, she stopped.
The hand holding her card above the machine hesitated and she looked up at the barista.
“Actually, can you make the iced one I had before?”
The barista nodded and immediately spun around to start making it.
“Two of them, please.” Agatha added on.

She stood to the side and waited for the iced coffees to be made, but she didn’t tap her foot impatiently, she didn’t passive-aggressively check her watch or sigh in frustration. She just waited until they were ready whilst sipping on the warm white coffee she had yet to pay for.

When the coffees were presented to her in a cup holder, she tapped her card on the machine and set off towards her office.
She debated with herself on whether she should take the stairs or the lift and ultimately decided that she wasn’t ready for the lift yet and started up the stairs.

When she got into her office, she put the coffees on her desk and took her laptop out of her bag, and just as she sat at her desk there was a knock on the door.
She checked her watch: 8:47am.
This had to be Rio, it had better be Rio.
If it was any one else then her mood would be soured for the whole day.

“You may enter.”
The door was pushed open and Agatha caught herself holding her breath.
She quickly blew it out as Rio walked in.
“Morning, Professor.” Rio said with an easy smile.
Agatha returned the smile and inclined her head. “Morning, Miss Vidal.”

Rio walked further in and dropped her bag next to Agatha’s desk. “Where do you want me?”
In my home.
In my arms.
In my bed.

Agatha’s fingers twitched. She wanted so badly to reach out to Rio. To pull her into her lap and just hold her there, telling her what she wanted.
But she couldn’t do any of that, so instead she said, “You can take your usual chair, but if more than one student turns up then you’ll have to stand.”
Rio nodded once and turned to go to the chair.

Agatha wasn’t in control of what happened next. Not really.
She hadn’t made the conscious decision to stand up and grab Rio’s arm, but rather her brain and body were acting of their own accord.

Before she could fully process what she was doing, she had pulled Rio towards her and their lips were connected.

Rio squeaked in surprise but began kissing her back.
Their lips moved as one, like they were made to do this, they were made to fit together.
Agatha dropped Rio’s arm and put her arms around Rio’s shoulders, burying her fingers in the hair at the base of Rio’s skull.
Rio’s hands settled on Agatha’s hips and Agatha felt like that’s where she belonged.
She belonged in Rio’s hold.

Rio rested her forehead against Agatha’s and closed her eyes. “You didn’t tell me that office hours included that.”
Agatha could feel Rio’s breath on her lips as she spoke and she could see the smirk that was starting to take shape on Rio’s face.

Agatha nodded. “Apparently this barista didn’t get the memo that I wasn’t buying drinks for you anymore.” She lied. It was safer than admitting the truth.

“Well, thank god for that.” Rio said lightly as she pulled away completely to pick up her coffee and sit in her chair.
Agatha shivered, suddenly cold from not having Rio so close, and sat in her desk chair.
She opened her laptop and pulled up her emails, rolling her eyes at the amount of unread ones that were sitting in her inbox.

She started sifting through them, deleting and replying accordingly, until the blurriness of the screen became too much.

She huffed out a sigh and reached into her bag for her glasses case.
She took the black-framed glasses out and slipped them onto her face, her screen becoming crystal clear which meant that she now had no excuse to ignore the emails now that she could actually read them.

She could feel Rio’s eyes on her before she spoke, but she knew that if she looked up, she wouldn’t be able to carry on with this mundane task that unfortunately needed doing.
“That’s unfair.”
Agatha didn’t take her eyes off her laptop. “What’s unfair?”
She heard Rio take a sip of her drink before replying. “Wearing glasses when I have to be in a professional setting.”
She had to purse her lips to hide the smile that was threatening to show. She lifted a single eyebrow, still not looking in Rio’s direction. “Glasses turn you on?”
“You in glasses turns me on.”

Agatha looked up at that, she couldn’t help it.
Rio’s eyes were now darker, even with the distance between them Agatha could see how wide her pupils were. She watched Rio’s tongue run along her bottom lip and she had to concentrate on her breathing to keep it at a normal rhythm.
In through the nose and out through the mouth.
She repeated the mantra to herself as Rio continued to look at her.

She’d seen that look from Rio every night for the last seven nights in a row. She knew exactly what that look could lead to. She knew exactly what she wanted that look to lead to.
But they were on campus, in her office, waiting on students to make use of the office hours she offered.
She absolutely could not give into it.

“Well you’ll have to deal with it until later.” She looked back at her laptop. “Unless you’re sick of me.”
“Never.”

It was so soft that she wasn’t sure she’d actually heard it at first. It could have just as easily been the breeze, but her window was shut.
If it wasn’t for Rio’s soft gasp following the whispered promise she would have ignored it, called it a trick of her mind.
She looked over the rim of her glasses at Rio.
“I mean I-”
But Rio’s attempt at explaining it away was interrupted by a sharp knock at the door, making them both jump.
“You may enter.”

The next two hours didn’t exactly fly by, but with the slow trickle of students the time passed relatively painlessly.
Rio seemed to enjoy helping the final years with their dissertations, pointing them in the direction of some sources they hadn’t considered or even heard of.
She read through first drafts of essays and offered structure changes in a way that the students didn’t feel like they’d made a mistake.
Using phrases like “What I found worked for me…” or “One of my lecturers once told me…”

More than that, the students seemed more relaxed talking to Rio than they ever had talking to Agatha, and while Agatha knew that was by design, she couldn’t help but feel a little jealous of it.
She should be more approachable, she shouldn't be as curt or judgemental as she was, she should be nicer to these kids.

Between the visits from the students they talked, and Agatha made sure the flirting stayed to a minimum because if she didn’t, then she might not be able to resist giving into the temptation.

One of the knocks at her office door produced someone that Agatha wasn’t expecting to see. He hadn’t used her office hours before, so when Billy walked into the room she couldn’t help the look of surprise that fell on her face.
Billy had a similar look when he saw Rio.
“Oh, sorry, I didn’t know you were busy. I can come back.”
“No no, you can stay.” Agatha rushed out, which made Rio look at her. “Rio is actually helping me today. Take a  seat, Billy.”

Billy nodded, a little unsure, but took a seat anyway. “Oh, okay. Hi Rio.”
“Hi Billy. If you’re gonna bully me for my notes again, you’re gonna be disappointed.”
Agatha looked between them for a moment before focussing on Billy. “You copy Rio’s notes?” She asked. Probably with more of a parental tone than someone who only knew him as a student should.

Billy immediately shook his head. “No, no I don’t I-” He looked at Rio who was laughing to herself.
“You can both relax. Billy likes to joke about using my notes, which are non-existent. There’s no cheating going on, Ag- Professor.”
Agatha looked at Rio and lifted an eyebrow. “Your notes are non-existent? I sure hope you’re not using my lectures for anything other than to learn, Rio.”
Rio smirked. “What else would I be there for? You know how good my memory is. I could probably recite your lectures word for word.”
Agatha pursed her lips, once again to hide the smile that was tugging at the corners of her mouth. “I’ll have to test you on that.”

Billy was now looking between them like he was watching a tennis match, the earlier shock and fear now replaced with confusion as he listened to them bat the conversation back and forth between themselves.
He cleared his throat and interrupted Rio’s rebuttal. “I, um, actually had a question about the essay questions.”
Agatha and Rio, who had only been focussing on each other for the last minute, both turned their heads to look in Billy’s direction.

Agatha spoke first. “Yes, sorry Billy. What’s your question?”
He looked between them for a final time before looking at Agatha. “Um, the wording on the second one confused me a bit so I wanted to clarify it.”
He explained where his confusion was and Agatha explained the question more for him and gave him a different way to look at it.
She got the sense that that wasn’t why he’d gone to talk to her, but Rio being there had meant he’d had to improvise.

He thanked her for her help and turned back to Rio. “So are you a TA now?”
Rio glanced at Agatha quickly but kept her focus on Billy. “If I am, then I’m an unpaid one.” She looked more pointedly towards Agatha then.
Agatha rolled her eyes. “I think I repay you well enough.”
She heard the words once they left her mouth and she felt the immediate heat that rushed to her cheeks. Her breath felt like it had been stolen from her as she tried to think of a way to rephrase that.

Rio came to her rescue and raised her drink up. “Might have to start paying me in more than just coffee soon though, Professor. As nice as it is, I think my efforts are worth a bit more than a fiver a day.” She winked at Billy who smiled.
Billy thanked Agatha for her help once more before saying his goodbyes to them both and leaving the office.

There was a beat of silence before Rio filled it. “You’re nicer to him than you are to the others.”
It wasn’t an incorrect statement, but it still made her stiffen. “He’s less annoying than the others.”
Rio looked at her like she knew there was more to it, like she knew that Agatha and Billy had a history. But she couldn’t know that. Not unless Billy had told her… or Wanda.

Thankfully Rio didn’t press any further. Instead she checked the time and said, “Now, about my payment.”
Agatha took her glasses off, closed her eyes and pinched the bridge of her nose. “I’ll buy you two coffees if you shush.”
“Hmm, I don’t think two coffees will quite cover it.”
Agatha opened her eyes again, hearing Rio’s voice much closer than it had been previously.

Rio was now standing in front of her. Agatha hadn’t even heard her move.
Rio leaned down and put her hands on the back of Agatha’s chair, either side of her head, and spun the chair so that she was properly facing her. “So if I’m to assume that last week was my payment for marking the essays.” She placed one leg to the side of Agatha’s. “And for giving the lectures.” She placed the other leg at the other side. “What’s my payment for today?” She lowered herself down so that she was sitting in Agatha’s lap.

Rio tilted her head upwards at a diagonal and pursed her lips, seemingly thinking about it. She hummed, “What if I wanted an advance?”

She tilted her head back down and Agatha saw the same look in her eyes from before.
The look that said if Agatha didn’t stop this now, they would spend the rest of the day locked in this office and then Agatha would promptly be fired, because there was no way she could keep Rio quiet for that amount of time.

Rio started to lean in and it took every ounce of self control that Agatha had to put her hand up between them, pressing two fingers to Rio’s lips.
Rio stuck her bottom lip out and Agatha didn’t know how many “that doesn’t work on me”s she had left in her, because it really fucking did work on her.
It was working on her right now, but she stayed strong, kept her fingers where they were and stilled the hand that was still on Rio’s thigh.

“Rio, we’re on campus. You know we can’t.”
Rio pulled her lip back in and flicked her tongue out to lick the pads of Agatha’s fingers.
Agatha’s lips parted slightly and Rio opened her mouth to take the fingers past her lips and onto her tongue.
She closed her lips again and began to suck lightly on the two fingers that were now in her mouth.

It was different from their kiss from earlier.
While the first one had been slow, unhurried, a greeting. This one was messier, needier, heavier.
Agatha didn’t ask for permission before pushing her tongue past Rio’s lips, she just swept it into Rio’s mouth and against her tongue.

Rio whimpered and put her hands in Agatha’s hair, tugging lightly at the roots and scratching at her scalp.

Rio rolled her hips and Agatha felt her last smidgen of self control start to ebb away.

She had to stop this. She had to pull back, push Rio back, anything before she completely lost control.
She moved her dominant hand up until she felt Rio’s neck and squeezed, not enough to do anything but enough to let Rio know that Agatha was back in charge.
Rio gasped at the pressure and that was Agatha’s chance to pull away.

She snapped her head back and caught her breath. “You’re infuriating.”
“Have you met you?”
Rio’s eyes were wide, the brown of her irises now fully enveloped by the black of her pupils and Agatha didn’t need a mirror to know her own eyes looked the same.

She loosened her grip on Rio’s throat as Rio dropped one hand from her hair to gingerly touch the skin on Agatha’s neck. “How do you cover these up so well?”
“Practice.” Agatha replied simply. This was bordering on territory that she really didn’t want to walk through.
Rio lifted a brow. “Oh? Had a lot of women leaving marks on you?”
Agatha moved both of her hands back to Rio’s thighs. “Something like that.”
She started to push at Rio’s legs, shifting her own body as a way to get Rio to stand up.

Rio looked reluctant but stood anyway. “I suppose that can count as your deposit.” She picked her bag up and slung it across her body. “I’ll see you tonight."
Agatha furrowed her brow. “You’re not coming to the lecture?” She asked as she started to pack her laptop into her own bag.

“Are you sure you can handle being in a room with me for another two hours without jumping me?”
Agatha rolled her eyes. “You sat in my lap. You’re the one that initiated that.”
“And yet you were powerless to stop it.”
Agatha sighed and rolled her eyes again as she opened the door and let Rio out first.

__________

Rio did go to the lecture, but she behaved herself. She didn’t send any suggestive messages, she didn’t stretch or flex any muscles, she looked like she was diligently taking notes on her laptop. Notes that Agatha now assumed would be sent to Billy.

She wasn’t mad that Rio was helping him, she was glad of it actually.
She was glad that he had someone who could proofread his coursework and help him study for his exams.
She would happily do it if he asked. Hell, she’d probably write the damn essays for him if he asked her to.
But she knew that he was a smart kid and didn’t need her to do that.

When the lecture was over she asked Billy to stay back, eager to know why he’d gone to her office earlier.
She waited for the doors to close before she addressed him. “I don’t have long, but I know you didn’t come see me earlier to ask about the essay questions. What’s up, kid?” She asked as she stood in front of the desk and leant back against it.

He shuffled his feet for a moment, scuffing the toe of his shoe against the carpet. “My mum was asking me some weird questions about Rio.”
Agatha felt her heart pick up but she kept her face and tone neutral, controlled. “Oh?”

He looked down briefly before looking back up at her. “She was asking me if I’d told her about… Well, about you two. Your past.” He stuffed his hands into the pockets of his hoodie. “But I haven’t. Rio only found out that she was my mum because- by accident. So I was wondering if you knew anything about it.”

The door was pushed open and the first few students in Agatha’s next lecture started to walk in. She pushed herself off the desk, taking a more professional stance. “Come to my office at the end of the day and we can talk about it then. I’m back to back for the rest of the day so I won’t have time until then.”
He nodded and smiled, though it didn’t reach his eyes. “Okay.”

He left then and her mind was reeling.
Why had Wanda been questioning him about Rio?
What had Rio said to Wanda to make her think Billy had told her anything?
What, exactly, did Rio know?

She had to push all of this to the back of her mind so that she could get through the day, and while she was teaching she managed it. But in the few minutes she had between each lecture, it all came back to the forefront, buzzing around her head.
She needed to know what Wanda had said to Billy.
She needed to know what Rio had said to Wanda.
She just needed to know.

She pushed through the rest of the day and rushed to her office after her final lecture, Billy was already waiting outside for her.
She unlocked the door and let them both in, dropping her bag on the floor and sitting at the coffee table.
“Start at the beginning, Billy. What was your mum asking you?”

He sat in the chair opposite her and played with his fingers. “I went home at the weekend and she looked mad? Worried? I’m not sure. But she immediately asked me if I’d told Rio that you two were together. I said that I hadn’t but she didn’t believe me. She said it had to have been me because there’s no way you would have told her, but I promised her that I hadn’t said anything and I wasn’t lying. Like I said, Rio only found out that we were related by accident. I haven’t- I wouldn’t-” He sighed and looked down at his hands.

Agatha’s heart ached for him. He was still caught in the middle of this nearly three years on and he didn’t deserve it. Neither of them deserved it.
“I believe you, kid.” She said softly. “I know you wouldn’t tell anybody anything about it. It was just as horrible for you as it was for me, and it still is. I’m sorry that you’re still having to deal with this.”
He didn't look up at her again, but he nodded.

“Did your mum say why she thought you’d told Rio? Did she say what Rio had said to her to make her think that?”
He sighed. “She said Rio had gone to her office and asked about you. She said Rio claimed that you’d told her some things but that she wouldn't tell her exactly what you’d said. So that’s what made her think it was me, and Rio was saying it was you to protect me.” His voice had gotten quieter as he had spoken and it made Agatha’s heart feel like it was being squeezed.

Agatha fully believed that Billy hadn’t told Rio anything, and the things that she herself had told Rio were vague enough but it is possible that Rio put two and two together and got four.
Agatha had told her that she dated someone in the department and if Wanda had also mentioned something similar, it wouldn't be a huge leap to join the two together.

“Don’t worry about it, Billy. I’ll talk to your mum and, if needed, Rio. I’ll sort it all out. It’s not your problem, so don’t let it become one.”
He looked up at her then, his eyes shining with unshed tears and Agatha wanted nothing more than to just hold him like she used to.
He nodded. “Okay. Thank you, Agatha.”
She smiled and they both stood up.

She shouldered her bag and moved to the door, but before she could open it Billy appeared in front of her and wrapped his arms around her tightly.
Her breath caught in her throat and it took her a second to get her arms to work so that she could hug him back.
“I’m so glad you’re back in my life.” He said over her shoulder.
She tightened her arms around him. “Me too, kid. Me too.”

They pulled back and Agatha ruffled his hair affectionately before she started to look more closely at his roots. “You letting your natural colour grow back out?”
“Absolutely not.” He said, batting her hand away. “Alice is dyeing it tonight.”
She laughed as he put his hood up to hide his hair from her. “If you two want to come round for dinner again, just let me know. I can do any day except Saturdays.”
“Okay, I’ll ask her and text you.”

They left the office and went their separate ways. Billy towards the campus housing and Agatha towards her car.

Whilst walking she sent out two messages.

The first was to Rio:

Agatha: I’m just leaving now so I can come straight to yours

The second was to Wanda:

Agatha: End of day, tomorrow, your office. We need to talk.

Rio replied almost instantly, giving her okay.
Wanda’s reply didn’t come through until Agatha had pulled up outside Rio’s building.

Wanda: Looking forward to it, sweetheart

Agatha growled when she read it. Actually growled. The amount that she hated this woman could not be put into words in any known language.
She needed to talk to Wanda first and then talk to Rio if she felt it was needed.
But as of right now, she needed an outlet for the frustration Wanda was causing her. And her outlet was on the top floor of the building she was now approaching.

__________

The following day moved at a reasonable pace.
She gave her lectures, used her free time wisely, and ignored Rio’s attempts to rile her up.
The last one was the one that caused her the most grief.
Rio had worn another ridiculously tight shirt and she was either wearing the thinnest bra known to man underneath it, or no bra at all because Agatha could perfectly see the outline of her piercings against the shirt.

It took all of her strength of will to not call the lecture early and lock them in the room.
But she managed it somehow and was now walking with determination towards Wanda’s office, her heels clicking on the polished floor and echoing through the corridor slightly.

She didn’t bother knocking when she got to Wanda’s door, she just pushed it open and walked in like it was her name on the plaque, like she owned it.
Wanda was sitting at the coffee table in the centre of the room and didn’t look surprised by her lack of knocking.

“Agatha! What a pleasure.” Wanda gestured to the free seat. “Please, sit.”
Agatha clenched her teeth, but gave no other sign of her immediate annoyance.
She lowered herself into the chair and crossed her legs, settling her hands one on top of the other in her lap.
“What would you like to talk about?”

Agatha blew out a steady, controlled breath through her nostrils. It was important that she stayed calm throughout this. She couldn’t let her affection for Billy allow Wanda to get under her skin.
“Billy came to me yesterday. He was concerned about some questions you had for him at the weekend.” She kept her tone flat and her voice steady.

Wanda smiled. “It’s sweet that you’re worried about him, but he is no longer your concern.” Her voice was sickly sweet and Agatha ground her teeth.
She had to take another deep breath, in and out, through her nose. “As he is one of my students, he is under my duty of care. Therefore, he is my concern.”
Wanda’s smile widened. “If this conversation between one of your students and his mother,” she added emphasis to the word ‘mother’, “had happened on campus, then yes. However it did not.”

She had won this particular battle, but the outcome of the war still remained to be seen.

Rio had gone to Wanda and called her out on it.
Rio had gone to Wanda and spoken in favour of Agatha.
Rio had done that of her own accord, she’d done it because she’d wanted to do it.
