“But it might be Herb’s business if he knew you were spending your free time with a student.”
Was it hypocritical? Massively.
Did Agatha care? Not one single bit.

Wanda’s gaze grew sharp, but she was yet to look away from Agatha’s eyes. “Rio and I are both adults.”
“So is Billy. Would you be okay with it if it was him who was sleeping with a senior lecturer?”

Wanda breathed out harshly. “That’s different. Billy is still a teenager.”
“And Rio is still a student.”
Wanda practically threw herself out of her chair.
Bingo.

“We are not here to discuss the ethics of me sleeping with a PhD student!” Agatha raised her eyebrows but said nothing as she watched Wanda flounder to try and correct herself. “Which I am not. And even if I was, there wouldn't be anything wrong with it since she is thirty and I’m not her supervisor!”

Wanda’s breathing was heavier after her little tirade.
It greatly amused Agatha how easily she could make Wanda snap. A few accusations rooted in truth and the woman was telling on herself.
Agatha didn’t flinch at all through Wanda’s shouting. She remained cool, calm and collected. “What are we here to discuss then, Wanda? How you continue to mistreat your son because you refuse to accept responsibility for something you did?”
Wanda had begun pacing but she wheeled round to face Agatha at this. “No. We’re here to discuss how none of this would be happening if you,” she jabbed her finger in Agatha’s direction, “could just leave the past in the past and move the fuck on from something that happened three damn years ago!”

Agatha smiled and shook her head. Wanda truly could not let herself be anything other than a victim.
 “Apologise then.” Agatha said plainly.
Wanda screwed her face up. “What?”
Agatha stood slowly. This was just going to move in circles so she wasn’t going to entertain it any longer. “Apologise for what you did three damn years ago.”

Wanda looked around the room briefly as if she were looking for her imaginary audience. “I have.” She spat, folding her arms across her chest.
“No, Wanda. No you haven’t.” Agatha sighed as she took a step towards the door. “I told Rio about our colleagues taking your side. Not Billy. Me. I didn’t mention your name but if she’s seen or heard enough to put it together then that’s a conclusion she’s drawn herself. I didn’t tell her anything that wasn’t true and if you can’t apologise to me, at least apologise to Billy. He’s just a kid. He’s your kid. Do better.”

Agatha opened the door and didn’t look back as she closed it behind her.
When she got in her car she closed her eyes and leant back against the headrest.
She wished that she could take Billy away from Wanda, she wished that she could make sure he never had to worry about anything again.

When she got home she poured herself a healthy glass of wine and saw it off in a few gulps.
She refilled the glass and took it and the bottle upstairs to the spare bathroom where she turned the taps on to fill the tub.
She still had a few hours before Rio would be letting her know that she was on her way so she indulged in a bubble bath.

The aim of the bath wasn’t to get clean since she knew that she’d be working up a sweat when Rio arrived anyway, it was to relax herself so that she could focus on only Rio.
Focus on the woman who had worked out who her shitty ex was and had taken it upon herself to confront said ex with little to no information.
Focus on the woman who had defended her to the Dean and to Wanda.
Focus on the woman who she now wholeheartedly believed was no longer sleeping with Wanda Maximoff.

__________

Having spent the majority of the week having to cover the bruises and marks that the collar of her shirt couldn’t hide, Agatha was happy that it was a Saturday and she could just wear her turtleneck again.
Since it was Jen’s turn to host and Jen lived closer to the side of Cambridge that Rio did, Agatha told Rio that she would go see her after she’d had her time with her friends rather than before.

For the first half an hour of being at Jen’s, it was normal conversation. Work, life, the usual topics.
But then Jen just had to ask: “Why are you wearing turtlenecks all of a sudden?”
“And your glasses?” Lilia tacked on.
Agatha batted away Jen’s attempts to pull at the collar of her jumper. “It’s winter. Can’t I want to be warm? Am I also not allowed to see?”

She shuffled her chair away from Jen so that she wasn’t within touching distance anymore.
She was wearing her glasses because, well, she needed them. But it was also because she discovered just how wild they drove Rio, and what’s life without a little fun?
But she obviously was not going to tell Lilia and Jen that.

“I don’t think I’ve ever seen you in a turtleneck before last week.” Jen said around her mouthful of homemade cottage pie.
“I’ve worn turtlenecks before.” Agatha said, stabbing a roast parsnip onto her fork. “Maybe you’re just not that observant.”
Jen narrowed her eyes playfully. “Hmm, maybe not. But Lilia definitely is.” She pointed her fork in Lilia’s direction. “Care to weigh in?”

Agatha rolled her eyes as Lilia looked her up and down.
After a beat, Lilia said, “She’s worn them before.”
Agatha knew Lilia was helping her lie. She’d had this particular jumper for about six years at this point and it had never been worn until last week.
She didn’t like turtlenecks, they felt too restricting. Like someone had their hands around her throat, and not in the way that she liked.

Despite this, Agatha gestured to Lilia. “Thank you!” Then she pointed at Jen. “Maybe you need to borrow my glasses.”
Jen laughed. “Those jam jars? My eyesight is fine, thanks. Though it is nice to see your eyes properly now that you’re wearing them. Usually you squint like Randall from Monsters Inc.”

Lilia snorted across from Agatha and Agatha looked at them both, wholly offended.
“I do not look like the lizard from Monsters Inc!”
Jen was laughing harder, wiping an errant tear from her eye as Lilia said through her giggles, “Agatha, darling, yes you do.”
“Why the fuck do I continue to put up with the two of you?”
Jen reached for her hand. “Because you love us.”
Agatha pulled her hand away, which made Jen laugh more. “Debatable.

They got through the meal with more jabs at Agatha, Jen once again complaining about her students – and complaining when Lilia reduced her lab sessions down to ‘making potions’ – and Lilia saying that she had perfect students as always.

When they moved to the living room, Jen excused herself to go to the toilet and Lilia sat next to Agatha on the couch, which was strange.
She looked at Agatha for a moment but didn’t say anything.
“Can I help you?”
Lilia pointed to the neck of her jumper. “What are you hiding, Harkness?”
Agatha sighed but Lilia spoke again before she could. “And don’t say ‘nothing.’ I lied to Jen earlier to get her off your back, but we both know you’ve never worn a turtleneck a day in your life.”

Agatha should have known better than to think Lilia would drop it or tat she wouldn’t question her. “I’ve been… seeing someone.”
Lilia’s brows shot up. “And she likes to maul your neck?” She asked with a slight smirk.
“Basically, yes.”
Lilia pursed her lips and nodded. “And does she also happen to be a self-assured PhD student with a knack for getting on your nerves?”
Agatha didn’t answer, she just drank her wine and looked straight ahead.
Lilia hummed. “You can’t lie to me or hide from me, Agatha. You know this. I’ll get your confession.”

They heard Jen start to make her way back down the stairs so Lilia patted Agatha on the knee and stood from the sofa to take her place in the chair.
Lilia gave her one last look before Jen came back into the room with a fresh bottle of wine.

Having nothing to do at all on Sunday, Rio was there from mid-afternoon again.
They’d had a lot of sex over the past two weeks so they took this one slower, taking their time to get to know each other’s bodies better.
Agatha knew what got Rio off, but now she was learning what made her squirm, what made her beg, what made her so needy and desperate that she struggled to form words.
She learned where Rio’s ticklish spots were, what names she liked to be called, the right combination of degradation and praise to make her shudder.

They were laying on their sides facing each other and Rio’s hand was between Agatha’s thighs, easing her down from another orgasm.
Agatha reached down and grabbed Rio’s wrist, pulling it from between her legs and putting her fingers in her mouth.
Rio groaned as Agatha cleaned herself off of her fingers.

When Agatha was satisfied that she’d cleaned Rio’s fingers properly, she took them out of her mouth and put Rio’s hand on the bed between them. “I think I’m done for the night.” She said with a content smile.
“Oh good.” Rio breathed out. “I’m running on fumes.”
They both laughed, happy in their mutual agreement.

Agatha ran her fingers along the inside of Rio’s wrist and Rio hummed.
She moved them down to Rio’s palm and drew a few circles there before she started playing with her fingers.
She looked down at their hands and started to weave their fingers together, letting her thumb rest on top of Rio’s for a second before brushing it lightly across her skin.

She felt the mattress move as Rio shuffled on it, but she didn’t look up until she felt the fingers of Rio’s free hand resting under her chin.
She let Rio raise her head up and leaned in to meet her lips as Rio closed the distance.
Rio ran her tongue along Agatha’s bottom lip and Agatha parted her lips slightly to let Rio’s tongue press into her mouth.
The kiss didn’t get any deeper than that, but it lasted for what felt like hours.

Rio kept her hand under Agatha’s chin and their fingers stayed locked together as they kissed slowly, softly.
Agatha pulled Rio’s hand towards herself and put it on her hip and she mirrored it with her own hand on Rio’s hip.

She pulled Rio closer towards her so that their bodies were touching without breaking the kiss.
They stayed like that for a moment longer before they both desperately needed to breathe.
They pulled apart and Rio moved the hand that was under Agatha’s chin round to her cheek and she swiped her thumb across it.

Agatha leant into Rio’s hand, turning her head to kiss her palm before she looked back at Rio’s face.
She ran the backs of her fingers up and down Rio’s hip and she felt Rio’s breath ghost across her lips.
“This is usually where you hand me a cigarette and turf me out.” Rio said. It was light on the surface, but Agatha could swear there was hurt underneath it.
She gave a small smile, feeling a similar hurt in her chest. “We can sit by the window again for a bit.”
Rio nodded.

They slowly got off the bed and Rio got dressed, Agatha put her robe on and took the cigarettes and lighter to the window, cracking it open.
Rio joined her on the bench and sat close enough that their knees touched.
They smoked in silence, in each other’s company, but still in silence.
Rio toyed with the hem of Agatha’s robe, keeping her gaze down towards it except for when she was taking a drag.

A cigarette was once a thing that Agatha used to enjoy every once in a while.
When she’d had a long day. When she’d spent hours marking piles of coursework. When she just fancied one because fuck it, why not?
Then it became something she did after seeing Rio, a way to clear her mind.
The burn of the smoke at the back of her throat reminded her that it was real.

And now it was something they did together. One last way for her to spend time with Rio before she left.
A final five minutes where she could pretend that it didn’t have to end, that Rio wasn’t going to walk away.

They flicked the tab ends out of the window and Rio let Agatha’s robe slip free from her fingers.
She didn’t stand up immediately but Agatha knew that it was coming and her mind was screaming at her to not let it happen.
Before Rio made a move, she said. “Why don’t I drive you home?” It came out a little rushed and Rio’s brows raised almost imperceptibly, but Agatha noticed.

Her heart began to pound as she waited for Rio’s answer, but Rio didn’t make her wait long.
“Okay yeah. That- I’d like that.” She smiled and Agatha could tell that it was genuine which made her stomach twist.
Maybe Rio would stay if she asked her to.
Maybe Rio felt the same tightness in her chest every time she left.
Maybe Rio wanted this as much as Agatha did.

She didn’t voice any of those things. Instead she threw her robe over the chair at her dresser, pulled a pair of sweatpants over her legs and threw a hoodie over her head.
They went downstairs and Agatha slipped a pair of trainers on as Rio tied her Converse and picked her jacket up from where Agatha had pushed it from her shoulders hours earlier.

Agatha grabbed her keys and followed Rio out of the house, locking the door behind her.

They slipped into Agatha’s car and were silent as Agatha pulled away from the curb.
After a minute or two, Agatha broke the silence. “I wanted to ask you, how would you feel about working on your thesis in my office again?” She kept her head forwards, not daring to look at Rio as she waited for her answer.

She saw Rio turn her head towards her out of the corner of her eye but kept her eyes on the road.
“Yeah. Yeah I can do that. It’s more cosy than the library.”
Agatha turned to look at her then, having to keep her smile from taking over her entire face.
They chatted a little through the rest of the drive until Agatha pulled up outside Rio’s building.

Rio undid her seatbelt and shifted in her seat so that her body was facing Agatha as much as it could be. “Thanks for the lift.”
“No problem.”
They looked at each other for a moment, neither of them moving.
“Agatha?” Rio said in the same way she had on Monday night.
“Yeah?”
Rio opened and closed her mouth, the same way she had on Monday night, but this time when she stopped, she leant in and pressed a kiss to the corner of Agatha’s lips.

Agatha turned her head so that she could capture Rio’s lips properly.
After a moment Rio pulled away. “See you tomorrow.”
Rio got out of the car then and walked up the steps to the front door of her building.
Agatha waited until Rio had closed the door behind her, knowing that she was safely in the building before she threw her head back against her headrest.

She ran her hands down her face and looked up, willing the tears that had once again began to form in the corners of her eyes to stay where they were.
She waited until she was sure no tears would fall before she drove home.

Chapter End Notes

Maybe a little yearning hurts me too, actually

Chapter 28: Rio

Chapter Notes

This chapter and the 2 before it were partially inspired by the song You Up? by Beth McCarthy
10/10 recommend
Also the Spanish is all, unfortunately, google translate. So please let me know if anything needs changing!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Seventeen days.
That’s how many days in a row that Rio had spent naked with Agatha.
Seventeen days.
That’s how many days Rio had been trying to convince herself that it was just sex and nothing more.
Seventeen days.
That’s how many days that Rio had spent thinking about the no nonsense professor she had asked to be her supervisor.

For the last seventeen days Rio hadn’t found a way to stop herself from ending up at Agatha’s or Agatha ending up at hers.
The first time had been… accidental, the second time had been circumstantial, and the fifteen after that had been purely casual.

In the grand scheme of things, seventeen days really isn’t that many days.
It was just over half a month. Barely any time at all.
The moon took longer to finish her cycle than the amount of days that Rio had been sleeping with Agatha.

It was nothing. It was just a tiny blip of time in the thirty years that Rio had been walking the earth.
It was such a small chunk of days. Even the police spend more time training than Rio had spent with Agatha, though nobody could tell.
It was nothing.
So why did it feel so consequential?

Why did it feel like it meant more than just falling into bed with a convenient body?
Why did it feel like it meant more than smoking a cigarette together afterwards?
Why did it feel like it meant more than the glances, the meeting of eyes, the not-so-subtle ways they tried to be as close as possible whilst in Agatha’s office?

In the past few days Rio and Agatha had fallen somewhat into their old routine.
Rio would spend more time in Agatha’s office like she’d asked. They would talk or work in comfortable silence.
They were texting more when they weren’t physically in the same room.

Rio joined Agatha for her office hours on Tuesday morning again and she noticed a significant difference in the way Agatha spoke to her students.
She was softer, more forgiving, actually listened to the reasons as to why they were struggling instead of rolling her eyes and telling them to grow up.

Though the hardness returned when one student had arrogantly mentioned ChatGPT when Rio asked him about the sources he was using.
“If I get even the slightest inkling that you’ve brought that shambolic program to my desk, I will have you out of this university and blacklist you from every other faster than you can blink.”
The student stared at her wide-eyed for a moment before he turned to Rio to try to get her help.

Rio shook her head. “I might be more forgiving than Professor Harkness, but there is no way I am defending the use of AI. I suggest that you reconsider its use among the actual reputable sources that you’ve already listed, and come back to us when you’ve learned to think on your own.”
The student nodded, mumbled an apology, and left quickly.

When the door had closed, Agatha was muttering to herself under her breath.
“Absolutley fucking ridiculous. Imagine thinking you can mention ChatGPT to me and get away with it. The fucking gall some of these students have.”
Rio chuckled at the scowl Agatha was wearing and her heart gave a traitorous thump when her brain registered just how adorable she looked.

Rio had been trying her damn hardest to not notice all of the endearing things that Agatha did, but this one had slipped through the net.
She stood up and walked to Agatha at her desk. She put both of her hands on either side of Agatha’s still scowling face and kissed the frown lines between her brows.
“I think we scared the AI out of him, don’t worry.”

Agatha’s face softened again and she sighed softly, wrapping her hands gently around Rio’s wrists. “This job is gonna kill me, I swear.”
Rio’s body moved before she could stop it and she sat across Agatha’s lap, moving one hand to her hair and the other to rest against her sternum, feeling the steady beat of her heart. “I won’t let that happen.” She whispered.

Agatha wrapped her arms around Rio’s middle and pulled her a bit closer.
Rio felt the warmth of Agatha’s body pass into her own and settle within her chest.
She hummed contentedly and Agatha tightened her hold slightly.
She leant in and brushed her lips against Agatha’s, waiting for Agatha to protest. To remind her that they were on campus.

But the protestations never came, so she pressed their lips together again. It was still tentative because she was still expecting Agatha to push back, but she felt Agatha kissing her back. Their lips started to move together and Rio ran her tongue along Agatha’s bottom lip.
A question she had asked many times and she received the answer as Agatha parted her lips and slid her tongue into Rio’s mouth.

They stayed like that until a knock at the door startled them and Rio tore herself away from Agatha and practically flew back to her seat at the coffee table.
Agatha cleared her throat and ran her hands through her hair as if to remove the evidence of the grip Rio had just had on it before allowing the student to enter.

Later that night Rio had discovered something about Agatha.
She had let Agatha into her apartment whilst she was on the phone to her abuela.
Apparently Gabriela had broken up with Jason and now her abuela was trying to get all the information out of her.

“Sí. Sí, abuela. No, no sabía que iba a romper con él ahora.” No, I didn't know she was going to break up with him now.
She looked at Agatha and mouthed, “Sorry, one minute,” as her abuela continued to rant in her ear.
“Rio, ¿de verdad esperas que crea que no sabías nada de esto? ¡No me mientas!” Rio, you honestly expect me to believe that you knew nothing about this? Don't lie to me!

Rio sighed and pinched the bridge of her nose. “Bueno, bueno. Mencionó en Navidad que lo estaba pensando, pero yo…” Okay, okay. She mentioned at Christmas that she was thinking about it, but I-
“¿Así que lo sabías? ¿Y me lo ocultaste?” So you did know? And you kept this from me?

Agatha had casually leant back against the door and was watching Rio pace around her living room.
“No era mi responsabilidad compartir la noticia, abuela. Tenía que venir de Gabriela. Y era su decisión.” It wasn't my news to share. It needed to come from Gabriela. And it was her decision to make.
“Río, cariño, sé que te contó más de lo que nos contó a nosotros.” Rio, darling, I know she told you more than she's told us.

Rio paused the path she was wearing into her living room floor and looked at Agatha again.
Her lips were slightly parted and there was a crimson tinge to her cheeks. Her eyes were on Rio and they were dark.
“Abuela, te avisará cuando esté lista. ¿Podemos hablar de esto mañana? Estoy un poco ocupada ahora mismo.” She'll tell you when she's ready. Can we talk about this tomorrow? I'm kinda busy right now.
She heard her abuela sigh down the phone but barely registered what she’d said because the look Agatha was giving her was making her brain short circuit.
She said a quick “Te amo abuela” before she cut the line and threw her phone on her sofa.

She stepped towards Agatha. “Sorry, family drama.”
Agatha pushed herself off the door and stepped forwards to meet Rio. “I had no idea family drama could sound so… sexy.” She put her hands on Rio’s waist.
Rio draped her arms over Agatha’s shoulders and tilted her head. “Did me arguing with my abuela turn you on?”
Agatha’s grip on her waist tightened. “Less the words and more the language they were spoken in.”

Rio leaned forwards and put her mouth next to Agatha’s ear, whispering, “¿Ah, sí? ¿Mi lengua materna te afecta de esa manera?” Oh? My mother tongue has this effect on you?
She pulled back and saw that Agatha’s irises had fully disappeared, taken over by the black of her pupils. “That means-”
“I don’t care.”
Agatha closed the distance and crashed their lips together.

Seventeen days they had been doing this. It had started as just sex but it had progressed beyond that and Rio was trying desperately to push it down.
She was supposed to be emotionally unavailable. A womaniser who just enjoyed sex and didn’t care about which woman it was with as long as it scratched the itch.

She should have been out flirting with other women, keeping Agatha at arms length. Seeing her sporadically, seeing other women in the days she wasn’t with Agatha.
She shouldn’t have been with the same woman for seventeen days in a row.
But she didn’t want to be with anyone else.
And that fact terrified her.

She ignored it. She told herself that it was purely because she’d only seen Agatha, and if she saw someone else then that feeling would go away.
But when Agatha messaged her and asked her if she was still going round that evening, she couldn’t say no.

She was about to book her Uber and pull her shoes on when she got a text from Billy.

Billy: What do you know about buying weed?

Rio: I know it’s illegal in this country. Why?

Billy: Eddie isn’t feeling great so he asked me to meet the guy but I’ve never done it before

Rio sighed and checked the time. She hadn't given Agatha an ETA so she could sort this first and then head there afterwards.

Rio: I’ll come meet you, tell me where you’re meeting your guy

Billy: I’m meeting him round the back of the off licence opposite my block in about 20 mins


She got her shoes on and walked in his direction, pushing herself to walk as fast as she could to get to him.

When she was about five minutes away from where he said he would be, she got another message from him.

Billy: Are you nearly here? A car just pulled up and 3 guys got out

Shit.

She broke into a jog and covered the final distance, rounding the corner into the back alley that was behind the off-licence.
She spotted Billy and the three guys that were now crowding him, all with their hoods up, all slightly taller than him.
She saw one of them push Billy backwards and his back hit the wall with some force so she picked up the pace.

“Hey!” She shouted, making all three of them turn in her direction as she reached them.
Two of them stepped around Billy to now be in front of her, one of them turned back to Billy. “What the fuck is this? You tell your mummy on us?” He grabbed Billy by the front of his shirt and everything that happened next was a whirlwind.

Rio threw her arm out and punched the guy to her right in the stomach before delivering a swift kick between the guy on her lefts legs.
They both doubled over with a groan and she pushed through them to grab the third guy's arm. “Let him go!” She screamed as she tried to pry him away from Billy.

The guy looked at her and said, “Fuck off, lady,” before kicking his leg out and hitting her in the shin. “This is nothing to do with you.”
She stumbled backwards, pain now shooting up her leg.

Once she’d taken a second to grit her teeth through the pain she tried to get the third guy away from Billy again. She grabbed the collar of his hoodie as he swung his fist towards Billy.
There was a horrible crack as she felt two pairs of hands grabbing at her from behind and throwing her into the wall, her left side connecting with the rough brick.

“Motherfucker!” The guy who had been holding Billy yelled.
Billy must have ducked out of the way just in time because the guy's knuckles were now scraped and bleeding from where he had punched the wall instead of Billy’s face.
The guy growled and cradled his hand. “Fucking get rid of her!” He shouted to the two others.

She threw her arm out and punched the guy closest to her square in the nose and sent him reeling backwards, cupping his hands around his face.
“Billy! Run!”
She didn’t give herself time to register the pain in her hand as she swung for the other guy.
But as she did she felt a blinding pain in the right side of her face.

Her ears were ringing and all she could see was a blinding white light.
She felt herself get grabbed again and then felt the grip on her leave.
She heard shouts and someone falling around her, only just breaking through the high pitched noise that was still in her ears.
Then she felt herself get grabbed again. A hand wrapping around her arm and she felt herself being pulled.

Her vision slowly came back to her and whoever was dragging her was sprinting so she moved to keep up with them.
It took a second but she realised that it was Billy that was pulling her along.
The ringing in her ears faded as they made it back to the campus housing and Billy pulled her to one of the picnic benches that was tucked around the side of one of the blocks.

“Holy fuck. I don’t- how did- are you okay?”
Billy’s eyes were wide as he helped her sit down.
“I’m fine.”
“Shit, Rio. Your eye!”
She pushed his hand away as he tried to touch her face, the pain still too much to fathom someone touching it. “Don’t. I’m fine. Are you okay?”
He nodded quickly. “Yeah I’m good, they didn’t hit me. You stopped them.”
His breathing was erratic and her head felt like it was going to explode.

“Let’s get inside.” She said, trying to keep her voice even.
He nodded again and helped her stand and lead them towards one of the buildings.
They took the lift up a few floors and then Billy led her to a door that he knocked on in quick bursts.

The door flew open.
“Jesus chris- what the fuck?” Eddie looked at them with the same wide-eyed stare that Billy had given her outside.
Billy took her into the room and sat her on Eddie’s bed before he launched into an explanation.

“I was waiting for the guy and then a car pulled up and three guys got out. They said that I wasn’t you, they said they didn’t like being lied to. And then they crowded me and shoved me and that’s when Rio turned up and fought them and tried to get them off me. She stopped one of them from hitting me and then they shoved her too and one of them punched her. I managed to get off the wall but they were on her then so I kicked one of them in the back of the knee and he fell into one of the others and then I grabbed her and we ran.”

He had barely taken a breath as he was talking and tears had started to fall down his cheeks.
Eddie pulled him into a hug and rubbed his back as he sobbed into his chest.
Eddie turned his head so that he could look at Rio. “Fuck, Rio. Your face-”
“I’m fine.” She snapped. Entirely done with this night.
“No Rio, you’re bleeding.”

She raised her hand to her right eye where the pain had now focussed, and tentatively touched the area. She let out a hiss at the sting and pulled her fingers away.
Sure enough they were red.
“Shit. Where’s your bathroom?”
He pointed her to his en-suite and she went in, taking a second before looking in the mirror.

Her right eye was so bloodshot that it looked angry, the white of her eye nearly fully turned red.
There was a slight discolouration around her eye, the beginnings of a bruise yet to fully bloom on her skin.
And a cut that was curving around the outside of her eye.

It was about two inches long and blood was already dropping onto her cheek. Another lot started to collect at the bottom of it, forming a droplet that was about to fall.
She grabbed some toilet paper and pressed it against the cut, clenching her teeth and breathing through the agony that pressing on it caused.

Billy had stopped crying and was resting his head on Eddie’s shoulder while Eddie had his arms wrapped around him.
They both looked at her and Billy sat up.

“Are you okay?” Billy asked, his voice wavering.
“It’s nothing I can’t handle.” She said, not quite meeting either of their gazes.
“You should go to the hospital, get that looked at.” Eddie said, gesturing to her face.

He’d said that the guys had mentioned that Billy wasn’t Eddie and that they didn’t like being lied to.
In his text he’d said that Eddie wasn’t feeling well so he’d sent Billy to pick up.

This should have been a routine exchange, one that Eddie had undoubtedly done with these guys many times.

But this time he’d sent Billy and that had set the guys on edge.
They’d been expecting the person that they did this deal with regularly, in that very spot, and when they saw someone different, they’d panicked.

She wasn’t making excuses for these guys by any means, but she could see how it had gotten so out of hand so quickly.
